description:
Very nice customer service. Congenial staff. Great tables for coffee and laptop work. 

But if you are a Chai connoisseur then this is a place to check out and get your Chai "on"! 

So many choices and delicious and fresh tasting. 

WORK and CHAI!
author: Mitch J.

description:
Went here with my family to grab coffee after having brunch next door at Mymy which was also an amazing brunch place. I ordered a regular coffee because I was a little nervous to go outside of my comfort zone when it comes to coffee. I explained all this to the guy who was at the front counter and he was super nice about everything and answering all my basic coffee question.  For my coffee being a regular one, it was so good. It tasted very smooth and now I want to go back and try everything else on their menu! 

They had succulents all across the long table in their coffee shop and a really cool art wall behind it. It's very cozy inside and not too loud so people can even come here and easily get some work done if they needed too! Will definitely be coming back!
author: Sophia K.

description:
First time coming in with high expectation because every time I passed by Contaband it was packed with people. 

I ordered a pirates spicy green chai which is a very ordinary green latte.  The milk foam was cold and it took up to 1/4 of the cup which it not as worth it for a latte like this. 

There were two small tables and the rest are high chairs. It is not a preferred place to work because the seats make me very uncomfortable.  

The staffs are friendly here. Maybe I will give a second try next time.
author: Shuyi L.

description: Great versatility and quality. They listen to music I enjoy and the staff are really awesome, genuine,  real people who understand customer service. The food is delicious and the cafe is clean. Local art changes. I recommend this coffee shop to all!
author: Amber A.

description:
They have free WiFi!! I literally couldn't find free WiFi anywhere else in the surrounding blocks. Thanks for coming in clutch friends. 

The man that took my order was really nice! Super informative on all the pastries and coffee. I got an iced latte which was good but it came in a rocks glass, like the little glasses used for cocktails. For the price I was blown away that it didn't come in a pint glass. 

The little snack I got was a black bean empanada, filled with good spices and had a really great crust! 

There is seating outside, which I opted for. Inside was filled with tall counter/tall table seating and your girl is little! Be careful sitting out there, it is SF the weather will change and you might not be able to sneak back inside! 

The WiFi was really fast, and it was a packed house!
author: Nicole K.

description:
A coffee shop that actually open late in this part of SF as we where planning to go to Philz, but it was closed around 6pm. 

Got myself a latte, the other two got some double shot of something and a mocha latte. It was good, but it wasn't great. The coffee could be a little more hot. 

Overall, decent place that you can hang out since most of the mainstream coffee shop was closed around 5-6pm.
author: Owie N.

description: This my place to get tea. I am into tea recently and I am stubborn about my coffee so I didn't gamble ordering the coffee. It's a relax atmosphere to enjoy a good book to read.
author: Juan V.

description:
Good coffee, but nothing special. I did really like their black tea chai latte though. Had hints of ginger and spices peaking through which was very satisfying. Place itself is not too big but it's packed with people on their laptops so it's not too easy to get seated. 

It's in a cool area with plenty of things to do, so it's not a bad idea to come here and relax for a bit.
author: Mati K.

description:
VEGAN OPTIONS - Yes. Soy or Almond milk.  

I ordered the sage rosemary cappuccino with almond milk. The consistency of texture on the drink was just ok. Not the best, but certainly not the worst considering it was made with almond milk. 

However the sage rosemary syrup is very potent, and there was way too much in my drink. This made the whole cappuccino taste bitter and unbalanced, since it completely overwhelmed the coffee flavour, and honestly isn't a great pairing. I've had these kinds of herbaceous additions at other coffee spots that were done much better, and provided a subtle enhancement as opposed to a palette blaster like this was. 

Also, the service left a bit to be desired. Overall not impressed and I would not return in the future.
author: Nina K.

description: I was not a fan of the coffee, it's a real kick in the butt. No syrups or flavors available! I got a small latte. There is a lot of seating and space but I don't recommend to work or study here as the background music is loud.
author: Apple S.

description:
I am so lucky to live by contraband aka the best coffee shop in SF! 

Pop by for a cup of drip,  chai, iced tea, tea, or fancy coffee for you fancy coffee lovers. I love coming here for the afternoon and people watch & work. 

Beautiful natural lighting, ample seats (inside and out). Come hang out, grab a drink, chat with friends, whatever you like.
author: Dana Z.

description:
Caught up with a friend here and ended up getting two lattes since we ended up chatting for an hour and a half! The baristas were friendly and happily answered any questions about their coffee and any recommendations they had. I got the pirate chai matcha latte and rosemary sage latte, both of which I have not seen on many coffee shop menus. I cannot rave enough about the pirate latte. The flavors popped and made me wish I had ordered the larger size. In fact, after my friend had a sip of my drink, she couldn't resist but to order it herself as well. The rosemary sage latte had more of a subdued taste, but was well made nonetheless and I'm glad I tried it.

Granted, I've only been here once since I don't live in the area, but it seems like a great location for chatting with friends or setting up your laptop and doing work. I appreciated that you did not need a password to connect to the wifi. It's not incredibly spacious, so you may not secure a spot at busy hours, but definitely felt very relaxed here.
author: Mary T.

description:
I love coffee. And, I love good coffee. Contraband serves good coffee. However... there are a couple reasons why this place does not deserve anything higher than three stars. 

1) Service. Twice I've walked out because, although I am the only person waiting in line, the barista has not even acknowledged my presence. 

2) Price. Yes, we're in San Francisco and *everything* is expensive, but a $1.50 for a serving of almond milk is ridiculous. An entire bottle costs $3.25... at WHOLE FOODS. C'mon. Add that to the $4.50 for the cheapest coffee and you've spent $6.00. Yikes. 

I live in the area and avoid Contraband if I can--in spite of it's very convenient location.
author: Alisa G.

description: My favorite coffee shop in SF and source of beans. Great customer service and knowledgeable staff.
author: Jay R.

description:
I've been here a few times now but since it's a bit further away from my apartment, I don't go as often. Definitely a nice space (bright, airy) and lots of seating. 

Coffee is great and they have interesting specialty drinks like the spicy matcha chai latte, golden chai latte and Rosemary and sage latte. It's the kind of place where they make coffee in fancy beakers...

Toeing the line between cool and pretentious but still friendly and warm neighborhood coffee shop. One star off because it's $$$ and the matcha chai mix has sugar in it (can't request sugar free).
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Decent coffee, especially the rosemary sage latte, but the ambiance leaves much to be desired. 

I've worked from here quite a bit, and the service and music has been hit or miss, leaning towards miss most of the time, but tolerable for the most part. But today, the music was some awful, off-tune noise by a lousy vocalist. It was as if they wanted us to clear out, the music was so horrendous. Even with my headphones on, having it playing in the background set my teeth on edge, and the amount of people working here with their ears plugged really is a testament of how bad it got. Of my multiple visits, I can say that 3/5 times, the barista has been rude or indifferent. Despite the decent internet, I'm not sure if I'll visit again, even if I do have to get some work done.
author: Patricia L.

description:
Solid coffee with a great vibe earlier in the morning. And for earliness, I did mean it as they open at 630 in the morning, which was completely my thing!

Ran into this neighborhood during my daily exercise and had a cup of latte, very balanced and loved the texture too (smooth as silk to be precise lol).

I wish I could come back or even live in this neighborhood so that I could grab a cup everyday!
author: Elaine H.

description:
Awesome trendy vibe. Awesome delicious coffee. Great mocha. Also the potato curry pastry was off the chains. 

I firmly believe that there is no limit of quality coffee shops in sf. These guys reaffirmed that I can have a great experience working or meeting a friend here as well. Love finding new fun places and will definitely be back soon!

The mocha was super tasty. Not too sweet, and still delicious.
author: Michael S.

description:
I found this place on Yelp while waiting in line for Swan Oyster Depot! 
Cute little coffee bar with friendly staff. Ordered the ice separtor drink and was somewhat underwhelmed. I think I prefer Blue Bottles New Orleans iced coffee!
author: Jane C.

description:
A quiet place, Contraband is where one might hear the sounds of fingers typing. This cafe is great for working, due to its tranquil atmosphere, except for the occasional weekend visitors who are chatting. Seating outside is comfortable for meetings. 

The baristas are friendly and knowledgeable, and the cafe offers a wide variety of coffee drinks, about which they will advise you. Not a coffee drinker, I opt for the Bhakti Chai, which is very good. They offer 3 different chai lattes, one of which is caffeine free. Use the OrderAhead app if you'd like.

I love their baked goods, from Neighbor Bakehouse (which will save you a trip to Dogpatch), Vive la Tarte and mochi muffins from Sam's Patisserie. Art on the walls changes often and is always interesting. Stop by when you're in the neighborhood!
author: Carol W.

description:
They had me at rosemary & sage lattes.
But I still ordered a pirates matcha latte.

Points for ingenuity...where else can you get a rosemary sage latte?  And my matcha latte was spicy, which was a welcome change from the standard.  But between the unsavory character hanging out front, the limited seating inside, the cold atmosphere...this location certainly didn't give me the warm fuzzies.

Then there's the wait.  I'm more than accustomed to waiting for my lattes & pour overs, but that's usually the result of there being a line in front of me, & having to wait a few minutes is completely warranted.  Waiting 15 minutes plus, however, when there was only one customer ahead of me is certainly not the norm.

Good spicy matcha, & solid coffee.  But this location won't be a destination when I'm in Russian or Nob Hill.  I much prefer their SOMA shop.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Morning brew. Hip vibe with environmentally friendly awareness.  Ready to seize the day now that I am fuelled by caffeine.
author: Audra E.

description:
Contraband is my favorite go to neighborhood coffee spot! I often enjoy working or just hanging out. The staff is super friendly and enjoys small conversations. Usually there's some cool art on display at times available for purchase. 

Pick between speciality drinks, drip, chemex, or pour over. I usually enjoy a fresh pour over or a pirates! 

They have a variety of different styles to accommodate any palate. 

Thanks for the great conversations and good times Contraband!
author: Nick F.

description:
I came in here to do some work and get caffeine. 

Based on other reviews, I decided to try the Pirates, with the matcha and chai. It was a great choice and I was very pleased with my cup. The chai spiced up the matcha nicely, yumm. 

From what I can tell, there's only about 3 outlets in the cafe amongst the long community table, counter tops, and tables. Be mindful of sharing outlets.
author: Brenda B.

description: Great coffee shop as usual in SF, they have free WiFi with no password and enough sitting area.
author: Jay G.

description: Coffee is ok I guess, nothing thrilling considering it takes a while to get. They have almond & organic whole milk to dress it up. Honey was available too, I may have overlooked the cinnamon but that's ok. I don't get it, 4 and a half bucks for a regular drip drink, what do I know?
author: Henry K.

description: A decent venue for a quality pour-over. The space is rustic and somewhat petite, but somehow it manages to jam in at least a couple of dozen laptop loiterers at small tables and at seats along the window. It would all be perfect for window watching if the barista hadn't sneezed all over the place while I was waiting for my brew, but otherwise it's a decent addition to this stretch of Polk.
author: Vincent L.

description: Nice local mix of people and true coffee drinks.  This is real coffee not some froo froo spice mango latte.
author: Hay S.

description: Favorite cafe in Nob Hill. The cortado is great, but I'll deviate for a green tea latte. This is my favorite place to take my laptop in to do work, as it's usually pretty easy to find an outlet. The music is on point, not too imposing, too.
author: Madeleine M.

description: Great atmosphere to study or think.  Love the music.  Service with a smile but no b.s.  Pour over coffee good, through espresso is excessively bitter.
author: Matt B.

description:
When I started working in this neighborhood a year and a half ago I was told I had to have Contraband coffee.  One of my co-workers asked for a cup of pour over.  So I went once and there was a line.  I ordered a pour over cup of coffee and while it was good, the guy serving it acted put out by my questions about the coffee.  With the wait to get the cup and attitude it was 2 strikes and you are out.  Cup was good, but did not blow me away.

So I went back today and got a cappuccino.  Slightly bitter, I added a teaspoon of brown sugar to take out the bitterness and it worked.  The service was excellent and the atmosphere was cool.  Average Joe type of guy need not go to this place, but if you are looking for more than a cup of Joe for Joe, then go.
author: Derald C.

description: It's ok. Not a lot of space, but in a convenient location I guess. There in free internet but not enough power. Also the coffee or tea might be little price.
author: Goli M.

description: Love coming to Contraband. Great coffee! I usually get a drip or a pirates chai. Both delicious and can't go wrong with either! Seems like it's always full of people, but always a seat. Outside seating is limited but snag one when the weather is nice!
author: Tianna N.

description:
And now, there are several (one less, CAW closed) options within a mile.



Still, by far, my favorite, and most regular cafe in my neighborhood. The drip, is excellent. The espresso is excellent when the Barista-on-deck is not pissed at something (you know exactly who you are, sir), the beans are damn good.

A really fucking excellent neighborhood cafe, even with, said surly-arsed Barista. I was raised in NYC tho, we can handle surly just fine and then some.
author: Max R.

description:
Thursday morning is when the beans are the freshest if you're buying some for home-brewing. This is a no-nonsense coffee bar with a super-cool mobil + ye ol' standard succulent planter In the middle of the table.

Sadly, the baristas here are nice and let you take your time in ordering. I like to get a for here mug when I'm not going anywhere.

If you like good coffee and a space that you can let your hair down in, come to contraband! Your friends will thank you for it and probably think you're pretty cool as well.
author: Andrew C.

description: I didn't appreciate the conversation I had when I tried to place my order. The guy who was taking care of the order was rude. Never tell a customer: "I didn't understand a word you said." Especially to a foreigner. Try: "could you please repeat one more time."
author: Jae S.

description:
First visit 3 stars (see below for update);
Really delicious rosemary and safe almond milk latte here but the service wasn't great.  The place is also pricey. $6 bucks for my drink was steep.  

The barista's replies to my questions made me feel dumb and when my beverage was ready, there was no announcement made.  The drink was just left on the counter.  The place wasn't packed when I came by so I'm. It sure why there was some moodiness in his part.  Basically, other Yelpers are correct here. Excellent coffee. It not-so-nice baristas. May come again for a to-go latte but definitely would rather go to Saint Frank because they're actually nice and have excellent coffee as well.
-----
Update 10/22/16
Came back again and wowowowowowow!!!

First, props to Nathan, the manager.  He reached out to me after my initial visit where I wasn't treated that well. During my visit, I fell in love with my rosemary sage latte but not with the service but Nathan convinced me to come back and give them another try, along with a couple free drinks.  He also told me they use high quality organic ingredients for their syrups which is why they're pricier.  Makes sense! I'm willing to pay for a delicious latte if it comes with a side of friendly barista :)

Anyway, I came back today and holy smokes! Sooo good! Service was MUCH better.  It was actually funny because I recognized the barista (Michael) who made my drink because he used to work at another coffee shop in the area (Reveille, which is also lovely); he was always super friendly to me there and once again was sweet and chatty here, too. We engaged in some banter and I found out he works here now instead of the other place.  His almond milk lattes were always great at Reveille and today's rosemary sage latte was nothing less of excellent.  Contraband, smart move snatching him up!  

Will return, even after my free drinks are used up.  Amazing!!!
author: Monica J.

description: This is a really great coffee bar to get some work done while drinking fresh brewed coffee and a pastry. The ambiance is contemporary with a minimalistic style. Wonderful place to relax and unwind after a stressful day from work.
author: Grace G.

description:
Finally, set off my unwinding trip in SF! The past few months felt dust in the wind. Nothing matters more than the very moment in front of you and the people who are willing to stay put and play a part. 

I opted for the most expensive kind of drip on the menu- Yemen Mocca Sanai. It's a medium dark roast with a slight burnt aftertaste. Decisive and yet with a balanced compromise.. like the sunshine reflected in morning mist, gently, spreading out to faraway places..
author: Delphi L.

description: I am from the Bay Area but left 8 years ago.  I came here to stay for 3 weeks, live in Nob Hill to give my 2 boys an experience.  We rented an apartment overlooking the water.  Needless to say we are very non pretentious people but we like the luxury.  I walked in there with my rugged sweat pants in the morning with my husband because we dont care what people think. I just want to have a good cup of coffee.  It is the most pretentious and that is fine but the rudeness is just not great.  I did not appreciate how people would judge you on how you look. I heard them say good bye to a couple of students but never said good bye neither had a good service for me and my husband.  To the owner...rich people do not have to show they are rich so pls do not judge..next time be fair to everyone...good luck in your business.
author: Charina Carrera B.

description: Great coffee, a bit too loud though. Wouldn't be a bad idea to have a dedicated coworking work table charged by the hour if that can help them lower the music volume a bit
author: Anthony A.

description:
I've had the pirates chai twice now and it's really starting to grow on me. Subtly sweet and I love the cream on top. Also such a pretty design they make out from the cream. The place in general is a nice place to hang out and do some work. They have plenty of seating and outlets too. 

Definitely coming back to try other items on the menu.
author: Annie H.

description:
Love this coffee place. I usually frequent the chains like Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, and Caribou, so I did not know what to expect coming in. The atmosphere was very calm; there were a lot of people working on their laptops or studying. The barista was a talkative, funny guy and he recommended I try the Mochi Muffin and the Pirates Chai. The muffin one of the best pastries I've ever had. It had a bitter-sweet fluffy texture on the outside and gelatinous, chewy mochi inside. Apparently, they're so popular there is a limit on the number each customer can purchase. The Pirates Chai was light, creamy and not too sweet. Absolutely perfect, and it had some neat latte art as well.

The muffin was $4 and the chai was $4.50 so it's around the same price as Starbucks, but at much better quality. I would highly recommend this place for the food or a nice atmosphere to get some work done.
author: Sylesh V.

description: the part where i'm standing in line and childish gambino "redbone" comes on and ffffn everyone starts bobbing humming whistling grizzooving to the song. and even though i'd already noticed i re-realize it's just me, 2.5 black people, and a ? dude... surrounded by "everyone else"... and someone starts stirring a spoon in a cup omfggg!!
author: Dan B.

description: I enjoyed my time here. Great place to read with lots of windows and natural light. The coffee was good and not too overpriced. I tried their guava and cheese cubano pastry and I with I had ordered 2. Being from Tampa where we have Cuban food everywhere, I had high standards for it. It passed with flying colors. I also love the fact that they are open later than usuals coffee shops; until 9 pm. I only wish that they had more outlets to charge phones and laptops
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Cute little neighborhood coffee shop.  Located on the corner with some outside tables that a perfect for a sunny day.  Inside there is a large communal table and some window seating.  The staff is super friendly and quick with your orders.  A great selection of quality espresso to really get your morning started.  A bit on the pricey side, but you are paying for the high quality ingredients.  
Love the 'no laptops' sign posted, this is a great spot to read a book or catch up with friends on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Ok if you're gonna have a stuck up coffee shop with terrible customer service you should probably have at least good or at the bare minimum decent coffee, this place has neither. Took one sip of my iced coffee before tossing it in the trash and getting another at a cafe down the street.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Pretty solid coffee place, I got the iced separator after seeing some good comments about it, but don't think it was particularly special or really worth the money (although I guess you get used to paying for really expensive drinks in SF).

Parking here is again, non-existent, but it's definitely a nice place to get something to drink and get some work done, along with some food from nearby places like Mr. Holmes Bakehouse or Hot Sauce and Panko.

Although I didn't have trouble finding seating, the place really wasn't that big, so I can see it getting full quickly, and although there were a few tables there were barely any outlets, so that's not the best :/
author: Andrew T.

description:
Good cold brew coffee in Nob Hill but don't make any pilgrimages to come here.

There's this strange trend sweeping through SF currently, where most cold brews sold at low key coffee shops in the city are incredibly sour - almost like drinking a sour beer but it's 10AM and you're not getting any drunker after having a cup.

Contraband doesn't cross the line with their cold brew with a much more balanced flavor profile. I would not come out of my way to come here, but if you're in the area and you're looking for some cold brew coffee this place is a good spot to stop at. Prices are pricey, as expected with SF, and the coffee shop is pretty cramped. There is space for 1-2 person groups, as their seating mostly comprises of a large communal table and 2 bartops to sit at. Outside there are a few tables for parties of 3-4, but when I was there they were all taken up by selfie-taking millennials. Oh young kids these days.

My only gripe is that there aren't that many plugs for your laptop: I think I saw only 1 for public use in the entire store, so that could be an issue. Bring a power strip?
author: Albert C.

description:
I needed a place to bum around for four hours as I wait for my sister to get off of work. This is a great small cafe that stay open very late. I had a spicy green tea latte and it had the right amount of chai spice to it. Besides the drink, I love the everything croissant I had. It was the best croissant I've ever had!! It was perfectly flaky and crispy. 
Besides the food and drink, the guy who took my order could be friendlier. He forgot to give me my crossiant despite shouting "put it in a plate." I was waiting for about 10 minutes until I realized he wasnt going to give it to me. The guy who made my drink was nice thought!
author: Grace Z.

description: We are visiting san fran and I am a huge coffee drinker. Was looking for a coffee place besides the normal Starbucks crap and stumbled on this place. Let me tell you this is by far the BEST latte I have vet had! Wow! Top notch guys wish you were in Florida.
author: Steve K.

description: This place and name looks and sounds more attractive than their coffee. First off, the interior was clean, there was ample outdoor seating, and the sole barista there was friendly/nice! I ordered a latte and thought it was only okay/wasn't worth the price. Their coffee is definitely on the pricier end.
author: Tabitha H.

description:
Order: pu er tea iced
-way too much ice
+nice spot to do work
-not convenient to get to by bart
author: Vivian C.

description: Never had a mochi muffin before and holy smokes, I was missing out. So delicious! Thank you Contraband for introducing me to these from Third Culture, yum! One of my pet peeves are coffee shops that don't offer nonfat milk, but this place thankfully does yayy. Super nice baristas to chat with + wifi + natural lighting + clean. This place is the perfect coffee stop for a quick pick-me-up or a longer work session.
author: Aradhana V.

description:
Since moving to Russian Hill, I've been on the lookout for a nice neighborhood coffee shop with people behind the counter who know their stuff without being too pretentious about it. Contraband definitely fits the bill for that. The barista there recommended the Ethiopia bean when I asked for something with a nice bold fruity taste with low acidity. Not only was he spot on with the rec, the bean was just as good as Four Barrel or Sightglass. I ended up getting a bag of it to brew at home and so far it's been great.

The interior was very nice, bright, and airy. Lots of table space and chairs along with a strong wifi connection.

Clientele primarily comprised of 20 and 30 somethings working from the coffee shop or chatting about life. It was refreshing to not be surrounded by, dare I say, pretentious hipsters rocking beards and suspenders.
author: Henry W.

description:
On more than a few occasions, I've slithered in here incognito: sunglasses, no make up, just a hoodie and my active wear ready to tackle my core40 class.

But I was missing something.

Caffeine.

BOOM.

Iced Americano, almond milk, classic syrup. With slightly creamy, full on bold coffee flavor that knocked my socks off. (Don't take my word for it, TRY IT!) 

I've had their chai latte on a few occasions. I usually prefer a spicier version and the Pirates Green tea chai lacks the spicy kick to it that was advertised on the menu. So a note to you chai purists: stick to the sweet version instead.

The liegl waffle is a delicious carb indulgence, but if you really want to go all out, grab the maple bacon donut from Dynamo. 

I don't feel guilty.  I go work it off at core40 afterwards.
author: Janice C.

description:
I've only had the espresso. Espresso's not consistent. I had an espresso shot. It was bitter and watery. I was kinda disappointed as I've had a latte before and it was good. Hence the 3 Stars. 

Maybe the espresso was bitter because of the bitter expression on the barista's face?? Who knows. I was served water in a dirty glass. No big. I asked the bitter barista for a new glass. She examined the glass to make sure I wasn't lying. She poured another glass and slammed it on the bar. And that was that!
author: CaliGirl X.

description: Quite simply, Contraband brews delicious coffee and lattes, so that's why I frequent this place. The pastries are good as well, but it's the coffee I crave the most. It's a tiny place, but I like to support local businesses when I have the opportunity.
author: Peter C.

description:
Food: Didn't get to try any, but the couple next to me was RAVING about the donuts

Drinks: Had an iced chai tea latte ($4) which was poured from concentrate, however it was pretty tasty.

Atmosphere: This is a great place to go if you're looking for a coffee shop to get some work done. They've got free Wi-Fi and lots of seating (there's a large table in the middle that seats about 10 people all around if you're having a group meeting). My favorite part about the coffee shop though is the fact that the front window panes let in so much natural light, that on a nice day the room is just flooded with sunlight and it almost feels like you're outside.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Smooth coffee and tasty almond milk lattes. The almond milk is not too sweet or too hot - just right.
author: Josh H.

description: If you like flavor, you need to try their Sage + Rosemary latte, it's delicious. People are friendly and service is just amazing
author: Zeidy O.

description: Great coffee shop! My fav sag-Rosemary latte yaaaaamvery quiet and clean place love it
author: Diana K.

description: Best matcha chai latte I've ever had. Good ambiance. I would definetely go here again.
author: Jikke V.

description:
Excellent mocha.

Relaxing vibe.

Sidewalk seating.

Pastries look good but I will try them next time.
author: Evan W.

description:
Brand new coffee bar in Soma, and competition for elite audio! This place serves their own roasted coffee, as patrons of their Nob Hill location would know. The inside is rightfully hipster simple, and the baristas are super nice. 

They just opened today and we popped in to take a look. In addition to espressos and coffees, they also have three kinds of chai, a big Five Mountains tea menu, and quite a few pastries. 

I haven't had Contraband before to be honest, but what I got was a nice, smooth espresso. The waffle with sugar crystals was good and crunchy, and while I shouldn't have that much sugar for breakfast I don't think I can resist it often ;)
author: Alice C.

description: I've read an article about places in SF where you can find matcha drinks and Contraband was mentioned. I ordered the Pirates Spicy Green Chai and it sure was spicy. It kept me warm and happy while I was waiting in line at Mr. Holmes Bakehouse down the street. They have other interesting drinks as well such as the Sage & Rosemary latte. If you're a coffee lover, then the place is worth checking out!
author: Helen H.

description: Went to buy a bag of coffee. I'll stick with Peets. I dont believe I got fresh beans
author: Hardy S.

description:
The choice to come here because the rating on Yelp is pretty high, abs it's closed by after shopping in Whole food. 
-parking: good luck on looking for the side street parking around this area. 
-service: the guy was lack of motivation, did not seems willing to serve, but was willing to chat with his coworker. So when I asked for suggestions about their drinks, he was not be able to give any. Well, he doesn't value his business I felt.
-drinks: good point first was its not that sweet, maybe I asked them to substitute the milk to either soy or almond milk, they didn't let me know what milk the put into my Chia latte either. Their drink was nothing special, Starbucks may way better. 
-environment: small printed menu on the table, there are seats around the shop, most people here for doing work on their laptops. 
That's it! Will not come back for pricey coffee drinks here.
author: Karmen S.

description: I got an iced pirates, which is a spicy chai flavored matcha latte. My bf and I love it! The only downside to this cafe is there is no A/C. It might be okay to have a short hangout here, but it's definitely not a place to read a book or study/work for hours.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Coffee was quality. They offer a chemex pour over and have a really good Kyoto style cold brew amount other things.

While I have no complaints about the quality of the coffee, they lack quality customer service. Staff was only semi-friendly and informative, but the clincher was the fact that they didn't have a full cup of the cold brew and charged us full price. Not the best way to win over customers. Go for the quality of coffee but have low expectations for service.
author: Darren Y.

description:
I keep going back to this beauty of a place - I'm addicted to their cappuccinos because they're so good. But cappuccinos aside, I've tried like everything on the menu and they never disappoint... There is something for every mood.

Firstly, they have the best iced coffee I have ever had - never been a big fan of iced coffee, but they are making a fan outta me. You gotta try it! 

Secondly, their cappuccinos, macchiatos and flat white are just out of this world. So perfect in flavors: smooth and delightful. I'm addictrd

Thirdly, they have some unique drinks like the 'iced separator' (a lightly sweetened iced coffee drink) and 'golden chai' (tumeric chai non caffeinated latte) that are just a treat! 

They are always busy but service is quick. You can normally find a place to sit indoors to get some work done or on their cute patio to chat and hang out with friends. This place is definitely a must visit cafe in nob hill.
author: Jenna M.

description:
Awesome neighborhood coffee shop!  The pour overs were spot on and the espresso delivered on taste and quality!  Service was great as well!

Thanks
author: Drew M.

description: Love this place. It's pretty close to my apartment. The ambiance is nice. I love their hot chocolate and needless to say their pistachio croissant is the best.
author: Sakshi V.

description:
Was excited about coming here knowing it's one of the main coffee shops in the city and wasn't disappointed..but it certainly did not live up to my expectations. 

I loved all the unique drinks (although it can be a little overwhelming. I kind of like the hipster coffee shops for sticking to tradish coffee not caramel whipped cream mocha frap blah blah). However, I did get the coconut cream something something that I thought would be really interesting tasting. However it literally tasted like iced coffee with coconut milk. But was $5.. Meh. 

The sage drink was  SOO good though!! Highly recommend this one. 

The drinks took soooooo long on a Sunday. Ordering was quick but then it took maybe 15-20 min for our drinks.
author: Aria S.

description:
Two words: Hawaiian Mochi.

Ok, so get that. For sure. Don't ask questions. I haven't, so I can't give details, but I can tell you it's absurdly edible and amazing. Ok, I do happen to know there is a special Mochi man too. Mochi man is he who concocts and delivers the Mochis. They are worth retrieving.

Enjoy your Mochi, cortados and cappuccinos, free wifi. Everything here is great.

Yay Contraband! It's definitely the best neighborhood spot.
author: Laura M.

description: Great spot to be productive (wifi + lots of outlets = a remote worker's dream), and enjoy a specialty coffee drink. Highly recommend the spiced mocha.
author: Sarah U.

description:
I decided to come here on a Saturday around 9:30 a.m. after trying to visit Mr. Holmes Bakehouse down the street and gave up after I saw that the line for cruffins was around the block. I was able to easily find metered street parking which cost $2/hr with a two hour limit. 

This coffee shop itself is not super remarkable, even though I did like that they had stool seating facing the outside window. Unfortunately, the shop appears to not be dusted regularly since I saw more dust than I should and crumbs on surfaces that need to be more regularly wiped down. With so many coffee shop options, it's important to make your shop appear spotless.

I ordered a 12oz mocha which came standard with two shots of espresso and latte art. It tasted okay, but I would of preferred there to be a stronger chocolate flavor. 

Overall, not bad, but I doubt I'll be going out of my way to come back.
author: Regina W.

description: Contraband has become my all time favorite coffee place! I typically go once a week in the afternoon and am in and out in less than 5 minutes. Consistent service and quality.
author: Joanna C.

description:
Visiting San Franscisco and was looking for a tasty coffee place. Originally was on the way to Saint Frank Coffee which has 373 reviews 4 1/2 stars. We started from the Embarcadero, took the Muni, then the cable car, then got dropped off at Polk St. and was walking towards Saint Frank but made a loop around as I saw that Contraband Coffee Bar have 4 stars with 592 reviews. 

After a long walk in the cold I was excited to try this place out. As we approached the register, we were not greeted and we felt like he was rushing us to place an order. It wasn't not even busy. Being my indecisive usual self, I asked questions about the drinks. He seemed impatient so I settled with a drink called Dark White (Flat white with a piece of chocolate on the bottom) and my boyfriend ordered a drink called ice separator. 

After I came out of the bathroom and saw my dark white drink, I was shocked. For a drink that cost $4.75 plus 75¢ for almond milk, the drink was the size of my fist and it was bitter and sour. I even added a piece of chocolate I brought and raw sugar. My bf's drink tasted gross also and it cost $6.50! We walked out and tossed our nasty drinks. 

I am thoroughly disappointed with this place, customer service-wise and the craft itself. If I could give zero star I would. So not worth the walk in the cold. Now I regret changing my mind and not going to Saint Frank Coffee.
author: MunMun S.

description: Cute coffee shop with a variety of pour overs/drips. I got the Guatemala, which was a nice medium roast but still a lot of body. My hubbs got the flat white -- delicious! Nice interior with plant decor in the middle of the table and some outside seating.
author: Sharon C.

description:
I was looking for a coffee shop near home and finally found a place that I may go to every time I am back in the city.

+ Coffee
So far, I've tried their Mocha and Latté. Good and smooth, nothing out of the ordinary. Can't go wrong, really. They also have a wide variety of different coffee beans you should probably try.

+ Ambiance & Service
I really like the simple and calm atmosphere of the place. It's the place to go to sit outside on the sidewalk, read a book while sipping a cup of joe. I don't think a good coffee shop has to be super modern or crowded and this is why Contraband is one of my favorites. I'm a fan of their very simplistic and lively vibe.
Oh and Free Wi-Fi if you need it!
author: Alex L.

description:
Beautiful and sanitary coffee shop.

The atmosphere is really relaxing.

The service is really personal most of the time and the coffee is great.
author: Trausti A.

description: Best Dirty Matcha Chai Latte I've ever had (thx Thomas) and the chocolate sesame Mochi muffins rock my world!
author: Jason L.

description: Stopped in to get our caffeine fix. Ordered the Sage & Rosemary Latte and shot of espresso. The latte was phenomenal!
author: Kristie A.

description: One of the best places for a pour over coffee in SF. Really interesting selection of coffee beans and great baristas. Wish I lived in the neighborhood to have easier access.
author: Wei Z.

description:
TL;DR - 5 stars for the drinks and wifi, minus stars for the better-than-thou service.

It was a rough morning and I needed a large latte (normally I'd get just a regular latte; quad shots ain't no joke!)

I'm prepared for the wait, and they finally call my name and I go up to grab my drink. There was about an inch of space from the top of my drink to the top of the cup. I hesitate because I know baristas know their stuff... but.... I ordered a large latte for a reason (gimme those 16 -not 12- sweet ounces of milk-y espresso goodness!) 

I ask the barista if I could just get a bit more steamed milk. She looks at me like I asked her to quote the theory of relativity or something. Finally, she rolls her eyes and starts steaming milk. Her coworker looks over and she sighs and says, "uh...... she wants more steamed milk." Then kinda gives me this dirty look. They proceed to both hipster roll their eyes (probably because I'm still in my pjs) and she grabs the drink out of my hands and intentionally fills the cup over the brim and throws the drink down. Thanks.

Honestly...
author: Crystal Z.

description: Ordered the iced separator; I don't really understand what the whole hype is about. It has too much going on, 2 of my friends also ordered it and agreed. Tossed it after two sips. NOT GOOD AT ALL. Also, it's completely overpriced.
author: Shela D.

description: The coffee here is very good, service is very bad.  The barrister was rude and the guy taking order was even worse.  Had two kids with us and they did not try to accommodate them at all.  This place is not for kids.
author: Jenny B.

description: Coffee was great and customer service was sweet. Outdoor patio was nice and offered plenty of seating inside.
author: Christina F.

description: Great service every time I pop in.  Try the croissants from the local bakery.  Not crowded, able to grab a table and work while staying properly caffeinated.
author: Taryn B.

description:
I came here with a friend on Sunday at noon. This place is really quite cramped. When they say it is a coffee "bar," they really mean that. Space here is very limited, so it is very much a grab and go coffee shop! Moreover, it isn't very clean.  People aren't too great at cleaning up after themselves here.

In terms of the coffee, my friend ordered the El Salvador and was very satisfied with his coffee. I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, since I'm a much bigger fan of coffee shops with seating areas and good ambience.
author: Catherine S.

description: Very good coffee,  but it's pretty pricey.  There are better places in the city to spend your seven bucks.  I personally prefer Fresh Brew a few blocks away.  Some of their cashiers can be rude too, especially the one getting his MBA at Stanford.
author: Aseem P.

description:
Nice coffee shop on nob hill with great ambiance and coffee. 
Perfect place to sip and sit outside to absorb the limited SF sunlight.
Inside was cozy with nice art work and displays.  
Got the green drink-pirates green chai.  It was spicy and smooth.  Great cup of chai tea in their ceramic mugs. 
They have ice coffee and special drinks like the iced separator with coconut water and spices. 

Definitely could see the difference in the way people dress in the neighborhood, nob hill is cool.
author: Linda T.

description:
Best coffee I've ever had. All the reviews decrying bad service are obviously used to, and expecting, Starbucks type employees, who are forced to cheerfully welcome all who step inside. 
The vibe here is very toned down, relaxed, and perfect for working or just having a relaxing drink. 
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting one or two of the mini waffle bites with your drink. They have a tiny sugar crystal baked inside and are absolute perfection.
author: Bianca H.

description: Good coffee, but ridiculously overpriced. It also takes; I spent 25 min waiting for my coffee. It seems that the place hires one hipster per coffee bean to polish it :)
author: Edik B.

description: Maybe the best coffee and pastries in town, but the vibe inside is borderline hostile. Tried to give it the benefit of a doubt, but after three separate visits over the past two weeks and the vibe was still there. The coffee is so good, but on the last visit they got my order wrong, recognized the mistake yet didn't refund me or apologize for the 75 cent difference. And this is after I tipped them 15% (which was like $2.50).
author: Connor M.

description: One man show in the morning which means you can't come here if you're in a rush. The Pirates Spicy Green Chai was full of spices with a slight creaminess. It's definitely more chai than matcha but I like the combo. The Cortado was sort of like a cappuccino--good, full flavor. They have pastries from other local establishments. It's also a good place to chill and look out the window.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Cute coffee shop in Nob Hill. I've stopped by twice, once for a (very strong) latte and empanada to-go, and the second time for an iced chai latte and empanada to get some work done.

I'm not a big coffee connoisseur but the coffee here didn't blow my mind. The chai was also very spicy and gingery (I'm not the biggest fan of ginger) so I wasn't a huge fan. It's also a little pricey for not a huge portion. 

The empanadas are tasty, although my 2nd one came out still a little cold in the middle from not being heated up enough. Not an ideal place to do work as even though there's free wi-fi, the power outlets are very sparse and the music is of the loud and headbanging variety, which is not the most conducive to focusing and getting stuff done.
author: Vivian L.

description: I know, I know, San Francisco is no place for kids. Still.  I went with my 10 year old, and there was literally nothing for him here to drink.  The place came highly recommended, but I was really underwhelmed.  Free wifi is great, but I didn't think the place was particularly cozy, comfy or cool.  I got an iced tea, which was fine.
author: Evan G.

description: This is an awesome, creamy Milano style cappuccino! Well done, Contraband Coffee Bar!!!
author: Grant G.

description: Bought a bag of beans, 12 oz for $17, and think that would qualify for a free cup of drip coffee, but no this wasn't the case.  The coffee is good (notice I didn't say excellent) but too pricey for my budget.
author: Susan D.

description:
They were opened on Thanksgiving which was nice but they were out of pastries for the most part and the sausage egg empanada that I ordered was not even memorable. I ate half and left the other half somewhere in whole foods while I was shopping. 

As for the coffee, I ordered the mocha latte and felt it was just mehh.. Nothing I was too impressed with or would go out of my way for. It was missing that extra something. I didn't really taste too much mocha and had to add a bit of sweetener to it and I'm someone who doesn't like my drinks too sweet (I will half the syrups on my my lattes at starbucks). 

Staff was nice and friendly though so kudos to them for working on Thanksgiving
author: Lindsay C.

description: I live really close by, but I don't come here too often due to the transformed nature of all cafés. However one time I brought an out of town friend here and we had a nice time chatting for hours. Recently while out in the middle of the day between errands, I recalled that pleasant afternoon and decided to stop in again. The small space was fairly quiet, with probably about 8 drones on their laptops. I had an envelope to stuff and deliver. While doing that, I sat at the bar drinking a Golden Chai latte. I appreciate the sign on the bar that says "no laptops or tablets at the bar." It's refreshing to not be too bunched up against people with laptops, where the only rule of community is to completely ignore each other's existence. I commented on my drink to the barista and our banter felt like an exchange that might have happened in a café 20 years ago. I read a long magazine article and just chilled out. I'll keep coming here when it's not too busy, for their *spectacularly* good Golden Chai.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
In a city like San Francisco with a high density of coffee shops you wouldn't think that a neighborhood like Nob Hill would lack - coffee shops! Insiders know about the little Peet's inside the Grace Cathedral but that's pretty much it. 

Head towards Larkin and California and enter Contraband - a modern coffee bar with all the things that make San Francisco coffee unbeatable - tasty lattes, espressos, and pour over made with South American beans. (Hot) sandwiches are also on the menu but I haven't tried those.

4 stars for the great coffee and the minimalistic interior, the large window front with the sun reflecting from the beautiful buildings across the street. Young crowd, good vibe.

Contraband, you nailed it.
author: Sebastian F.

description: The Americano was pretty nice. Good flavor and came out fast. I was also hungry and ordered a quiche from their pre-made food display. I received it and it was still cold and frozen. I told the man working at the counter who gives me a dead-pan expression and goes "we can heat it up again." I get the heated up quiche back.... and it's still totally cold. Their coffee and atmosphere is good but customer service and quality of food products were completely lacking. Not going back anytime soon.
author: Hina A.

description: This place definitely has character. I've noticed that Contraband likes to be loud. Including the baristas. Barista, do you really need to rant loudly how you think it's good that Trump pulled out of the Paris climate agreement? But the wood acoustics makes this better than the new 5th st location. The blasting ska/punk was at first a bit off-putting at first, but it kind of warmed up to me... I can see how it's endearing.... But then again can you really not afford a premium Spotify (or Pandora?) membership????
author: Michelle C.

description:
I think I managed to stop by here for 4 days straight while staying in Nob Hill for a conference in town.

The drinks reminded me of coffee service you'd expect in Europe or Australia.

I fell in love with the pistachio croissants. It's a good thing probably I won't get to go back for about a year...
author: Jeff S.

description:
Free wifi. Nice community high table with plants in the center. 

They have the Blossom coffee maker contraption that controls 6-7 variables in brewing. Got the Yemen - darker brew - you take your first sip, and expect the astringent bite at the end and it isn't there! Very smooth, clean-tasting coffee. Comes in a glass beaker / pitcher with a tasting cup. Awesome.
author: Inga C.

description:
Okay coffee place. Stopped by the other day since I live in the area and this place has high reviews. It was fairly packed on a Sunday afternoon with a primarily clientele of people studying or doing work, so it was a bit difficult to find a seat. I got a latte, which was decent, but definitely nothing outstanding about this latte that I'd rave about. Parking can be hard to find in the area, so either walk/uber or you might risk having to drive around for quite some time to find parking, which is what happened to my friend.

Overall, I found it to just be a typical coffee shop, nothing particularly stand out.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Really f#@king good coffee. These guys are not screwing around.
author: Ried C.

description: Coffee is prepared so quickly and delicious! My friend and I came here to study and it is a cute coffee shop vibe if not a little small and on the noisier side
author: Vivian P.

description: Love their coffee and exceptional customer service! I've been coming to this place from time to time before I met Christopher who works here as a barista. He is really welcoming and nice! Now it's my to go place to get coffee! I usually get their Chemex Ethiopia which tastes great!
author: Maria O.

description:
came here to do work... overwhelming paucity of outlets, and the wifi is garbage:

http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/6380481942

coffee is ok... i wish i had the option not to shell out for pour-over, but i guess i should have seen that coming.
author: Michael C.

description: Rosemary latte is the way to go. This place has a super hipster/bourgeois vibe if that's your thing. Their pastry section is a bit limited though, I was a little disappointed  about that. The environment is ok, it's not as warm and welcoming as some of the other places I've been at. It's lacking energy. It's a meh coffee shop.
author: Morvarid T.

description: Really loved my mocha spice almond milk latte. Service was great and I love how they didn't give me a to go cup even if I was staying in the cafe. Really sustainable and awesome options!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Summary: coffee is good but not outstanding, though I liked the pour over better than the espresso drink I ordered. Overall I would return if I was in the area and in need of coffee, but definitely not worth going out of the way for. Skip the treats here and just get coffee.

Pros:
1. Pour over was exactly as described (read: I actually tasted the flavors in the description) and definitely the highlight
2. Lots of seating, free wifi
3. Coffee and espresso were smooth and well prepared

Cons:
1. I ordered a "dark white", which was supposedly a flat white mixed with dark chocolate, a "really intense mocha". In reality it was a flat white with a bunch of dark chocolate stuck at the bottom. Could have been mixed better.
2. We ordered waffles with our drinks. After about ten minutes of waiting it turned out they had forgotten to take them out and had burned them so they made new ones. The new waffles tasted undercooked and were not very good.
3. It's sometimes difficult to tell what drink is being made because they sometimes don't call out what's on the bar (also the drink is written in very small letters on the very top of the cup. Hmmmm)
author: Jon C.

description:
I've been here twice, this being the second, and rave about their Chai.

They have a ton of coffee selections.  If you can't find something you like here, then you must not care anything about your coffee and tea.  They also have a small display of pastries and empanadas on the side - not a lot, but enough.

I'd highly recommend the Chai!  It's really bold and flavorful and the spice used in it will give you a good kick.  It's right on par with the Chai from Samovar... but instead of paying $8... it only cost $4.  

This place also has a really long working table in the middle, which is great for working groups or just sitting amongst others.  They also have a few tables outside in the event the weather is nice.  Both times I have been there the place has been full.. but not too loud...I was still able to be productive.  They have outlets on the walls and free wifi also.

I will definitely return.
author: Jared N.

description:
While in San Francisco for the day, we ate lunch at Swan's Oyster Depot and decided to try one of San Francisco's famed coffee shops before we left.  YELP guided us to a well rated one about a block away.  We weren't disappointed.

I ordered a small coffee and was hit with an incredible selection to choose from.  Finally tried an Ethiopian coffee which was outstanding.  My son usually goes for iced coffee and reported his was superior as well.  We tried a croissant which was exceptional.

The place is very clean, comfortable stools and counters for workspaces which several patrons were utilizing.  The barista was very professional, helpful and efficient.  Don't understand all the bad ratings because of lack of perceived indifference- not everyone can be Mr. or Miss Personality.   Outside on the steep sidewalk comfortable chairs are available when the weather is nice.
author: Milton S.

description:
Wow, I really enjoyed the Pirates Chai Latte! I am a huge matcha fan, and the spiciness definitely added an extra kick to the flavor.

If you're trying to find a spot to do some work, Contraband is cozy with free wifi.
author: Christine T.

description: Visited again after being away for a few years. Not as awesome as I remember it. Pastry options weren't as good, decor had declined, coffee was fine but nothing to write home about.
author: Mike M.

description:
They have some unique coffee choices here. I got the Flat White, which has a little more milk than the Cortado my boyfriend chose. Having them side by side, I could actually taste the subtle differences in the intensity of the coffee flavor.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/contraband-coffee-bar-san-francisco?select=fhq4QHyCaDFWNwBaMh8kUA#fhq4QHyCaDFWNwBaMh8kUA

Free wi-fi (and bonus: their range is so good that I was able to use it across the street while waiting in line at Olea!), outdoor seating that works out to be in the afternoon shade, good service. A good contingency of folk sitting at their laptops, but no line at the register and it wasn't crowded. A nice time overall.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Friendly staff, lots of light, chill tunes. Not a coffee aficionado, but I still enjoyed what I had. The most recent time I've been here I had a nice mug of "pirate chai latte", which is a spicy (not sweet) chai made out of macha green tea, for $4.

Free wifi speed: 2.68 down / 0.69 up
Only downside is few outlets; there's one on the left wall closer to the bar window seating when you walk in, and one on the wall facing you between two two-tops. Probably a good place to grab a coffee while you wait in line outside Mymy or Olea for brunch, as well.

Heads up: by around 10am on a Saturday, about 1/3 of the seats are full and there's a small line for coffee ending at the door. :)
author: Linus W.

description: A little stuffy inside, even though it was in the 60s outside, but the yummy (not too spicy, so don't be afraid of that word) pirate's Chai creation and the pistachio croissant made the experience worth it!
author: Anna A.

description:
Interesting tea latte options. 

I'm a huge fan of any well done tea latte. Contraband offers a selection that I haven't seen in other places; I had the Pirates Chai (matcha chai) and my friend got the sage lavendar latte. Both lattes were strong in tea taste and not particularly sweet, which I like. Could have been a been creamier for my taste, otherwise, great latte.
author: Becky M.

description:
Sweet spot. Good coffee.

Found this place on Yelp this morning. After our pickups at Mr. Holmes Bake Shop, girlfriend and I were looking for a place to sit down and nom with a good cup of coffee. Conveniently, Contraband was just a short walk away, about 4 blocks. It was easy to spot with the red signage and outdoor seating. Inside, there's a decent amount of seating, including a communal high table in the center, high chairs along the windows, as well as a couple of side tables for 2. Saw a couple people with their laptops out, so I assume wifi is available. Good beverage offerings; there's a good photo of the menu in the gallery here. Also noticed they served Dynamo donuts - cool. We got a latte and a single origin Ethiopian pour over. Girlfriend enjoyed the latte, but mentioned it had a bit more foam than normal, almost like a cappuccino. The single origin Ethiopian was light and bright. I believe it is their lightest roast. We both liked their mugs. The latte came in a slim, tall, black mug with a generous handle, which we appreciated. The pour over came in a simple white mug with some cool Contraband branding. It was the perfect spot to enjoy coffee with pastries.
author: Roderick T.

description: I want to like this place more because it is in a convenient location, but I've realized it really is overpriced. I've been many of the better coffee shops around SF and Contraband stands out out as overpriced for what you get. This is most obvious with their drip coffee and $1.50 au lait surcharge.  An almond milk au lait, for example, would cost you more than $6 at Contraband - that's drip coffee plus steamed almond milk..nothing too fancy. The regular coffee prices are up there with the latte prices which just doesn't make sense and seems very unusual compared to other stores. I understand they source good quality beans and that costs more, and I would expect to spend between $4-$4.75 on this in most higher end shops, but $6+ for a basic drink is over the top. I'd recommend going to Saint Frank down on Polk, where they make their nut milk homemade everyday and it still costs less! The coffee is better and they are friendlier, too.  That said, Contraband coffee is good and they have some really interesting latte drinks with sage and rosemary for example, and those are totally worth the extra splurge once in a while
author: Liza M.

description: We stopped in twice during our long weekend in the city. The baristas are knowledgeable and the coffee was very good. Get the coffee in a mug and stay awhile. The mugs themselves were nicely shaped and weighty. They added to the fullness of the coffee experience.
author: Jayne I.

description:
Well, I can honestly say I'm impressed with the way the staff has made a 180 in such a short period of time.  I'm talking pleasant demeanors, smiling faces, and actually making me feel welcome, which truly changes the experience entirely.  

For the sake of full disclosure, the manager reached out to me and asked that I give Contraband another try as they're aware of some of the issues I previously mentioned and are making a concerted effort to change poor customer reviews.  If that isn't commendable enough to pull me back, offering me a couple free drinks practically had me knocking on the counter ready to place my order.  The fact that this small business is investing in their employees and helping them interact with customers better is awesome.  Pair that with an unhappy customer turned to a happily caffeinated one that'll return back and even recommend to others - now that's what I call "showin' people how it's done!".  

And yeah, my almond milk latte tastes much better.  Did they change the way the make the lattes or was it the positive baristas?  Who knows, who cares, I got what I wanted.
author: Tina A.

description: I had the 'Pirates' Green Chai Latte with an added coffee shot. It was sweet, spicy, hot and frothy. For anyone who knows their chai, or likes dirty chai lattes, this was great. I would definitely get it again. My friend had a cappuccino and she rated it 'pretty good'.
author: Elina G.

description:
I like to think of myself as a coffee purist but I branched out here at contraband and i wasn't disappointed. I got the iced separator which had coconut milk, honey, and cinnamon which was a nice counterpoint to the coffee. It was refreshing and full of flavor. 

The atmosphere was really welcoming inside and outside. It was a great place to spend a nice Saturday afternoon.
author: Sarah Z.

description: The drinks are excellent and the service is even better. Sara was very friendly and had wonderful recommendations, even at the end of a long shift. I couldn't recommend this spot more!
author: Elias S.

description:
EXTREMELY rude guy answered the phone. I had a question and he was like, "I have customers to help right now!" 
Then why the hell did you answer the phone?????
I was going to go there but changed my mind.
I'm sure they have great coffee which I was looking forward to have but I won't find out! 

This review is strictly based on RUDE customer service, not coffee! If you open a business to serve customers, hire people who are good at customer service both in person and over the phone. Tell your employees NOT to answer the phone if they are busy!
author: FoodE Y.

description: I usually think most coffee tastes about the same...but the coffee here is REALLY good. Even my unrefined palate can tell the difference. You can't go wrong here.
author: Allegra G.

description: I've walked past this place so many times, I finally ordered my go-to almond milk cappucino. Smooth finish, with no bitter acidic after taste, yet still has a strong coffee taste. All drinks with espresso shots come in double shots, the only way to do a cappuccino - I'm a fan! I've also grabbed the Hawaiian mochi that they get from Third Culture Bakery, as my sweet tooth simply can't resist. With that said, it's not super sweet, and has that nice mochi texture. I'll be back to try some of their many pour over options.
author: Aimee K.

description:
Great coffee and friendly staff! 

Not too much seating inside or outside mostly stools at a small counter near the window which is nice and sunny. There's free fast wi-fi and a few power outlets available. It gets pretty crowded on weekends. Definitely a good place to get some work done.
author: Linda X.

description: Across the street from where we are staying, with very relaxed and helpful baristas. The coffee is good, good WiFi, cute place, all over just a great coffee shop to go to.
author: Esther S.

description:
Ehh... Maybe their working 36 hrs straight or they just hate what their doing with their lives but definitely  not a place I'll frequent. Sorry guys, it's depressing. 

Had their Kyoto cold brew. It was ok. Their $4 oatmeal cookie wasn't fresh... 

Rather disappointed with my coffee break.
author: Raul M.

description: I find it hard to find a nice cozy coffee shop where its not loud and filled with yuppies. This place is nice, cozy, and quiet. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Wifi is available and one restroom with a key code. They offer a wide variety of drinks and snacks. I got the green tea matcha which was pretty tasty.
author: Sarah C.

description: Best Cappuccino ever! My husband had the Ethiopian brew and raved about it. I also ordered their spinach and feta empanada and it was delicious. I completely recommend this place!
author: Marita S.

description:
The chubby guy with glasses was an asshole. He ignored me as I was waiting to order so he could finish nonchalantly mopping-- he didnt even greet me. No big deal though.
When he finally approached me to take my order, I asked if he's gonna wash his hands. He blew the question off and, with an elevated temper, asked "What do you want man(!)?"
I said thank you and left. 

I don't know if this was a case of discrimination, or if he was just unhappy with his life. Either way, his representation of himself and the café has inspired a deep hate in me. With all the problems in the world, what's so bad that we can't be nice? How would you like to drink coffee made with hands that prepared a mop bucket?
author: Aar A.

description:
Their coffee is simply amazing. 
The ambiance is perfect for computer use.
I come here whenever I'm in the area and need to get some work done, always served up by a friendly face for some delish tea or coffee.
author: Gaya G.

description:
As I was exploring Nob Hill I found myself walking past this interesting coffee bar so I decided to stop in for a drink. The atmosphere is fairly trendy and new. 

In most aspects this is no different than any other run of the mill coffee shop, but one thing that really stood out to me was the number of options they had both in coffee preparation styles and in the number of coffee roasts they offered. They had at least 6 or 7 different roasts with detailed descriptions of their origination and flavor notes. Their coffee styles included standard drip, pour over, a massive aeropress type of machine and a few others. If there is one thing I like, its having options... and this place has many. 

I definitely recommend getting a cup of coffee using the blossom machine that they have as it produces an incredibly smooth taste. 

Overall, in the Nob Hill area, this is certainly my preferred place to get a caffeine fix. "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
I wouldn't say that the baristas here are extremely nice, but the coffee sure is good. With place to do some work and just enough of background noise, I'd say this place is pretty ideal for a nice hangout spot or to get some work done.

Awesomeness to note:
1. Free wif
2. Pretty designs in the coffee
3. A good amount of seating (inside and outside)
4. They have baked goods so you have something yummy to accompany your coffee
5. Great lattes! Not too much milk....I may never go to starbucks again...*gaaaasppp*
6. Great spot to people watch

Helpful tip: Make sure you say [insert whatever beverage you want] "to-go" or "for here"..so you don't seem like a noob. Haha. :(
author: Jennifer S.

description: Personally, I'm not crazy about contraband's flavor profiles but their technique is excellent and the pour over tastes crisp and clean.
author: Jen H.

description:
Coffee and tea options are A1. They somehow combine high quality coffee, chai options and fun flavors to please all who come in. We ordered the safe Rosemary latte (one hot and one iced, hot is the way to go) a spiced mocha and a hot chocolate for the kiddo.

We came late in the afternoon so the baked goods were slim pickings, but we enjoyed what we got. We had the poppyseed, Gruyere and ham bun and the spinach and feta empanada, both warmed.

Parking can be tough, and outside seating is limited, but that being said it definitely is worth the inconvenience. I cannot wait to come back to try other seasonal coffee offerings as well as one of their chai's.
author: Victoria O.

description:
Great selection of different coffees and methods of preparation.  You would need to come here once a day for a whole year to try every combination.  You can also tell the staff really knows what they are doing with all those combinations. Plus, almond milk on tap to add to your coffee! 

Haven't tried the liege waffles, but plan to next time for some fika - the other pastries looked good too. Music makes the atmosphere and plenty of space to spread out (I can't say how it might look during a busy period).  Definitely will return to Contraband.
author: Ben K.

description:
What an unfriendly place. The guy taking our order seemed so impatient that we were trying to figure out what to order even though there was no one in line behind us. Then when we placed our lattes down, he didn't tell us which one was which and got annoyed when we asked him which was which. 

The latte's were ok. Nothing special. And we each had an empanada. They were ok too. Average food/coffee with shitty service...um, no thanks.
author: Kat A.

description:
Contraband is a convenient (if expensive) local option for Joe. The baristas are always friendly and have a deft touch for making amazing lattes. The flat whites with soy milk are petty stellar too. And for fun they have a "flat dark", which includes a bar of chocolate.

I've only tried a couple of their pastries, but can say the morning bun is insanely good. Eat bite into it is like sinking your teeth into a perfectly flakey, buttery, smoked ham slice of heaven. A menu lists Dynamo as their source for some of their baked goods but not sure that covers all of them.

The main problem with Contraband is the price per ounce. Their coffees are teeny. Think: lattes served in those espresso to-go cups. Yet, they are almost as expensive as the much larger versions at Peets or Philz.

So, that factor alone makes Contraband a great option if you need something local and quick, but if you have time, save yourself a buck with a walk elsewhere.
author: Christopher M.

description: I went here for the first time this weekend and was immediately drawn to the vibe. The decor is simple and clean, which only adds to the relaxation of a coffee break. The coffee is good but not strong. A nice change from the heavy coffees currently sweeping San Francisco.
author: Rachael B.

description:
I'm in the top 17 (not to be overly specific or anything) customers in the Perkville iPad, so, yes, I'm clearly biased and think this place is the bee's knees. But I wouldn't have climbed my way up there out of the 7000 folks who've entered their emails if this place were bad, would I? 

The people who work here are genuinely nice and fun people. They show fun and affordable art (full disclosure: I got to hang some of my work here a while back). The place is airy and bright and if you're sitting in the window you can glimpse the cable car lumbering on by. The coffee is superb.

My favorite drinks here: cortado, pirate's chai (matcha chai latte), iced separator, and Kyoto cold brew with soy milk, which, according to barista Jack's Lowbrow Tasting Notes™, tastes like Cheerios. (Not sure I got that, but, suffice it to say that it's delicious.) Come, but not when it's too crowded, because then I'd probably have to wait behind you in line.
author: Catherine K.

description: Not only their choice of format for coffee bean bags is suspicious (12oz bags prices like 16oz in other comparable stores). It is not worth it either. Not coming back.
author: Winter M.

description:
Found this place on Yelp and saw it was just a few blocks away from our hotel.  It's a smallish space, but at least there's more seating outside.  After a quick scan of the menu, I saw they offered a CORTADO.  Bingo.  My friend ordered one too.  Bitter, but to my liking, not so much to my friend's.  I scanned their display case and saw these interesting looking donuts.  I asked the guy working the counter what they had and he happily rattled off the flavors.  When he said HUCKLEBERRY LEMON, it was all over.  It was fantastic!  What a great flavor combo.  These are Dynamo Donuts, freshly made right here in San Francisco.  They're denser and taste like they've been baked.

Anyhow, we loved this coffee bar and went twice on our short weekend trip to SF.
author: Carol L.

description:
Writing this review after one quick visit, so hopefully a review update will occur quite soon.

Contraband was way more than what I was expecting! No pretentious baristas, but yes, quiet hipsters pounding their cold brews at shared tables.

Coffee was outstanding, and pretty reasonable for a single drip. Being lactose intolerant, I did love that they offer almond milk and soy milk on the side bar (instead of just half and half or soy milk)!
author: Kerry G.

description: Had to stop by for a second visit before leaving Frisco. Best almond cap and tons of unique pastries. Yum!
author: Irina N.

description: Yummy chamomile tea, quick service and very spacious. This place has a few 2-tops outside and one that seats 4. Good place for coffee/tea if you want to get away from the crowd :]
author: Anna M.

description:
Came here a few months ago and I can still distinctly remember the taste of their iced separator in my mouth.

I admit that I go to great lengths to try out different coffee shops.  I currently live in Livermore and have driven down to Santa Clara because I was craving a coffee shop's coffee.

But I'll admit that I didn't drive to this area for that reason.  We were arrived early for an appointment in the area and decided to try this place out since they were close by and had free wifi.. And they serve Dynamo Donuts (my favorite!!)

I'm all for natural tasting and subtle sweeteners where I can actually taste the coffee.  My usual drink is actually a black cold brew or pour over.  But since I thought that I'd only be coming here once, I might as well try their specialty - the iced separator.

I'm so happy I did!! I'm all for natural tasting and subtle sweeteners where I can actually taste the coffee.  I also love the mix of coconut cream/milk, almond milk and cinnamon.  It was really the perfect blend.  Granted, the drive out and the traffic to deal with coming from the tri-valley would be a bit much for me.  But if I'm already in the city, I'd gladly go out of my way to come here again for this refreshing drink.
author: Krystal Nina L.

description:
I've never really been blown away by the coffee here. Other Yelpers say it's on par with Blue Bottle, but I don't see it. A Blue Bottle cappuccino has a strong and distinct espresso flavor. The cappuccino I had here was more dull and the espresso just didn't have that flair to it. There was also half an inch of room at the top, which kind of sucks when the cup is already a modest 8oz. They seem to know the procedures to make coffee drinks well and have some pretty trendy selections, so maybe they just need better espresso. But overall, since prices are on par with Blue Bottle's but the drinks are inferior in quality, I'd say it's not really worth the money. 

As for the space itself, it's a good cafe for people watching. It's also a good place to study or do laptop work, with high table seating, big windows, lots of sunlight, and free wi-fi! If you're looking for a place to camp out with your laptop, I'd say this is a good choice.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
Found this great coffee shop while working from SF last week. Apparently working WiFi is a rare find in SF, but this spot pulled through with free and quick internet access.

Baristas could be a bit friendlier and wecloming, but otherwise It's a nice sunny space with long shared hightop tables perfect for doing work. On a Monday morning, most people were working from the cafe and posted up with their computers. They were playing some great lowkey tunes perfect for focusing, and coffee was strong and good. The prices here are sorely high, but this could be a standard in SF. I got a coffee and yogurt for $9. They also have some bar space facing the baristas, but they don't allow laptops/electronics in this area.
author: Coleen K.

description: I've been to more coffee shops than I can count and this has the best cappuccino I've ever tried. Amazing coffee, nice decor and affordable prices.
author: Jack A.

description: This has to be my favorite roast for cappuccino, no sugar required. One of the smoothest caps I have had. Always finished off great on the presentation. Actually send some of their roasts to my son in Oregon for his drip coffee. Awesome, and I visit every time I go to our San Francisco office.
author: Steven H.

description: Best coffee in the nob hill area by far. I typically get an americano and one of the best I've had. There's always people sitting outside with their dogs socializing. My dog enjoys coming here as well
author: Brian G.

description:
Delicious cold brew - check!

Selection of Dynamo doughnuts (and other delicious-looking pastries that I pass over because, doughnuts) - check!

Lots of light (because I'm weirdly picky about light) - check!

Friendly baristas - check!

The only downside to this cafe is that it's not in my neighborhood.
author: Han Z.

description: I'm not sure what it is about this place I dislike like more! It's either the smug barista or the cappuccino that just isn't very good. I've given it two tries, but I won't be back. There is great coffee to be had in San Francisco and this just isn't it.
author: Jen B.
