description: I did not like the iced separator at all! It was way too sweet, especially once the drink started to settle and all of the sweetener settled to the bottom. The service was also pretty cold. I would rather stop at Philz, Blue Bottle or Sight Glass!
author: Hayley H.

description: LOVE Contraband! Great espresso drinks and selection of goodies to eat.  Whether you sit outside or inside it's very comfortable and the baristas kick ass! Thank you guys!
author: Richard B.

description: This is an adorable coffee/tea/pastry shop that I just tried on a layover. I saw a picture of the spicy "pirate" chai green tea on Yelp and had to make the trek. This journey did not disappoint. I ordered just that--the spicy pirate chai green tea and it was beautifully crafted with the frothed milk making a lovely design on top that only the talented baristas seem to be able to produce. I asked the barista what he recommended for pastry/baked good that would fill me up and he claimed the "morning bun" would do the trick. It was filled with ham and cheese and sesame seeds, a delight..and they heat it up for you right there. The atmosphere is very hip and chill..spots for laptop and tablet charging and a bright and airy feel to the place. There's also outdoor seating to people watch (which I'm extremely guilty of).
author: Heather L T.

description:
I go here everyday. The drinks are delicious, staff friendly, and most patrons are working on their computers inside (with free wifi and outlets) or socializing outside on the patio furniture. I work a block from Equator and Blue Bottle downtown, but they aren't quite the same. If you like iced drinks, I'd recommend trying their signature Iced Separator.

They also have unique prints from artists for sale on display on about a two month rotation. Overall, wonderful little spot that could seat ~30 inside and another ~10 outside.
author: Desmond W.

description:
Ice separator coffee really unique with nice flavor of coconut honey etc but a bit deceptive in looks.I took it to go and it didnt look like the picture that i saw near cash register.I also tried the spicy vegan cake and the dark white coffee which were really good too.

Overall the coffee is strong sans milk and sugar but the flavor and fragrance is good.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Nice space with a good amount seating.  The drinks have been solid and the employees are relatively friendly and without pretension.  It's a comfortable neighborhood spot to hang out.  I come here to get some work done or catch up with friends. 

Note that if you come here to work/study, sometimes the music played is very loud and jarring (maybe they're trying to prevent it from being a work destination? Not sure).  Actually even when just chatting with friends, we had to speak over the music to be heard and it was loud enough to feel relief when the song ended and there was a brief silence.  Usually it's more relaxing music though.
author: whatever I.

description: Love this cafe! It's close to my apartment and I go there all of the time to work. They have a rewards program too so after buying a few drinks you get a free one. They also have amazing hot chocolate. Only reason for 4 stars is their food selection is pretty poor and the wifi is slow and times out a lot. Also there aren't that many outlets. If you want a tasty snack or fast wifi, I'd recommend somewhere else.
author: Lindsay L.

description: I didn't love the coffee here but the place is cute and a good place to work. They have plenty of seats and a chill vibe so I was happy I found it when I was staying at a hotel down the street. I ordered an almond latte that had a subtle taste and the almond milk sort of overpowered the coffee. I also had an oatmeal that comes in a cute mason jar but was not anything to write home about. Only two small tables but three sections of huge communal tables with seats!
author: Alyssa H.

description: Had some CUPS drinks to spend so decided to check this place out. Glad I did. Very good nonfat latte. Milk was very well steamed. Espresso flavor was dark, earthy, and bold. They wouldn't let me have a single origin bean for my latte though which is a bit of a bummer. Also tried their nonfat flat white. Pretty good, definitely stronger but the milk wasn't as thick as it could be. I actually preferred the latte instead. I also tried my friend's single origin pour over. Usually not a big fan of pour overs but this wasn't bad. Fruity, a tad sour. Philz is better.
author: Will N.

description:
I don't understand the high ratings to this place!  The name sounds extremely compelling for me to want to go to this place and check it out, but it didn't live up to its name!  I imagined the place to be like a pirate themed atmosphere and they would have cargoes of coffee labeled contraband on it...boy, was I wrong!

A M B I A N C E - The decor and atmosphere was a modern, simple place to grab coffee at.  What a letdown!  There was no AC either when it was a hot day!  The music was very soft in the background.

C O F F E E - To me, it was just good coffee - not the best I have ever had.  I ordered the latte because they ran out of coffee.  What bad business to run out of coffee when the name says Contraband "coffee" bar!  Plus, they charge tax on your coffee if you are dining in - I encountered that at only this cafe so far!  Pretty pricey for coffee!

L A Y O U T - Adequate seating and long high-tables, but not enough electrical power outlets!  Their Wi-Fi passcode is Chuck Norris!  I find that amusing!  They have different bins for recycling paper, plastic and compost.

Final say - They should remodel into something exciting that compliments the name!  Good place to get your work done in the residential surrounding area here!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I live a block from this place but hardly ever go. Coffee is decent but not worth $6 (yes $6) for a Starbucks size grande and the guys that work there are pretty big dicks - no other way to sugarcoat it. Just rude and generally unfriendly.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I really like the simple decor and clean space they have going on here. Went in to do some work, and had an enjoyable experience.

I got the Pirates chai and yelpers were not wrong, this drink is pretty killer (I'll definitely be back for it again!). The mix of chai and matcha was perfect and super tasty.

My only complaint is the the wifi took quite a while to pull up the agreement page so I was waiting at least 20 min to get internet. But hey, what's so bad about going to a coffee shop just to enjoy it and your company! I feel like a brat complaining about the wifi, especially since everything else was lovely! 

Happy to have found this little spot (with ample seating and a delicious array of coffees and tea). Definitely recommend it to the picky coffee drinkers of SF!
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Fine coffee, but absolutely crappy service.

From the beginning.....I was outside smoking a cig looking in through the window to review the chalkboard menu. I was easily 15 feet from the entrance and there were no customers outside and a sole 1 inside. (This wasn't a bad sign, it was just 630am). The guy behind the counter came charging outside and snapped at me that I couldn't smoke in front of the place. So I meandered up a few feet past the story front, had a couple more drags, then went inside. He was definitely on edge, but I'm a New Yorker and a little tude is easily disregarded. I apologized for my faux pas (he didn't acknowledge my aquiescence or apology, but again who cares) and proceeded to order a red eye. 

He then proclaimed that their coffees were all strong enough and he wouldn't make that. I looked over the menu and there were lots of choices for single origin drips/comexes. I chose the black market blend though because it's explanation was bold toasty and full bodied. I also ordered a shot of espresso. He pulled the shot and I sipped it well he brewed my cup. It did have a full flavor, but was a little watery and I'm glad I had the extra kick of caffeine to start off my day. I left Contraband with my brew and captain snappy didn't say another word to me.

I've worked in the food and beverage business for 20 years and still do. I love good coffee. Yet this is The city and by no means is it lacking on places for a good cup of coffee. Additionally, I know the customer is not always right. What they are though are paying so a little bit softer demeanor goes a long way in dealing with us.

Needless to say, the next morning I went to Cup-of-joe got my redeye from a happy employee and won't ever be heading back to contraband.
author: Jacob O.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for quite some time now and was so excited to finally try it.  Looking through the other yelp reviews, I decided to try the pirates chai: a mix of chai & matcha green tea latte. Unfortunately, I did not enjoy it as much as I hoped. There was a bit of green tea taste to it, but the chai part made it taste weirdly bitter. 

Although, the pirates chai did not live up to my expectations, I was so intrigued by the iced separator that I decided to come back the following day to give it a try. And oh my, it did NOT disappoint! The iced separator is an espresso with coconut water, coconut cream, honey, almond milk and cinnamon. Served SHAKEN ;) Definitely something I have never tried before and I've had my fair share of eclectic coffee. 

For both days, I came to try to get work done. I would recommend coming with your laptops fully charged because their outlets are very limited.
author: Janel L.

description: Super chill place to do some work, it's quite, but not a ghost town. The pirates chai is my favorite drink and the guava scone is great. I'd have to try really hard to think of something that is even remotely negative about this great spot. They're also open relatively late (they close at 9pm but on occasion it would've been nice if they stayed open another hour or so). Also they let you order online if you wanna run in and run out--really convenient feature--although most times there isn't a line, you can't rely on that being the case every time. So yeah ordering online is a safe bet. Great place and staff is always extremely friendly and very competent.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
The Dynamo donut was delicious! We got the regular glazed - highly recommend. Lemony!

Fiancé had the Costa Rica black pearl drip - she really liked the flavor.
author: Raj S.

description:
The coffee is phenomenal. The donuts are just aight.

I finally got a chance to try Contraband Coffee and I have to say it lives up to the reviews. It's definitely a great coffee joint ... but with mediocre pastries. I don't know about this dynamo donuts business. They were ok. I think I prefer this traditional notion of donuts where they are fried and fluffy.

These donuts are full of ... I don't know. Then glazed with ... I don't know and sprinkled on top with ... well I was lost at "full of" so I didn't even get to the sprinkled part. Meh.

The coffee though. I also am a huge fan of their cups. There's just something about them that's so cozy and inviting. They make some great lattes (soy in particular) but also have really awesome smelling drip coffee which I will have to partake in next time.

Win!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Great coffee, lots of unique offerings and coffee methods. Loved it!  All pastries looked exceptional, and the one I had was mouthwatering delish. 

If you are in the neighborhood and jonesing a coffee, this coffee place is a must check out and try, especially meet and catch up with a friend:) 

Cheers!
author: Sonia A.

description: I was here in September after searching for coffee near my Nob Hill hotel.  I enjoyed my experience TWICE  with the knowledgeable and artistic barrister and also pleased with the variety of coffees.  I was amazed to see not one person engaged in conversation as they were all on their laptops!  If you're  a coffee aficionado,  go to Contraband.
author: Rick S.

description:
Average coffee place. Came here on a Sunday morning because every other brunch place had ridiculous lines already.

Ordered the smoked ham morning bun which was quite delicious- crunchy on the outside with poppy and sesame seeds and soft on the inside with ham baked inside.

Ordered an iced mocha which was not good- tasted like artificial chocolate melted into some water with 4 espresso shots. Thankfully, there was a free latte at the bar (guess no one picked it up) which was better. Coffee here is SUPER strong (if that's what you like).
author: Sharon Y.

description:
Really cool coffee. Really crap attitudes behind the bar. Eh. Whatever I suppose it's cool to be a ride and extremely unhelpful in customer service these days. 

Living extremely close to this place and I'd like to  come here more , however it just hard to feel good about spending 10$ for two drinks being served by bitter baristas.
author: Raquel F.

description: Great coffee and ambience! The pastries (from another bakery) are also creative and quite delicious.
author: Kit C.

description: Came in for their infamous pirate chai (spicy matcha), but unfortunately out for the day. Opted for the Bhakti chai and it did not disappoint. Spicy ginger kick to warm the soul on a gloomy SF day. Lots of space to bring your laptop to work or you can just people watch and enjoy your drink. I'll be back for the pirate chai ARRGGHH!!
author: Minh N.

description:
Visited on a weekday afternoon - as calm as it gets. Ordered the rosemary sage latte with almond milk, and it was lovely! A fun surprise to smell familiar flavors and enjoy them as a sweet, milky drink. Wifi is free and very few outlets, so come with a fully-charged laptop. Ended up staying and working, and also got their cold brew which was strong and got me energized.  

Barista was friendly, easygoing and happy to chat with customers to explain drinks and the background of the store. Sounds like weekends the lines can be especially long, and many in line are those waiting for brunch spots to open up...I guess it's understood in San Francisco that all good food and drinks are worth waiting for, so why not enjoy the wait?
author: Susan F.

description: The Chai was very ginger'y. Different, but still delicious.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Now this is what every coffee bar should aspire to be like.  The foam of a latte has never sat so perfect on your upper lip while dreaming about the rush of caffeine to come.  The service was wonderful, friendly, approachable, and they even let me in 5 minutes early as it was raining outside and I had no place to go.  The staff is always smiling as if they've had their coffee for the morning, so no frowns or inappropriate scowls were in sight.

The coffee was a little weak.  Not in a bad way, but in a "I don't drink coffee that often so please ease me in" kind of way.

As if Contraband was a bad thing.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I hate this place. The guy behind the counter is really rude. I dislike hipster coffee shops that think they are the coolest things ever because they generally are far from it. 

I came here to find a place to study and the barista told me I was blocking the aisle and that I should move to the side of the table. There are no other people in this cafe! What the heck.

Never coming back. Chai tea latte I ordered was bland.
author: Vidya K.

description: Great place with outdoor seating. It's located on a relatively quiet street (well kind of) so it's nice to sit outside on a sunny day. Inside the coffeeshop can get a bit hot and humid depends on the day. But the staffs there are very nice, their coffee is good, they have a few tables but mainly bar style seating. They have different art displays by local artist in the coffeeshop which I thought was pretty cool. Park is pretty easy to find on the street.
author: Shirley W.

description: I was looking for a coffee place other than starbucks while on visiting San Francisco. Yelp led me to this place and I sure am happy I found it. I had the Colombian pour over and the latte.
author: David K.

description:
Contraband was across from Olea. On a sunny day in the city this nondescript looking coffee house was almost overlooked by our group. If it wasn't for Yelp. 

Coffee from here while waiting 45 minutes for brunch across the street was a saving grace.  As your walk in you will be greeted by a bustling group of laptop slave humans all engrossed in their own world. I feel their pain. Most of the time I'm there too. 

Fast but friendly service. I was very happy with their latte! So flavorful. Partner was happy with his strong regular black coffee! 

Now what was the contraband here??? I want that!
author: Janet D.

description: Tried the Americano, it was very good. It gave me the jolt I needed from being up at 4:30 am.
author: Amanda C.

description: Contraband really steps it up when it comes to the craft and passion that goes into the art of brewing. Every tool you'd expect at a good shop; pour overs, scales, and the Japanese slow drip (forgot the name),They have great coffee, great espresso, and the staff is always friendly. I'm terms of space it's not the biggest coffee shop so there may not always be a spot to sit, but I've always gotten mine to go.
author: Thomas R.

description:
Getting too expensive. It's a shame too, because I really liked how this place was shaping up to be. I've given up on Contraband and am happy to check out other places in the neighborhood where I can get $2.25 large cups of Blue Bottle or Sightglass drip coffee.
p.s.
I miss Josh
author: Da Wei S.

description: Probably my favorite coffee in the city. They also have cuban guava cream cheese pastries on certain days! The staff is friendly and the place is bright, spacious, and relaxing.
author: Ti Z.

description:
For a while, this used to be my second home (or primary office). Nothing feels more productive than drinking gourmet coffee and working on their free wifi early in the morning. That's how to jumpstart a day!

The single origin pourover coffees change regularly, and the employees are more than happy to talk about the nuances of the beans and the intricacies of the brewing process. 

This is not just one of my favorite coffee shops in SF, it's one of my favorites in the world!

(I usually don't eat there. The pastries and stuff are OK, but don't expect full meals-- it's a coffee shop)
author: Mike M.

description:
I don't mind the coffee, but the staff is pretty cold/unfriendly and have been a little rude at times. I work down the street and have stopped in probably 15 - 20 times and more often than not, the service was just whatever. If I'm going to make something my regular spot, I'm looking for a little more.

The coffee & pastries are pretty good and the vibe of the place is quiet enough to work/have meetings which is a plus. I just won't be making this my go-to given the service.
author: Jess B.

description: The single origin Zimbabwe espresso was so salty. Obviously it was way lower extraction!!! Bad shot
author: YuQian L.

description:
Tried the black market roast. Pretty good.
The place is decent size. Computers and readers all welcomed. The baristas were nice and fast. Their breakfast pastries like amazing yet I already ate before coming. A must if you're in the hood
author: Amalie A.

description:
I was looking for a solid place to work with wifi and Contraband was perfect. It is a small but cozy venue with plenty of seating and enough outlet options. I also love the amount of sunlight that comes in--it feels great to only to get stuff done on a weekend but also feel like you've successfully captured some sunlight as well.

The soy latte wasn't the best I've ever had, kind of had a funny / watery taste to it but the venue made up for it in my opinion.
author: Heather Y.

description: At least they have free wifi. I come here on weekdays after work when I'm too early for my Core40 class. The ambiance is way off, and the seating just feels awkwardly arranged. The coffee is good, but even with the free wifi, I wouldn't feel that comfortable working here for long. The staff also seem to -know- I'm just killing time, or else they're unfriendly/just doing their jobs. Which is fine but not what I've come to expect from coffeeshops.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Contraband is quiet and nondescript -- perfect for dates or whiling away an afternoon alone with a book. 

There is a serious coffee menu, with bean varieties from all over the world. I had a damn good cappuccino here, mmm. Food selection is a bit more limited: mainly sweet pastries, but also delicious empanadas. My breakfast empanada with bacon, sausage and cheese was flaky, savory and light. 

Would love more empanadas and hipster cred around Nob Hill. For that, Contraband, you get 5 stars.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
My boss recommended this as his favorite coffee in the city, and I endorse his opinion 100%.

The coffee is delicious, the waffles are great, and the iced separator is the best caffeinated beverage I've ever had.

Minimal seating, but this is seriously a great place to study or crank out some work!
author: Meaghan H.

description:
The barista was not friendly. It was as if she was doing us a favor by giving us the gift of coffee. 

The four of us were looking for coffee after we just had a great dinner and she made us feel so unwelcomed we could not have left fast enough.

Michael C. was looking for 2 shots of espresso in a cup. That's it. The look she gave him was as if he had beamed down from a UFO. As if she's never heard of any such thing. Her responses were short and curt. 

When Cindy N. asked about one of their menu items the barista just read exactly what was written on the board. Which wasn't much. 

She just didn't want to be there, didn't want to make coffee, didn't want to serve coffee. In San Francisco you can't afford a barista with this kind of attitude.
author: Jane N.

description:
The actual cup of coffee was delicious. The price for a single origin iced coffee was a little on the high side at $4.75. I can get incredible cold brewed iced coffees all over the city for less than that. The best part about going to these high end, exotic coffee shops is knowing you're going to get incredible coffees made by incredible baristas. My barista this afternoon wasn't friendly, didn't want to answer my questions on which coffee was his favorite, then called out my order with "I can't remember which coffee this is but its yours". 

I live close to this shop and hope that the next time I go thru the service will be up to par with the price of the coffee. Until then I'm not sure I can recommend it with so many other amazing coffee shops in the vicinity.
author: Zack P.

description: Super hipstery. A bit expensive. But at the end of the day, a cute little space with tasty coffee and a chill vibe. Fast wifi. Right in the heart of the city. Enjoyable, probably not worth a special trip.
author: Sean B.

description:
Contraband seems like it ought to be a better coffee shop than it is.

You walk in, and see all the signs of a good 'third wave' coffee shop. Thousands of dollars' worth of grinding and brewing equipment. Single-origin coffees, roasted in-house and brewed to order. Baristas who look like they stepped out of an indie movie, pouring intricate latte art and forgetting your coffee order. A fancy logo that some beret-wearing graphic designer probably made in a nearly identical coffee shop.

So when I had my first mediocre cup of coffee here, I wrote it off as an anomaly. But I've been back a couple more times since, with similar results. I think it's time to admit that the coffee here just isn't that good. Which is unfortunate, because it's the closest coffee-focused coffee shop to my apartment.

I've tried their espresso and their pour-over, and got a bag of beans to brew at home. The espresso was pretty decent, if you don't mind a bit of acidity. The pour-over was a washed Ethiopia Yirgacheffe. It was OK; not much of the fruitiness you often get with Ethiopian coffees, but drinkable. Not really worth the four bucks or whatever they charge for it. I wasn't sure whether it was underwhelming because of the beans or the brewing -- pour-overs can be temperamental, after all.

So I brought  some beans home to try in my Aeropress; Costa Rican this time. Opening the bag, I got a whiff of something acrid, like burnt rubber. I used to play around with roasting coffee at home, and these beans smelled like some of the batches I messed up. The roast *looked* fine -- not too dark, pretty even-looking -- but smelled all wrong. I brewed up a couple of cups, and didn't finish them. They tasted pretty much how they smelled. So now I've got about 11 oz of Contraband Costa Rica coffee beans that I'm probably not going to drink; not a good use of eighteen bucks. (UPDATE: they got a bit less burnt-tasting after a couple more days' rest. Still not great, but drinkable.)

Now, I don't want to be *too* harsh. Contraband is a fine neighborhood coffee shop, if you adjust your expectations. It's a pleasant space, lots of sunlight, and the espresso drinks are fine. I'll probably come here from time to time, when I don't feel like elbowing my way through the bruncher crowd at Jane's. But my search for a go-to neighborhood coffee shop continues.

UPDATE: Adding a fourth star because this place has, in fact, become my go-to neighborhood coffee shop, albeit only for the occasional espresso. I'm still not going to buy any more beans to brew at home.
author: Nath A.

description:
Contraband has without a doubt the best flat white I've ever had in the states. It's a thing of sheer beauty. Not to mention the breakfast empanadas! Both the bacon and sausage empanadas are delicious, albeit a bit small.

This is definitely a co-working cafe, but it's still super chill if you just want to sit and enjoy an amazing coffee.
author: Nick S.

description:
Legit coffee spot. I had the macchiato which was on point. I accompanied that with a biscotto and some waffle bites. A very laid back vibe with plenty of chairs and tabletops for the army of MacBooks on display.

Part of their setup looks like it was built by Gale Boetticher from Breaking Bad. The actual barista was wearing track pants and a tee so I appreciated the contrast.
author: Gonzalo S.

description: Discovered Contraband early in the morning. Sipped a scrumptious almond cappuccino while fully waking up and feeling like a local watching peeps walk to work. Will make a point to go back when I'm back in San Fran.
author: Marijani R.

description: Just my kind of place! These guys get what coffee and tea is all about. The vibe in there today was very mellow and calm. Being a Monday, I realize most people are at work but there was still a decent amount of people but it was really quiet, in a good kind of way. The kind of quiet that makes you want to sit in the corner and drink your spiced matcha chai, all day long here. Also, let's just discuss this chai for a moment. I finally found matcha in California, who knew it would be so difficult?! And they make it taste even better by mixing it with a delicious chai!
author: Sasha R.

description:
Maybe it's because I came in too late in the day (4.30pm), but their quiche and waffle were both incredibly dry. The coffee is small for American standards I think. 

Oh, and their bacon doughnuts were sold out in the morning, so if you wanna try them you'll have to get here early.
author: Yu Sheng T.

description:
Writing this review after about 5 visits in about a year and a half (?)

I guess I have been lucky at times I go (usually late afternoon) because I have never waited in line. I have never ordered anything but drip coffee (a different single origin each time) and I never put cream or sugar in it because I'm a heterosexual male. My companions have ordered their other coffee drinks. 

I have gotten my order always around 4-7 minutes after paying. Totally acceptable time for quality coffee.

 One companion I went with said her flat white was not like the ones she had outside of the US but still good. My GF loves Americanos and she says its one of the best she's had.

The coffee tastes of quality and it's made properly. 

Customer service isn't overly friendly but not rude in my opinion. Not smiling DOES NOT EQUAL rude.

No better coffee place in the immediate area.
author: Monsieur_Meursault _.

description: Place is great awesome atmosphere. I hope they establish a presence in so cal. :) their my know what they're doing as far as roasting goes that's for sure and the table/bar with plants in it is pretty dope to fashow
author: Joshua L.

description: Not bad coffee, but isn't the type of coffee I'd go out of my way for - and there are a lot of coffee shops in SF that I would definitely go out of my way for.
author: Jeanette S.

description: Really pleased by the response from the business. They take customer service very seriously.
author: Christopher M.

description: One of my fav coffee bars in SF. Donuts are yummy too!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Decent coffee bar with predictably aloof employees. Only one was friendly enough to give us the wifi password when asked, after ordering two drinks and giving us attitude about sitting at the bar and ordering rather than standing at the counter, despite the fact that there were no other new customers present during our visit.

Signage at bar says no laptops or tablets to be used there- which is all well and fine, but get a nicer sign or add a smiley face please, comes across as overly pissy considering the chair six inches behind me is apparently free game for working while I drink. Maybe there's a safety or liability issue at hand, then put that maybe instead of sounding nitpicky.

Overall design and decor is light, minimalist, and airy, with wood chairs, white tabletops, and a nice centerpiece/light fixture thing going on I. The dining area. 

Cappuccino is tasty, other drink ordered tasted overly acidic and had an awful aftertaste. Menu has sparse dining options, so if hungry eat elsewhere.
author: Stefany V.

description:
***Two years ago, I wrote a dissatisfied review of Contraband, decrying their poor customer service. I'm pleased that I gave them another chance. And another after that. And probably twenty more after that until I felt I had achieved a fair sampling. They really have changed their customer service for the better. The systemic douchbaggery from behind the counter has gone. The people who are working there are chill and won't make your grandma cry for asking why they don't just have a pre-made coffee pot. ***

Contraband's space is small, but well suited to accommodate laptops and coworking without rendering the space a cultureless office humming with the buzzing of drones. It's anything but. The spirit of the space is dominated by art. Usually good art. Local art. 

The coffee is expensive. It's expensive for good reason. Their location is awesome, rent is probably astronomical, pour overs are labor intensive, and their beans are goddamn amazing and totally worth the price. Yes they have some crazy green matcha tea latte that probably tastes good if you're into matcha but their beans and pour overs are why this place is amazing. The two shining stars are both Ethiopian single origin. Despite a little batch to batch inconsistency in the amount of sour, the Ethiopian Yirgacheffe is consistently light, complex, bright, and citrusy, with a clean finish. On those days it is a tiny bit sour, this is easily the one of the best coffees I've ever had, anywhere. The Ethiopian Sidamo is consistently a thick bodied texture, rich with berries and sweetness, without much acidity. The finish is fairly clean but a little earthy boldness lingers. Their default size is 12 oz, but if you're an a-hole with a big personal cup, they are happy do the math and figure out how to get you a 16 oz. 

Look, the coffees are on par with Sightglass and Four Barrel but you don't have to expose your grandma to SOMA sidewalk surprises or mission penny-farthing enthusiasts respectively. You can come here and have a good cup of coffee even if you don't know a damn thing about coffee. You can eat a pastry that will make you fat and happy. Put a maple donut in your face, unless you like kale, in which case you can put a savory tart right in your precious little mouth hole. You can appreciate local art or get lattes that are a reasonable facsimile of art. No, they're really effing pretty, even though you're an idiot for dumping milk onto their roasts and masking the flavor of all those lovely tannins. What I'm trying to say is, you should go here.
author: Rick Z.

description: I tried their iced mocha it was amazing!!! I've been wanting to try the maple bacon donut but they were out! They also have a super cute indoor searing with some modern plant! Super cute date spot or just for hanging out!
author: Amy Y.

description:
I loved this place before, but their owner (i suppose that guy with the funny mustache is the owner) is very rude and makes you feel uncomfortable as soon as you finish your coffee and just seating there with the laptop. Even if only 30% of the seats are occupied... 

The other day I saw that he swore with a man who came to the shop and took the place without an order as he was talking by phone... i suppose that he would order smth after he finish his call but the owner decided no to wait and kicked him out of the shop... ((

I understand that he needs to make money on the business but not provide anybody with the place for work. I am sure that there are other ways to achieve this goal rather than be rude. 

Will avoid this place in a future. There are plenty places around with much more friendly stuff.
author: Anna I.

description: Contraband is just down the street from me so I come here somewhat frequently. The coffee/espresso/quality of their beverages is consistently great. I've never had a bad latte here. The barista's are friendly and efficient. Sometimes they are a little short/snippy but I don't take it personally. I think pricing is reasonable for the quality of the drink you get.
author: Bryce P.

description:
When my commute on the cable car to catch my work shuttle on Van Ness allows it, I stop by Contraband to fill my re-usable coffee mug with a soy mocha (smooth, creamy, great pick-me-up) and grab either a Dynamo doughnut (regularly delivered, maple bacon or spicy chocolate...mmm!) or an empanada (love them all, so far I've had: apple sausage & egg, sweet corn, meat, mmm, yummy, love it love it!!).  

Service is friendly and they got voted best new coffee cafe for 2011 - congrats!  Also, I love the local art they change around on their walls.  I sign in on their little computer stand by the register so that I get a free coffee every so often as a frequent customer.  :)  Contraband, see you again soon!
author: Maile N.

description: I've traveled so much of the world, and visited hundreds, if not thousands of coffee shops, and Contraband continues to be #1. Not only is the coffee amazing, but the people are wonderful and the energy of the place is fantastic. I come in every day because it makes my life more joyful. Thanks to the Contraband team for creating such a great experience.
author: Svetlana S.

description: Best coffee you could ask for. Great neighborhood spot with reliable wifi for wfh folks. Plus, their rosemary and sage latte is a bit of a revelation.  Yummers!
author: Linh S.

description:
Is it pricey? Yes. Is it hipster? Yes. Does that equal delicious? Yes. 

With the rising cost of coffee these days, it's normal to splurge around $4 for a good cold brew or a latte in San Francisco. Ritual and other popular third-wave cafes in the city definitely cater to a crowd that can afford to spend around that. I would wager that Contraband is on the even more expensive side for a good cup of coffee but I do think that for a nice environment to relax, work, or just grab some local pastries and coffee, it's still worth the extra money.

I splurged on their "iced separator," which is espresso, coconut water, coconut cream, almond milk, honey, and cinnamon and was blown away by the deliciousness. A 12 oz runs you over $5 but it's still a delicious treat. They also have cortados, flat whites, and cold brews for the discerning purists as well as tons of tea options. 

Pro tip: They have the oh-so-trendy Mr. Holmes pastries and Dynamo donuts here.
author: Kate M.

description: This is quality coffee place made to order  ,huge variety of coffee from different parts of the world just avoid going on rush hour because it's usually a big line of people ,it's a bit on the pricey side I wish it would be a dollar cheaper
author: Fabio T.

description:
Highly disappointed in the poor customer service.  We came in last Saturday afternoon and ordered 2 regular lattes and a chai latte.  The chai latte and one of the regular lattes came out in a timely manner, so we waited for the other latte.  Finally after it had become apparent that we weren't going to receive the second latte we got back in line to inquire about the third latte, the barista insisted (read: argued) that that's not what we ordered, he said we ordered 2 lattes and an empanada.  The original woman who took our order must have made a mistake, in fact she had admitted she was having an 'off day' - no big deal just correct the problem, right?  Keep your empanada and just make us a latte, not that difficult.  No need to give us attitude or a hassle about the situation.  It took another gentleman (possibly a manager?) to intervene in order for us to get our Godforsaken latte.  We paid in cash so no receipt to show for it but should there even be a debate over who's right or wrong?  Whatever happen to 'the customer always come first'??

Shame we came here as my cousin was visiting from LA and wanted to get a taste of SF's incredible coffee scene, she had a huge list and we ended up wasting a trip to this place. 

*Coffee was decent, nothing to write home about.  The chai latte they use is Bhakti which is a brand I discovered bottled cold at Whole Foods and really enjoy it.  I'd much rather go back to WF and buy the bottle and heat it up myself if this is sort of service is the norm.
author: Kathy W.

description: Really cool coffee joint that offers different types of drinks. The pirate spicy green chai piqued my interest. It tasted like a spicy matcha latte with cardamom and cloves! It was the best drink I had on my SF trip and I had many! The owners were very enthusiastic about their products which I appreciated oh so much :)
author: Lisa T.

description: I was so excited to try the iced separator and they were out. I tried the Pirates spicy green latte. The barista was no help in recommendations and kept telling me no. Pretty good drink but hopefully will have a better update when I come back and give this a better rating. Seems super cool though!
author: C Y.

description:
Very much needed in our hood (only premium coffee in area, which is weird on its own). Great coffee, love the waffle bites. 
5 stars if staff more friendly.
author: Shahar B.

description:
Love it! Very smooth, but strong, espresso drinks. I love coming here to do some light work, or just to grab it to go for my commute. It's a bit expensive but I think this is my favorite coffee place in the neighborhood. Joining the perkville thing gives you rewards, and sometimes limited-time deals. 

They also have great empanadas!
author: Wendy K.

description: So while here the music was a new experience, the service was stimulating and Sara,was a champion amongst mere mortal with her dinks in astounding like portions.
author: Matthaeo J.

description:
OK...finally a "really good" coffee shop has arrived to the Nob Hill area.

I also like the cool name too. 

When I think of "Contraband", I think of smuggling illegal exported and imported goods to elsewhere. Not that I ever participated in these unlawful activity(s). 

But there is nothing illicit about these good tasting crafted-coffee and espresso drinks here. 

I had the café's patented Latte for $3.50 and a chocolate spice doughnut made from Dynamo Donuts. The Latte is smooth and tasty. The doughnut had a unique mixture of sweetness with a pinch taste of spice. 

My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NUrDd8QedLz9G6KFC458sA?select=ZyTwd8XpjGOMUEP27dH_JA

This café is also a paradise for laptop users with its free wi-fi access. Overall laptop hangout or any occasion, this is a great place to chill with late closing hours till 10pm. 

With the café just opened only a month, it is a great addition to the Nob Hill area. Expect me to come here often to get my coffee!
author: Matt G.

description:
I'd like to give this place 4 1/2 stars. 

I had a double latte, which was expertly created. The flavor was lovely. I've had thousands of coffees all over the country, and this was one of the better ones. They clearly take pride in the art of the drink. 

Pros - interesting and more unique beverage selection than many places. They have a cool 'iced separator' (no pun intended) coconut espresso drink that they shake in a martini shaker that sounded delicious, but I didn't try it. 

Quality tasty espresso. They have soy milk in their "accessories" section!! Most cafes only give you skim or half and half to add to your drink if you want it. I applaud Contraband for having a wide selection of options. 

Lots of bar tables along the walls for working or lounging. They have a few tables outside too. 

Incredibly friendly staff. 

Cons - Pricey. Everything in SF is, but I'd say this is one of the most expensive cafes I've ever been to. I was disappointed in their selection of treats. I had hoped for a scone, but all they had was biscotti and a few croissants. Maybe they have more in the morning (I went in around 1:30pm).
author: A C.

description: Great latte! !!!!  Friendly barista.  Going to buy the Illicit beans which are the ones they used in my latte to use with my machine back in Atlanta.  Only roasted 2 days ago.
author: Chris S.

description: Love it here. Get the iced separator. It was a bit cold out this am, and asked the barista for a suggestion. He said "latte?" I said "I was thinking something a bit different." He said " well we don't have anything sweet, and the separator is sweet." Kinda snarky. (Blank stares) Well dude, if I wanted a caramel frap I'd go to Starbucks. Just wondering if there was a suggestion. This place has the right balance of good coffee, and no ass kissing because they know it. So I don't expect to have a relationship, but when I am staying here and spend on the average of $9-20 every visit and I tip. Don't make me feel like a 15 year old at Starbucks asshole! Don't shoot me for wanting to support local business. I'll keep coming back on my layovers. And when I drive down from the north, because I like a challenge.
author: Alana W.

description:
Great coffee.  I was told no talking on cell phone nicely by owner.  It would be nice to have a visible sign instead of being called out on it. I got off the phone right away. 

What bothered me was there was an older man sitting having a conversation with the owner  with his dog licking the leg of a chair.  He was allowed in there while enjoying his coffee.   Definitely not service dog, no harness.   Owner has to figure out what is best for his business, city law or making his own guidelines for his customers.  I will be back for the coffee.
author: Elio P.

description:
Coffee here was great. I had to wait a little as they initially forgot to make my order amid the chaos. Eventually a perfect pour over was delivered along with a treat for the wait.

I was surprised (happily!) By. 'Bitcoin accepted here' sign. Trying to pay with Bitcoin didn't work though. It seemed like nobody had paid that way in a while and the app for accepting Bitcoin was on a different device. No problem, I may try that again another time.
author: Michael B.

description: Best coffee ever!  They grind the beans by the cup. Great coffee selection. Nicest people too.
author: Laurie Z.

description:
Cute indoor and outdoor seating area.  Sometimes, I'm not sure if some baristas personalities are just forward or that's their nice, but certainly go for the drip coffee and espresso.  Sit outside on a nice warm day.  They have great tea options too.    Oh yea, perfect pit stop with Trader Joe's over the weekend.

Tip:  Perkville - so worth it for the free coffee.  They will also send you $4 for $7 deal.  Sooo worth it.  You know how coffee gets expensive in SF.
author: Candice H.

description:
Due to the time change and my date's guitar students lack of planning, I ended up having to burn some time in the Nob Hill area.

It was Sunday and I didn't want to commit to sitting down for brunch so I looked for coffee places in the area and Contraband Coffee Bar popped up.

Nestled in a small space on a mostly residential street, Contraband Coffee Bar feels like a neighborhood coffee joint. Neighbors were running into each other and catching up inside and outside this cozy place. Loved the sparse but warm interior. Ultimately, I ended up ordering a latte and a doughnut and sitting outside. Latte was awesome - not acidic at all! The doughnut was...less like a doughnut and more like a chocolate scone. Weird.

The only note I would give Contraband is that the lattes could stand to be a bit hotter.
author: Tara H.

description: In my visit to SF this was my go to coffee shop when I needed an escape/to get some work done. Great quality coffee, unique specialty drinks, yummy snacks, and wonderful work space.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Been here a couple of times and really enjoyed the decor and atmosphere but the coffee not so much.  Had a latte on my last visit that tasted oddly watered down, like they didn't even pull the espresso.  

The space is tight but well organized and there are a few outlets for you laptop folk. People who work here are great too but I regret not asking them about my crappy latte. I'll be back if I'm in the hood in the near future to test it out again.
author: Francis C.

description: I come here almost every weekend to grab coffee or work on the weekends. Their Sage & Rosemary Latte, Pirate Green Chai, and Ethiopian coffee are all fantastic. The pistachio croissant is also fabulous.  It can get crowded around 10am-2pm on the weekends, so best to come before 10am or in the late afternoon if you're looking to hang out for a few hours. It's pretty nice having a hot latte and working on your laptop in their outdoor area. The team that works here can be a hit or miss, but the coffee is great and its certainly a great spot in this neighborhood!
author: JJ X.

description:
Not impressed! I should be,looks progressive, close to my place.its busy with laptop goers.
I ordered a basic coffee black with my own cup.
The guy making my coffee jumped down my throat because I didn't know the coffee lingo for ordering there.got a ear full on how to appropriately order coffee here. Come on,ridiculous. 
Coffee OK, I couldn't believe how expensive. Even jamacian blue isnt over 5.00 for a cup.It's a coffee,not a mixed coctail.
What really rubbed me wrong was if you want to drink it there,they charge you dining in tax,never in my 40 years in S.F.,have I heard of such a animal for drinking a coffee.Its not food,and I'm not being served at a table..It is very interesting, because I worked in the bar and restaurant business for decades. Seems odd.
It's not my cup of coffee place for sure. I rather go to happy donuts. There's many great cool coffee houses with a bit higher price without the attitude. 
I tried it three different times.
Different strokes for different folks ..
author: Connie B.

description: Five start for sure ! The girl was sooooo knowledgeable and she actually cared about serving . Customer ahead of me wasn't sure what exactly he wanted so she took her time to understand customers taste and what he could be in the mood for . Coffee is freshly ground , good music indoor and love the aroma . Prices are bit much but I guess coffee is worth the money and service.
author: Neha K.

description: Tried the separator based on all the Yelp reviews. Not terrible, but underwhelming for a small $5 cup of coffee.
author: Nicole F.

description:
Let me preface my review by first saying that I am by no means a coffee snob.

Stepped into this breath of fresh air after hiking up Nob Hill on a cloudy day. Took a peek at the menu and it was all foreign language to me. If you think Starbucks' menu is rough, you'll have a tough time translating this menu. I thought to myself, "what is a flat white..?"  Baffled, I ordered the drink that was featured at the counter because it included a photo (the separator?)  It consisted of honey, almond, coconut milk, espresso and some other nutty flavors. 

The coconut milk most defintely threw my taste buds off. Not in an unpleasant way...but each sip I took had me more puzzled than the last. I was eventually able to down the cute mason jar filled "coffee" with ease but it took a bit getting used to.
author: Renee L.

description: Coffee was good and was pleased to find a large selection of pastries and mouthwatering donuts, but the all-male staff were very intimidating with no patience whatsoever. A quick question regarding the price of coffee beans seemed to be too much to ask and led to my mom and I being pushed off to the side as the cashier proceeded to ask for the person behind us to order ahead of us. We also couldn't get our drinks fast enough, apparently, as the barista seemed to be irritated with calling out our drinks more than once. We definitely regret giving Contraband our money and effort.
author: Simone M.

description: Picked up a cappuccino on our way back after eating breakfast. It was just as I remembered a genuine barista coffee in the US. A bit bigger than I actually wanted but I ordered a large cup. :) Will go back for more before I leave the city!
author: Annamaria S.

description:
$4.65 for a cup of coffee? 
An 'ok' cup of coffee. 
In a small (albeit cool looking) cafe. 

No thanks. 
Don't need to come back here ever again.
author: Nilu r.

description: Great coffee, nice atmosphere and friendly stuff- beat components for a great morning!
author: Maria O.

description:
They have a good coffee and I only keep going here cause it's right by my house. BUT the service I've got from the same guy is always terrible. He's incredibly rude.
Today while waiting for him to take my order I was on the phone with my sister, he was busy making two other drinks for another customer and there was no one else waiting.  He hadn't even greeted me when he looks over and says "there are no phone calls on the line". No where did I see a sign saying this but I politely hung up my phone call and proceeded to stand there awkwardly in silence while he continued make the other drinks. After he takes my order he makes my drink and just drops it at the pick up station, doesn't say anything doesn't even say have a good day! It wasn't even busy for him to not have had the time and he seemed pissed off for no reason.
I can understand the no phone rule if it was written down, but I was not just mindlessly talking and not paying attention to him, when he was ready I would have put my phone call on hold to give him my order. his tone was rude and it wasn't the first time i have received this bad attitude from him. But it was definitely the last.
I will no longer be visiting this contraband, there's another coffee shop by tjs I'd rather frequent that has good coffee and employees with a happy demeanor.
author: Angela F.

description:
Great coffee and selection of pastries.

Used to come here often when I was in the neighborhood. Recently came after a long time and unfortunately found that their internet changed to being barely useable that drops you every few minutes. Would not recommend as a working coffee shop. Just come for the coffee.
author: Alex L.

description:
For me 4.5 stars rounded up to 5 for down to earth baristas.

Not the best coffee in the city, personally I like the slow bar from Four Barrel more, although this might be the best espresso in the city.  Definitely the best espresso I've had in the city.

Chill place, nice layout, free wifi.  Great pastries.  Good stuff.  If you have a couple minutes, get a cofffee made on the blossom for there.  Fantastic machine served in a caraffee on a wooden board.  It makes me happy...
author: Chris A.

description:
3.5 Stars. 

Stopped by on our way to the 16th street tiled steps. Contraband is a small but efficent coffee bar-esque place. It's got a few high tables and some outdoor seating...it somehow feels larger than it is.

We ordered a simple latte and it came warm and had a nice smooth flavor to it. 
I'm no coffee person, so I took a few sips from the husband's cup. I think it's a little less
creamier than Philz, but nothing over the wall different. 

They have a cool selection of  pastries, including some of the donuts from Dynamo Donuts. I would've preferred if they had a backing / closure to their pastry section though. I saw a bug fly and land on the donuts which was all it took for me to not want one...
author: Mimi C.

description: Not my first time here, but this is as good as I remembered it. Baristas are chill, lots of sunlight, and great variety of drinks offered (my friend had the matcha chai latte and I a cappuccino, both delicious). We sat at the bar and the machine grinding/brewing sounds weren't too loud/distracting. They have 3 tables outside, neighborhood isn't too crowded at all even though there are two other restaurants serving brunch on the same block.
author: Jackie C.

description: My best coffee in nob hill. Also as a plus they know how to make a flat white (for those who don't know is like a stronger latte).
author: Glen T.

description:
I'm Australian and our understanding of what "good coffee" is is VERY difficult to find in the US! It's not snobbery/prejudice, it's just two very different perspectives on black gold...

I am almost completely unable to function without a large, skim latte of a morning... Proper espresso, filtered through a quality machine, with milk that has been heated/foamed just right (not just hot milk with bubbles). I panicked when I got to the US and realised how hard it would be to find what I need!

Thankfully, I'm staying opposite Contraband! They serve a decent coffee (Aussie standards)!!

The staff are generally friendly (although occasionally a bit too aloof in that I'm-a-hipster-with-statement-facial-hair-who-judges-you-for-saying-skim-instead-of-non-fat kind of way), there's free wifi and a relaxed vibe... sitting down to write an email with a morning coffee is no-fuss and enjoyable... Perfect!

Thank you for existing Contraband!
author: Guida B.

description:
Easily the best coffee I have had outside of Italy. Had a latte both times and the milk was perfectly steamed giving it that awesome creamy consistency, and not just 'hot  Milk' as is the case in so many coffee shops. The espresso was sublimely roasted with no hint of over roasting/burning. I had to return before I left Frisco to get a take out and the second time was just as good.

Interior was pretty basic but the simplicity worked. I believe free WiFi is also available.

Coffee was slightly pricier than average but happy to pay for the quality. 

Plenty of different blends of coffee available if you're going for an Americano or straight up Espresso, from Kenyan to Colombian and more. 

The name is very appropriate, coffee this good must be illegal..
author: Abdullah B.

description: Delicious golden pirates (matcha and chai)... must try!! Great coffee shop in nob hill. Lots of table room to work on your laptop or catch up with friends.
author: Didi S.

description: The coffee is consistently good, I would recommend the iced separator, it's the bomb.
author: Mikel K.

description: Having departed Nob Hill after Contraband showed up, I was determined to make it back here after passing by so many times.  It took one of my best friends getting married at the Fairmont to finally make it here, and I was SO excited. Unsure as to what I was walking in to, I asked the man behind the counter what he recommended the Costa Rica Black Pearl.  A few of my friends ordered espresso drinks and some teas, and in general, our drinks came out pretty fast.  My Costa Rica was definitely everything that was described on the menu: sweet berries, medium roast.  While I had a pleasant experience, some of my friends mentioned that the barista who was making the espresso drinks was rude to them.  I can't say that I heard any of it, but being snobby at 8am on a Saturday is unnecessary. In any case, it was definitely a good trip, I would love to try some of the delicious donuts they had showcased when I go back.
author: Lisa I.

description: Amazing coffee and empanadas! On a weekend turn around and this is the place to go! Had the drip and a latte!
author: Herrera H.

description:
2 stars, for the nice chocolate croissant. I am french so it's difficult to compete. I have to say, it's pretty good. Also the pirate's chai. Really good, not too sweet, green macha, love it. The Yemeni coffee is good too.

The cons: the rudeness of the staff, horrific. Granola and yogurt served in the package with a bowl on the side "do it your self" style.

To conclude: if you are interested in this place, take away, don't stay.
author: Aziza B.

description: The service was poor. I felt the barista was bothered by the face that I requested Service. I probably would never come back here again. The coffee itself was okay. I didn't find that it was particularly tasty.
author: Axedentol S.

description:
OMG Best coffee i ever had in my life!!
walked in at about 10:30, long ass line but it moved very quikly.
 The curly girl was super cute and nice, and made me the best coffee i'v ever had (in US). perfect temperature, silky smooth foam, and excellent espresso - milk ratio. 
I come from europe, most american coffee is a disappointment to me, so you can imagine how thriled i was to finally drink a great tasting cappuccino. 
the service was quick, warm and polite. all and all - great coffee experiance, glad i discovered this place, definitely coming back.
author: Lulu B.

description:
This is my all time favorite! Love their coffee - memorable & unique! I've tried several single origins from other coffee bar, but this one is the best - well balanced and full flavor (not diluted). Americano and espresso always have layer of crema - an indication of freshness :) 

must be honest though.. I would try to avoid mustache days..  (Why focus on the bad apple?) other staff are super friendly, receptive to feedback, address customer by first name .. How many places actually do that?
author: B N.

description:
+ Good coffee (great selection and tasty soy lattes) 
+ Good service (the baristas were happy to recommend their favorites)
+ Thank Jeebus they have Dynamo Donuts (but you need to get there early before they're all snatched up)!
author: Adena B.

description:
Was in the area and needed to do some light work.  I ate breakfast around the corner a couple of times and thought this spot deserved a visit. 

Nice space, lots of table area and outdoor options when the weather is cooperating.  I don't know if I got the luck of the straw but I entered with two others just squeaking in front of me.  So there's 3 of us in line and a single barista.  The barista is trying to be efficient, but takes an order and than makes said item.  So instead of ringing and taking orders for 3 of us all at once and letting us get comfortable, I patiently wait for 10 minutes while she executes a chai, rings up next customer and than makes a latte.  

While this is happening, another co-worker comes in.  No acknowledgement to customers patiently waiting in line.  He just opens his laptop and starts surfing.  Then takes the garbage out.  Almost walks into a customer with a mop not saying excuse me (even if it wasn't his fault).  

To be fair, the barista had a smile on her face.  The cappuccino I ordered was ok, a little too thin for my creed.

If you're in the area and want a cup, this place will do.  If you're willing to spend 30 mins trying to find a parking spot for a really good cup of joe, this place might upset you.
author: Kevin H.

description:
One of the best coffee shops in this part of the city. They have an amazing variety of single origins which keeps changing (or rather increasing) every now and then. The Kenya and the Ethiopean  are some of the really complex single origins I have ever tasted. The place is wonderful for working (strong free wifi) and the espresso products are equally or even more rich in taste. 
They have a coffee made on this high pressure device called the blossom which seems to be a big hit already. I am a regular here and the baristas are super friendly. One of them (I think her name was Sarah) made me a pretty amazing cappuccino after one of my weekend runs (when I did not have my wallet on me) and insisted that it was on her :) 
Many more visits going forward.
author: Ankan S.

description: Humph... From the price and reviews, I expected more... The mocha was lukewarm and I'm not one to want super hot beverages but this was really on the brink of not hot enough... I always drink almond milk espresso drinks but somehow this one didn't mix well? I'm not sure what happened there... Maybe it just didn't get hot enough.  And lastly the barista was a grump. He didn't smile once, looked like he really didn't want to be there and was overall unfriendly. Also both for my drinks and the girl before, neither of us hard him say they were ready so they sat there a while before we realized... I wanted to more like this place so this is disappointing...
author: A-S R.

description:
It was a Friday morning, it had been a long week. I needed coffee and I wanted biscotti. I had noticed Contraband on previous strolls around the neighborhood and decided to stop in. 

It was a quieter bunch of patrons, most of them working away on laptops. I ordered an Americano and decided to try the cranberry and pistachio biscotti, and because they were small, I also got a chocolate drizzled anise flavored one. No judgements, it was Friday.

I wasn't able to decided on a particular bean for the drip coffee and also, I didn't particularly want to pay $4.50 for one but there is a good selection if thats your thing.

The coffee was tasty but the biscotti were soft and crumbly, not hard and crunch. The flavors were good, I'm glad I sprung for both!

I might go back for coffee but to be honest, the barista wasn't especially friendly and they have taken San Francisco pricing a bit too seriously.
author: Ellen B.

description:
This was a walk by decision while waiting for a car repair near by.  I only had a cup of the decaf coffee which was fine but it looked like they had some very tasty items to eat.  There were a lot of people who seem to be enjoying them so I'm thinking they are good.

The shot is nicely arranged with tables both in and out and a lot of room to work and still have some privacy.  the free wifi was OK, I ran a speedtest:

Download 1.43mbps
Upload 0.67mpbs

Not blazing fast but fine to check mail and surf the web.

Good experience and I would go back - try it out....
author: Drew M.

description:
My coffee is fine, but I'll never be back because of what a colossal asshat the guy working was. No greeting, talks to you like you're an idiot and intentionally rude. 

I asked what the quiche was and he says 'Broccoli'. Ok cool. I like broccoli. He then pours my iced coffee and proceeds to put it on the other side of the espresso machine while I'm still finishing paying. He actually went further out of his way to put my drink down than he would have to just give it to me. 

I then wait forever because he never called out the quiche and I find it sitting there cold and it's broccoli and bacon - I'm veg. Thanks, dick.
author: cassandra m.

description: Only coffee shop open late in the area so we decided to make a stop. Inside decor was nice and simple. Quality was meh and a bit overpriced in my opinion.
author: Yolanda C.

description:
$3.25 for an iced americano at a good local shop that doesn't brew Sightglass, Blue Bottle, or Fourbarrel? Yes please. Sign me up. Also, the option to not have a cold brew coffee for once? Yes. Yes. Yes.

I don't live anywhere close to Nob Hill, but if I'm ever in the neighborhood, you bet I'm coming back here.
author: Sharon L.

description:
I remember the first time I visited Contraband. 

It was July of last year, and I had just spent the weekend moving in to my apartment. I was eager to explore the surrounding area, where some very different (and recognizable) neighborhoods bleed into one another. Russian Hill is easily accessible to the north; the affluence of the top of Nob Hill looms to the east; Pac Heights is just a little west - but you need to cross the bar-and-restaurant-filled Polk Gulch first; and the beautiful California Street bustles with its cable cars toward the south, with the TenderNob close by. 

Admittedly, I was overwhelmed. I was determined to find an identity within this seemingly hodgepodge intersection of lifestyles, activities and communities. I spent most of my afternoon trekking through the area in a wide loop. By the time I reached California and Larkin, I was exhausted and, like the caffeine-addicted San Franciscan I am, really in need of coffee. 

Walking up Larkin, that's when I saw it. A welcoming red awning jutting out over the sidewalk. Two large windows showcasing locals sipping on coffee, some chatting in pairs, others busily working solo on their laptops or peering back out at me. Wire tables and chairs outside with a few groups, smokers and dogs lazily enjoying the weekend. It was like the light at the end of the tunnel. Could this be my new go-to coffee shop? 

There was only one way to find out.

I walked through the door, and was immediately greeted by a wood, white-black-and-red-themed interior. A cool old-school letterboard on one of the walls listed some standard espresso drinks. The smaller menus on the counter had an assortment of drip coffee, teas, and snacks. The barista could tell that I'd never been before and was pleasant enough to walk me through some of the menu. In the end, I went for the soy cappuccino. You can tell that the baristas here treat the process of making espresso drinks as a true trade. My carefully-crafted soy cap had some beautiful latte art. Just the right amount of foam. 

It tasted like the best espresso drink I'd ever had...except better. This was my new home coffee shop. I've never looked back.

As I started to go on a regular basis, it didn't take long for me to strike up a conversation with Josh, the owner. He's a really great, hands-on guy who knows how to run a coffee shop. He often works the morning shifts on his own. Always sociable and welcoming, Josh does his best to promote a sense of community in the area. Contraband has hosted numerous events on weekends, such as waffle-making or brewing lessons. They rotate local artists' pictures on the walls. Josh and his business partner clearly have a sense of humor (ask them what the wireless password is). No matter what time of day you drop in, if there are two or more baristas behind the counter, they're having a good time, even when the line gets long. I'm pretty sure Josh knows most (if not all) of the regulars by name...and their favorite drinks. 

One of the greatest things Contraband has done - besides the excellent coffee - is to create a focal point for the people in our neighborhood. Many of the local store owners frequent each other's businesses, and Contraband is no exception. The 'regulars' tend to run into each other throughout the area as well, whether it's over food, drinks, or grocery shopping. They all have Contraband in common.

I've noticed the main points of contention that bubble up in Contraband's rare negative Yelp reviews are the 'hipster vibe', or the 'pretentiousness'. To those of you who feel unwelcome, I urge you to stop in a few more times. I think folks are often intimidated by a coffee shop that roasts its own beans, boasts a snazzy espresso machine, and has baristas who actually know a thing or two about coffee. Like any relationship, it just takes a little time. I've never felt so at home in a coffee shop before.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Bottom line: Typical coffee shop. I would go again to sit outside. 

Baked goods aren't out of this world and little pricey. I had an egg and bacon empanda (definitely not traditional but it worked well enough) and passion fruit donut with chocolate chunks (I would have liked pecans crumbled on top instead of chocolate to balance with the sweet tart passion fruit). I washed those down with some great pu'er tea. 

The best part about is place is the seating and short line during prime café hours. Choose among outdoor, window counter, or laptop table seating! 

I chatted it up with some other folks soaking up the sun and had a great Sunday morning. I'll be back for the seating options and a drink. Hell, I'll try the other baked goods. 

SF has so many great cafés. This place is just average among the hundreds of other cafés in the city but hey, there is nothing wrong with average.
author: Matthew T.

description: I have a new favorite place to get coffee when visiting the City. This is one of the best soy lattes I have ever had, very smooth. Terry helped me the past two days that I came by, he is a master barista. Ask for him, he will take care of you.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Lame hipster spot.  Not that I'm against hipster spots.  This is just a lame hipster spot.

My coffee wasn't hot!  I'm not a fan of the drip method if my coffee ain't hot!

They ran out of cream at the fixings bar and by the time I got some, my coffee was really not hot.

I ended up taking a few sips and then tossing it.

Staff are not cool or nice.
author: Li J.

description:
Charming little place. I'm Australian and I love that I can order a "flat white" here.

Great quality stuff
author: Bianca D.

description:
Coffee amazing! Guys behind the counter are pretty unfriendly.  The just seem unhappy to be there.  This has been my second time in and I was hoping the first bad attitude I experienced was a fluke. Bummer since I was really looking for a solid neighborhood coffee shop because I just moved to area.  I will try again here and if I experience any different, I'll update review.

In a nutshell:  If you want a good cup of coffee awesome place but if you want a good cup of coffee with a warm fuzzy feeling inside or appreciate friendly customer service, try somewhere else.
author: Kristi R.

description: Sunday morning after the Skrillex show, we had to find an epic brunch spot. Of course being brunch time on Sunday mornings in San Francisco, there is definitely a high possibility that you will be waiting for at least an hour any where you go. As we were waiting outside to be seated at Mymy next door, I was becoming irritably hungry, tired, and cold. As I entered the coffee bar, I immediately knew this was a hipsters paradise. I ended up ordering a small nonfat mocha. When it was done, I was a little disappointed that the barista didn't bother making some form of latte art like all the other drinks especially since I paid a pretty penny for the drink. As for the mocha itself, I definitely loved the strong flavored coffee flavor that wasn't masked by tons of milk, sugar, and chocolate. Overall, other than the lack of presentation, the mocha itself definitely made up for it.
author: Cristal C.

description:
Grabbing brunch at Olea, I sighted a new coffeeshop I hadn't visited! Contraband, situated in a small space within the residential Nob Hill area, was a surprising find. I had to go in...

Out of all the coffee shops and roasters I've visited, Contraband is the only one I know that can brew your coffee using a Blossom. I didn't really know much about it (even now, only a general idea), but the barista told me it's a combination between a French press and an espresso machine. I had to try...

I didn't really get much from it. The coffee was alright, and I didn't see any differences in the use of the Blossom, in comparison to an actual French press (pour over, or other brewing method). Whether it was the coffee or the Blossom, I wasn't impressed...

Overall, I thought it was alright. Nothing special, and a tad overpriced for ordering coffee using the Blossom. I'll have to try more from them to see if there's better stuff.
author: Kevin J.

description:
A well designed space where you'll be served quality, expertly prepared coffee while listening to a tasteful music.

Try the Cortado or the cold brew.
author: Vladimir C.

description: Minimal, earthy, artsy. I come here every time i have a hair appointment. I always seem to find parking near by and the people working are always friendly. Plenty to choose from including single origin. Coffee snobs enjoy : )
author: Bauble C.

description:
The coffee here is good.

I got a low fat latte (1/2 skim and 1/2 whole milk)  and it was tasty!  The espresso was strong, but not burnt. Feel me?  

I also got the banana bread (nut free!), which I was told was made at Batter.  It was OK.  The flavor was good, but it was a little dry.  

There's free WiFi and it has a memorable password.  I chuckled a little when the barista told it to me.
author: Marisa R.

description:
Good coffee. I tried the Ethiopian and Guatemalan drip. I got much different flavor notes than they did, but the coffee was good non the less. 

They roast their own coffee, just not on site. The reason for the three stars is that the shop was dirty and they didn't bother to clean up empty cups or plates.
author: Logan S.

description: Wasn't able to try the Kyoto style ice coffee but they apologized and luckily their other cold brew made up for it. Friendly staff and Dynamo donuts are a reason alone to give them a shot.
author: Xavier L.

description: Great little coffee spot but regularly close their doors earlier than posted, like right now 25 mins early
author: Chris K.

description:
Nice, modern coffee shop.  I had a cup of their lattes while waiting for brunch across the street with a friend.  I didn't like how my cup of joe wasn't hot, but it was still enjoyable to look at the coffee art on the top.  

This place isn't too expensive and it has good quality beans.  Nice to enjoy a cup of coffee on a Saturday afternoon.
author: Nancy S.

description: I used to really like Contraband. The coffee is always good. I've just noticed the overall maintenance of the shop has gone down. Counter-tops and tables are always covered in crumbs, gnats always flying around, and just a general feeling of things being unclean. Coffee is great, just get it to go...
author: Danielle H.

description:
Unreliable opening hours. That's a deal breaker.
Used to be a regular when I lived around the neighborhood. Great coffee, decent pastry choices, ok decor, fairly laptop friendly. Took quite a bit of effort to come back to this, and saw the notice on the counter that they closes early today. Which they didn't care to post on their Twitter, and I take it as they don't care about their customers' time.
author: Roy C.

description: I went in here to grab a cup of coffee instead of at starbucks or one of the chains. I was shocked that my large cup of coffee was over $6. It was a decent cup but I dont think I would go back.
author: Kristan B.

description: I found Contraband today because it's a close walk from my place and I was looking for some coffee shop that is study/work friendly (so yes, I was definitely one of those laptop-campers, probably why I feel compelled to write this review). I like how they cover most of your needs-- pastry options, a bathroom, water (this is important to me ok), a large table in the middle for people like me to do work, stools near the windows, some small tables, and a few outside in case you're there to chat with a friend. The vibe is nice too, lots of people coming in and out while there are also people chilling and working. Coffee is delicious. My only gripe as a laptop-goer is to please have more outlets!!!!!!!! There's literally only one.
author: Connie W.

description: Coffee is good, but they over charge. A few of the hipster baristas are very pretentious, except the blond girl she's chill
author: Melanie K.

description: Great capaccino! Best in the neighborhood. Food is on the pricy side and I kinda wish they have some healthy options to eat not just bakeries and sweets. But overall it's a great place for coffee.
author: Yumi Y.

description:
Not even 15 seconds upon entering and this place already went off to a bad start. There was no one in line. One lady just paid for her order and the barista told me "Oh. It'll be about five minutes." Five minutes for what? Tell me why at least so I won't be judgmental about it. Did she have a big order? (A few minutes later, I saw she only ordered two drinks. Again, there was no line. If this is about giving customers personal attention or devoting all your energy to making drinks, that's fine. But apparently he cancelled out that rationale for me.) And then when I asked him (since he needed five minutes and I needed to kill the time) if there was a wifi code, he said "Sir. I will get to you in a minute with all that information." "Umm... okay..." I was just about ready to go, but I paid 2 bucks on the MUNI to get here and I'm gonna stay. Hey, I'm a grad student so 2 bucks means a lot --- especially in an expensive city like this. He said "I can help the next person." I walked over from the communal table/stools, and I said "Could I please have a double espresso over ice?" "I don't do espresso over ice." Hmmm okay... then he said, "I can do an iced Americano." I don't understand why you can't do espresso over ice when that's basically what an Americano is after the ice melts (I can't stand watered down Americanos.) Anyway, the Americano came out to $3.80. Holy smokes. I know this is a gourmet coffee/espresso boutique brand, but $3.80? (I think the most I've paid for an Americano is $3.50 from Intelligentsia so Contraband wins! It's the Robin Leach of espresso bars!) I felt like that should come with at least a few biscuit! Geez. 

He gives me the password information for the wifi, I get my drink, and it's fine... I'm not altogether crazy about the flavor of their espresso. It's silky and creamy (I'll give them that.)... but there's an aftertaste of something like stale espresso. For $3.80, I expected to taste like liquid gold. It was more like liquid silver. Meh. 

The interior is fine... not very cohesive in style and aesthetic. The communal table has fresh flowers in sunken vases. Lots of birch action happening with the wood (not really a fan of birch. So generic!)... and there are some interesting (the default word when you don't have anything else to say) art pieces inside. Anyway, between the passive aggressive barista (I couldn't tell if by his "sir"s and strange way of dealing customers -- or, at least to me if he was being respectful or... passive aggressive), the humdrum espresso (and annoyance that I can't order espresso over ice), and the Willie Nelson or Garth Brooks (I can't deal with this country music. My ears were bleeding!) playing, there was no chance of me returning. I was hungry and wanted one of the famous Dynamo Donuts, but I didn't wanna spend another dime there.
