First impressions matter, and though it might be just one barista, that was enough for me to say "No thanks, Contraband. Buhhhhhbye." I've been to over a hundred coffeeshops in SF, Chicago, LA, DC, NYC, and other cities (yes, I've kept count) and this has the honor of being my lowest rated one. Luckily, there are dozens of other places in San Francisco to patronize. 

(Oh... and after just reading the other reviews of this place, apparently several other folks have had issues with the barista with the mustache. Okay, I guess it makes me feel a little better that he's rude to others -- not that that is something to feel good about! Not exactly needing warm and fuzzy, but just be cordial!)
author: James Z.

description:
If I could rate the coffee and customer service separately, I absolutely would!

While the coffee was excellent (5 stars), the gentleman behind the counter was condescending and made me feel like a heathen for ordering a drip coffee without having first memorized the entire coffee menu. Please, be less pretentious and actually be nice to your customers. Will probably not come back here.
author: Alex S.

description: The cappuccino I ordered was pretty average. It was a little bitter and came in a really small cup for a 'large'. Great atmosphere and friendly staff though.
author: Johann B.

description:
Staff has attitude. 

I went there for getting work done (and grabbed a coffee) but the barista decided to close the cafe prior to "close" hours b/c it wasn't busy. Now I go to Another Cafe around the block.
author: Sharon M.

description:
COFFEE:
Ethiopian drip coffee

SERVICE: friendly staff :)

ATMOSPHERE:
Love it. Ppl working on laptops. Nice modern feel. Lots of bartops, big community table.

14
author: Angela L.

description:
smh.
Terrible customer service.

(To the coffee drinkers): Make sure you know what every item on the menu is...and DON'T ask any questions.  This way...the person behind the counter won't snap at you...or talk to you as if you were dumb.

(To the staff): Goodness..if you don't want to serve people...DON'T be in customer service!!!
author: Nancy T.

description: 5 Stars for coffee drinks, less one for pretentious barista's. Seems like you need to be hipster with macbook or writing journal in-hand to get decent service. That said, coffee is great and I highly recommend the iced separator - good anytime, but especially the morning after a long night out.
author: F G.

description: I wanted to love this coffee place, it's a tiny little storefront (probably has enough seating for about 20 people). Ordered the pistachio croissant, an iced latte, and a chai latte and it set me back $13 (a pretty penny for not even a real breakfast). I have to say the coffee and the croissant were both pretty amazing. They also note that they only allow service dogs in their space but that you can just inform them of such if your dog is one and they won't ask additional questions and/or proof so I would say relatively dog friendly policy.
author: Betty C.

description: Contraband is a great addition to the artisan coffee movement in the city. The blends are of gourmet quality, but the brand doesn't exactly scream hipster or snooty either. The space is small, but comfortable enough to enjoy a cup of your favorite coffee without being disturbed. The baristas are competent at doing latte art and the coffee is good and strong. They also carry a number of snacks such as Dynamo donuts (gone by the afternoon), waffles, and empanadas.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Correct me if I'm incorrect, this location has been pretty empty of craft coffee. Thus, Contraband to the rescue! Took a walk up appointment at Peoples, and took the wait time as a chance to finally get over here. A pretty straightforward setup with nice high top communal tables, bar at the window seating and, my favorite thing, which I'd love to see more of at coffee stops, is counter bar seating. 

They roast their own & they stand as strong as the other specialty roasters in the city with delicate roasting & brewing methods. They use the glass, flat-bottom Kalita pour over set up, and the results are wonderful. 

If I were in the neighborhood more, I'd be more & all the time. Anyone in the area on the regular, take note.
author: Jon A.

description:
I mean these guys can do no wrong.  I come here at least once a week, they have rejuvenated my hope for the coffee world.  But I find I don't have to be here every morning fighting with the commuting wild.

I like to come by on sunny afternoons and get some work done.  Usually its a latte, and a donut, both of which are phenomenal (donuts compliments of Dynamo).  

Today, however, I ventured for their coffee.  They have options, so dont be intimidated.  They also give you space to read and decide.  Now, I havent enjoyed a really good black cup of coffee in a long time.  See above, lost hope for the coffee blah blah. Im not a snob, really, but I was a barista for a short while here.  And today, I had an amazing cup of just black coffee, with nothing added to it on my end.  I wont keep secrets, it was the Ethiopian Yergacheffe Blue Nile.  Im not even sure what all that means, except maybe the first part.  And in their description, they even scoffed at even using cream and sugar in it.  And they were right. As usual.
author: Todd B.

description:
Smooth decaf with a nice tart finish which pairs well with a savory croissant (kale or prosciutto).

Free wifi (sign up via email or fb) along with few electrical sockets to juice your laptop so you can happily work without distraction.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Lousy coffee, nice space.
The staff is hit or miss, lots of misses.
The manager asks me every time if I want food.
I never do.
The food is not appealing and not healthy.
I wish he would stop asking me.
I've been here dozens of times.
author: Isley T.

description:
I don't know if I just haven't had a good latte before, but Contraband's lattes are amazingly perfect and should be known as the latte-ultra or something similar. Beautiful foam art, perfect blend of creaminess, not at all harsh or bitter.

They offer a rewards program as well, so if you enter your e-mail address in their on-the-counter iPad, you accrue points and get a free cup of joe, or free coffee beans, etc. Lighting is good for studying, free wi-fi, and the people working there know everyone by name and face. Not that big but big enough.

Something they can improve is centralizing their menu; on the wall is a list, but then on bulletin boards on the counter are other lists. Wish they were all localized on one wall.
author: Christine Y.

description:
The coffeeshop of my dreams.

Clean, modern interior. Great service. Beyond just coffee.

Its the perfect coffeeshop without the snoot. The shop is small but outfitted with mostly shared-space tables. Personally, I'm a fan of co-working spaces and this is one of them. The walls feature the works of local artists and their main table is inlaid with a planter in the center which houses fresh flowers. Ambiance-setters which deserve recognition.

When I inevitably make my move to the Bay Area, I hope my nest is within walking distance of Contraband. It's not the crowded, bustling, commercial coffeeshop of my current reality. Your cup will take longer than expected. But who can complain with freshly ground coffee--as in freshly ground made-to-order.

Contraband roasts their beans in-house which are derived from various coffee-spots around the world. They even have a rotating selection which changes from time to time. Who can complain with variety? On my visit, there were four or five coffees to choose from. I went with the Guatemala and Kenyan varieties. 6-7 minutes later, I got my cups of fresh drip coffee, purchased a couple bags of beans (which they grind according to your specification) and kissed Contraband goodbye.

Until next time!
author: Yuhi K.

description: Great little coffee place. Espresso was just perfect. They even have a rewards program. Amazing little coffee house.
author: Marie D.

description: I was visiting San Francisco from out of town and was told to check out Contraband while there.  So I stopped in and it was just as excellent as I had been told. This is a really great little place with lovely decor of rotating artwork along with superbly crafted coffee. The barista named Bret was really nice and told me about some other great places in the neighborhood. I will definitely go back when I return to San Francisco, and have recommended it to all my friends. This place is a real find.
author: Karen H.

description: Smells like coffee and sells interesting pastries and desserts. My main complaint is that they give you the tea w/ a steeper, but not anywhere convenient to put it as it drips all over the place.
author: Leslie H.

description: Three stars for good iced coffee and great location. Don't go here if you only have a few minutes to spare or like to get your coffee efficiently in a friendly environment. Even if there's no line, the slow-moving people behind the counter take their time....very slowly....in a slightly pretentious manner, might I add, which is not ideal when you're just looking for a coffee before you get to work. If you need to stay to work and rely on wifi, don't go here, it will take a day and a half for one tab to load. Oh, and they don't run AC even on hot summer days. And to echo all the other reviews, the staff initially comes off extremely arrogant and unfriendly, but take the time and make small talk and you'll leave without judgment and in the same mood you were in before.
author: Casey L.

description:
While customer service, smiling, and just being personable people are not their strong suits (I'm actually writing this review as the barista forgot to make my coffee and after I asked him if my coffee was ready, didn't apologize or anything and just said he'd make another cup), their coffee is pretty good and atmosphere here is quiet

So it depends on what you want: If you want to come here to grab a cup of joe and chill out / bring your laptop to do some work - this place is great.

If you want a place with a friendly, warm vibe where the people working there are actually nice - go down the street to Philz or somewhere else.
author: Clifford T.

description:
OMG dynamo donuts a few blocks from my  house!!

very sleek and modern coffee shop full of hipsters and tattoos serving superbly made (albeit, quite $$$) lattes.

love it.
author: Josie M.

description: Great quality of donut but extremely expensive! Two iced drinks and two donuts for $14.50 is a bit pricey. I have had bigger and cheaper donuts. 3-4 varieties available today. Great to try at least once! Nice outdoor table and chairs for the beautiful SF weather :)
author: Anna G.

description:
I walked over to Contraband Coffee Bar from Embarcadero Bart Station which is a long walk up the hill on Calif. St.  I wanted to walk, but they usually have a Cable Car that goes up Calif, this weekend it's not running, but they have a Muni shuttle.

I got a Latte $3.50 & they do latte art.  I got it for here and it was nice.  I think they do the art even on to-go orders.

There's a bunch of chairs by window & outdoors, plus communal table to sit & kill time.

They have cookies from Mission Beach Cafe.  I like their chocolate chip cookie w/ nuts - delicious, but didn't get one this time.

If you use your credit card & it's under $5, they charge an extra .25c so I paid Cash.

They have one unisex bathroom in the back on the Left.
author: Ann L.

description: Horrible horrible service. Went in about 6pm to order the "separator". Man cleaning not paying attention to me trying to order without any hesitation rudely yells at me "sorry i don't make that anymore" so why the fcuuu is it on the menu? So I ask if I can order a shot over ice "no I can't make that either" so wtffff.
author: Anjo C.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker, but their drinks have a kick to pick you up.  Plus, they offer an assortment of pastries and snacks, ranging from muffins, cookies to donuts.  Among the variety of flavors, I love the maple bacon dynamo donut.  

This is a swanky, clean cyber cafe to hang out and surf the web.  Service is fast, friendly and helpful.  Parking can be tough on the street, but check this place out if you're waiting for any of the local eats or looking for a place to lounge around.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Incredible coffee!!!!!! Lot of people work there with laptops. Very nice place and nice music on background. The guy never smile and it's a shame. 
You should try this coffee fellas!
author: Riccardo S.

description: The coffee is good but it is $5-$6 a cup. But the real annoying part is the internet. Not only did it take a long time to connect... it requires data on you email, gender, dob, etc. I am not at an airport, i am a customer that just paid $6 for a coffee! Come on!! Go somewhere
author: Keith R.

description: Love, love, love the Separator! Staff is super chill and nice. Inside or outside is clean and relaxing!
author: Audrey R.

description:
If I lived anywhere near here, chances are, it'd be my new go-to neighborhood coffee shop. Unfortunately, since corner coffee shops are something that should be easily accessible, I doubt there's any possible way I could become a regular unless I happen to be running errands in the area, or I wake up in a strange place in-or-around Larkin and California. Eyyy oh!

With that being said, it's gourmet coffee without the usual caffeinated, snobby attitude that comes as baggage with other spots of similar ilk. The folks behind the counter are friendly, it's not laced with trust fund hipsters, and the accommodations are cheeky and inviting. 

They also sell an array of pastries, and my favorite, Dynamo Donuts! I still wish there were a place closer to my pad in Alamo Square where I could get my hands on some of the best donuts on the planet, but it is easier for me to get to Contraband than venturing to the outer Mission. That might be worth repeat visits in-and-of-itself!

*Note to anyone slinging coffee in my 'hood: start selling Dynamo! You'll murder the competition!

If you're not a donut fan, they also sell Peasant Pies, empanadas, and as referenced earlier, a spread of pastries like muffins and croissants. Nothing hot, but they will warm your pastries upon request.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Fun coffee place with a variety of unique blends. The spot is a little isolated but worth it if you're interested in trying coffee spots in SF
author: Jim N.

description: The Guatamala Quichè is a nice pour-over. If you really want to bring out its floral tones try having it prepared in their Blossom device. It's been described as a precision AeroPress. So its especially good when combined with Latin and South American beans.
author: Alex B.

description: Great spot to grab a drink and work on the laptop. The green tea latte wasn't so good, but their coffees and treats are. Sunny sidewalk during the morning. I hear their chai is good!
author: Jacqueline S.

description: Came here on a recommendation with a coworker.  So glad that we did.  The coffee was heavenly.  We typically grab coffee from Peet's or Starbucks, but Contraband didn't have the burnt taste that those two do, and we didn't miss it at all.  Also saw that they have empenadas and Dynamo donuts.  Will definitely have to return for a snack.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Open until 9, Contraband has become my go-to place to work. The snug space has a nice variety of seating with a communal table, a couple two-seater tables (hard to snag but my favorite for spreading out papers), window seating, and a counter where you can chat with the baristas as they do their long, slow pour.

To eat, they offer a well-curated and diet-killing variety of Dynamo donuts, Neighbor Bakehouse pastries, Nucha empanadas, waffles, croissants, etc. I just wish they served lunch.

The best part about Contraband is the music. The playlists keep me happy, energized and working.
author: Cecilia L.

description: Sleek, warm, hip. Nice folks. Lots of space to sit inside and outside. Yummy pastries. And you can get a Cortado instead of a Latte. You can be super coffee geek here.
author: Rassamee H.

description:
I like this place!! 

Delicious, smooth, quality coffee.
Full of locals since it's tucked away in the Russian Hill apartments.
Communal table, perfect for studying or socializing. 
Lots of counter space and chairs to sit and do work. 
Not unfriendly baristas. Unique pastries and snacks. 
Outdoor seating. Bathroom. Modern. Clean. 
Attractive, bold store logo on their walls and mugs. 

Really, what more could you ask for?
author: Allie E.

description:
The espresso and coffee are 5 stars, no question.  I used to regularly buy their espresso roast and use it at home.  Personally, I prefer their espresso to all the other big SF names - Sightglass, Blue Bottle, Four Barrel, etc.

BUT the vibe in there is why I don't hang out inside.  The owner seems like a nice guy, but another employee has such a grumpy, douchy attitude that I can't take it.  

Great espresso and coffee though...
author: Dane P.

description:
Shout-out to Jill and Robert(?) for great customer service during my visit on the morning of Monday, 4/22. 

Robert made the best and hottest coffee I've had there in a long time. Jill made sure I had fresh cream (i.e. straight out of the fridge) for my coffee just as I was walking up to the coffee condiments bar. She also voluntarily took my empty plate and cup as I was heading toward the bus trays. Last, but not least, she has a great, friendly smile that made my morning.

Heads-up: There is very loud construction taking place just outside the cafe, so bring your good headphones.
author: Michael O.

description:
Espresso high.

I'm a fan of Contraband. It's nice that I live right next door, but even if I had to walk several more blocks, I'd probably make the trek.

I'm a fan of simple and clean decor which Contraband succeeds in executing.

Clean rustic woods with white walls, glass, and modern seating. From a design standpoint, I tend to appreciate simple coffeeshops where I can focus on the task at hand, rather than watching other people or distracted by coziness (though this can be good as well).

So, connecting the dots... Contraband has strong, tasty coffee and on-point espresso. Their design and layout is exceedingly minimalistic and simple; allowing you to use your caffeine high effectively, and get twerkin'

They have speedy wifi; small capacity (maybe 20 customers can fit inside?), bench seating along the bar and the walls with huge bright windows, bathroom (unisex), and a few wall outlets distributed about the cafe.

This cafe is less suited to large crowds, group work, and conversation; please take those to a larger space and save Contraband for individual caffeine sessions. That said, the outside sidewalk is spacious and conducive to meeting with friends over coffee.

Contraband. #WINNING.

Protip #1: Donuts, pastries, muffins in the glass display.
Protip #2: WiFi Cafe (no time limit)
Protip #3: There are two small tables outside (inner seating consists of 2 small tables, 2 long bar benches facing the windows, and one shared high table in the middle of the cafe)
author: Roy C.

description: Hipster place with a lot of seating. The coffee is amazing. Great place to study!
author: Sahrenah S.

description:
Mmm, Ethopian coffee :)
This is a small shop, and there is definitely a wait, but it's well worth it. My coffee was so complex, so smooth that I thought about it all day. Great neighborhood vibe, friendly barristers.
I shall return.
author: Scott H.

description:
The guy working here has a super awesome mustache and my cappuccino was perfect (nice leaf design too!)

I usually get the empanadas, but I think I need some Dynamo donuts next time! At least I won't have to go all the way out to Mission. 

Or maybe a cookie.

If the weather is nice enough, sit outside! :)
author: Kei H.

description:
Nothing like when the barista slow-drips your coffee, dripped-to-order! A little longer of a wait, but of course, totally worth it for coffee snobs like myself :) Guatemalan blend is a lighter roast, but good nonetheless. Great service, although it can be a little loud inside.

They also sell Dynamo Donuts here, so got to kill 2 birds with one stone (I'm visiting for the weekend and so must optimize food list with time) - Chocolate Spice donut was a win. Never thought some salt and spice would go with a donut... until now.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I'm not sure what it is, Contraband, but our relationship is SO love and hate.  But the more desperate I've been to find a go-to place to get tweaked by caffeine and the pixels off my laptop, the more you FAIL to turn me on.

I swear that the uncomfortable ratio, between chair height and table, is by design!! It's like how retail stores blast music so you impulse shop or why Barnes & Noble removed all the comfy seats so that you can't linger; Contraband's hard seats and tall counters make it really hard to slave away on your macbook, without killing your back! Another example of this is when the barista shooed me from their adjacent counter because they, "don't want laptops, in this area, because it's a space for conversation." 

Well said, barista-guy! This is a nice joint for kicking back and enjoying conversation--which is probably hence its name: Coffee BAR. But, although I'd love to stay and chat, I AIN'T GOT TIME FOR THAT!
author: Diane N.

description: Coffee. Meh.  Nothing to me rite home about.  Was misaligned with the reviews it had.  It was stifling hot and uncomfortable inside. The service was poor and the server was confrontational and rude.  I guess if you're looking for average coffee and don't care about atmosphere this is the place for you.
author: Joseph N.

description: Delicious coffee, reasonably priced. I ordered the flat white. The baristas were friendly and the atmosphere was pleasant and sunny. We loved the bird-of-paradise planter in the bar.
author: Allie H.

description: One of the best lattes I've ever had and one of the best coffee shops in the city! Definitely a cute, quiet spot for a delicious afternoon pick me up.
author: Rachael B.

description: Epic space & one of the only that I know of that has free wifi in SF. But very over priced. My tea was 4.75. If you're down for really bizzare/trendy coffee combos or innovations then this is your spot.
author: Kennedy D.

description:
At Contraband you can grab a decent coffee and sit outside in the sun (this place is basking in sunshine all morning). The pastries are sourced from a local provider (almost as good as a European pastry). 

Not too busy, always room to sit, even on weekends.
author: Amy M.

description: A decent place in Nob Hill to chill and drink some coffee. It's pricey coffee and made one cup at a time, and there's good street seating for people-watching. inside isn't super conducive to chilling out from my perspective.
author: Andrew K.

description:
2/26/13

Nonfat latte was perfect except it could be a little hotter. Perfect execution in terms of milk steaming. The crema stays til the last drop. Beautiful latte art. Very tasty. Uniform and bold texture. Friendly barista. $4.
author: Matt Y.

description: I'm not a huge fan of this place, in all honesty. I'm all for small business, but the staff isn't super friendly and the drinks aren't that original. It's not worth the line, in my opinion!
author: Austin O.

description:
I stopped by to get some work done while waiting for my car to get repaired at Too Good Auto Body and had a fine experience. It's a nice, mellow place to hang out and get some work done. They have a good selection of teas that don't come from those average tea bags you can get at grocery stores - makes the ~$2 seem more worth paying.

Free good wifi and a calm atmosphere. No complaints here!
author: Amanda C.

description: Fantastic spot. Had a washed Ethiopian brewed in a Kalita Wave; a savory pastry (kale, squash, manchego); and finished with the house espresso. All fantastic. Good vibe: a decent amount of seating with background music. Left with a bag of the Yirgacheffe!
author: Joshua S.

description: Great flat white and tons of open seating to do work, but the wifi is super slow.
author: Amin S.

description: I love this place. Very nice spot to sit tight and get your work done while drinking coffee. Coffee can be better, but the atmosphere is so nice. That makes me to come back here
author: Alina K.

description: My wife and I have lived in the neighborhood for a couple years and we have tried most of the coffee shops in the area. Contraband has to be among the worst for several reasons - rude staff, uninviting/stark atmosphere and bad coffee. We go there on occasion because my wife loves one of their signature drinks, but caveat emptor for everything else. This most recent visit, I ordered two things and they got both wrong. I asked for a regular latte (was given skim) and a bacon and egg empanada (was given vegetarian). When attempting to reconcile the situation, we were told they didn't hear me. If you're looking for a better experience, go to Jane on Fillmore, Saint Frank, Flour & Co, heck even Starbucks. Anything is better than Contraband.
author: Dan M.

description:
Contraband Coffee Bar is a great local coffee shop. It has everything you could want in a nearby shop. Friendly baristas, great espresso and coffee, square payment systems, slow drip coffee, plenty of seating, cool vibe, and so on. The list goes on. This is where things tend to get tricky. These things would normally warrant a 5 star rating in most cities. If you can pull these things off, you're doing it right. But we're not in any city. We're in SF and the competition is fierce. Slow drip coffee is the standard and the devil is in the details. I really love this place and they do everything really well. The only things I wish I could change about Contraband is the limited plug situation. I tend to work a lot from coffee shops, so this is crucial. To offset the lack of plugs, I find the balance and trade on this is they have great outdoor seating. This with free wi-fi and some water bowls for our four legged friends makes Contraband a solid 4-star shop. Go here.

P.S They serve Dynamo Donuts
author: Isaiah D.

description:
ITS OPEN!!! DO not pass go do not collect $200 (ok well take the cash) go directly to Contraband and get yourself an amazing cup of coffee.  I live just across the street and have been waiting for them to open for what feels like forever but it was worth the wait.  The place looks fantastic the owners are great guys and the coffee is outstanding.  Small bites are soon to come that will include Dynamo Donuts and other tasty treats from across our great city. 

Welcome to the hood guys and keep up the good work.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Moved into the pac heights area and have been making my rounds looking for a coffee bar that I can make regular.

Went to Contraband Coffee Bar for 3 days in a row. Loved the place, good-roasted coffee, and the staff is nice.

I am giving two stars though because today I decided to bring my dog and found the treatment to be just a bit unfair. I had seen people bring their dogs in the first two days I was there. Some dogs came in off-leash and wandered up to everyone in the store and sniffed their bags/shoes. None of the staff complained so I thought it was safe to bring my dog as well. I left my dog(english bulldog) outside while I ordered. I went outside untied him and grabbed a seat. When my coffee was ready, I walked in with my dog picked it up, got milk + sugar and walked out to take a seat again (about 30 - 45 seconds). A few minutes afterward taking a seat, I was approached and told that I couldn't bring my dog in while I ordered unless he was a service dog (they were nice about it). I apologized, had my coffee, and then left shortly after.

My complaint is that I was asked not to bring him in because they didn't like my dog (and not because of the rules). When another dog comes in off-leash and no one complains vs my scenario ...it's just unfair treatment. 

But again. Great coffee + nice staff.
author: Christopher K.

description:
best hipster voice- "I just love the way they roast their beans here, it's like the only place that does it right"

The only times I avoid walking in here is when the mustache wearing coffee bean nazi is working the espresso machine. He's pretty selective on what he wants to make and who he feels like being nice to. Plus, his barista skills are fairly substandard.
author: Nate C.

description:
Hi All!

I really like Contraband!  There aren't alot of frills and whistles here - actually there aren't any, including sweetner for your latte, or cup sizes...But the minimalist approach to customer service is oddly charming, and unique to a coffee cafe.  

The coffee here is superb, each different bean has a distinct essence.  The quintessential taste and aroma of the bean is locked inside until it is violently released by the cupful through a necessary grinding and leeching process for your specific order.  Each cup of coffee is made to order, I love it!

I also like their empanadas, the beef one is my favorite, and I also like the mushroom and gorgonzala one.  I recently brought a bunch to a staff meeting at work and they were a huge hit - everybody was so distracted by the yumness that they didn't even notice I was 15 minutes late!!

This is a comfortable place to hang around, free unlimited wireless, and in a cute area of Nob Hill.  Everyone I have interacted with has been friendly, helpful, focused and competant.  Nobody is going to hold your hand here while you order a cup of coffee but seriously, this place is the tits!

-Brandon
author: Brandon E.

description: Contraband is my favorite coffee shop is san francisco. Great coffee and great service.  Sara the barista on Friday nights is always super friendly and welcoming.  Make sure to try it if you live around the area.
author: Raul D.

description:
I'm a coffee lover. Been going to Blue Bottle since Linden alley was a needle-strewn dump. Hayes Valley Espresso in the form of a perfect cappuccino was my staple for a decade. I've subsequently had some great espresso drinks from costa rican beans at Ritual and some well made drinks at Sightglass. Hit and miss at CoffeeBar. Usually always a miss at Four Barrel, where the espresso always seems over extracted and harsh. Recently went to St Frank where the gibralter had no flavor profile at all. Making great espresso is an art. There a so many minutia that can affect the extraction and I go to cafe's in hopes that all those things come together for my drink. I don't judge on a single drink. I try places and settle in where the flavor profile of the drinks generally suit my taste.

For the past year or so, Contraband Coffee is where I go most often to get the perfect cortado, macciato, or cap. Their house Illicit espresso blend is perfect with a little milk. It has a bit of citrus to cut the dairy and raspberry chocolate flavors underneath. I occasionally try their special and exotic roasts, just to compare, but in my opinion Contraband has the most consistently great espresso drinks anywhere. I hope they open a few more locations soon.
author: Ethan K.

description: Updating the stars because the barista that I mentioned in my first review reached out to me and asked for feedback. I really appreciated that and it changed my opinion about the employees. It showed that they care about how they treat their customers and are looking for ways to improve. Because of this, I will give them another shot. Thank you for reaching out, Brett!
author: Joey M.

description: Fantastic neighborhood coffee shop. Always have eclectic and rare coffees available, expertly prepared. Also interesting art on the walls that constantly changes over, so usually something new to enjoy.
author: One T.

description: Great little cafe with unique wall art. From what I remember there's a lot of communal seating but loved that there were also a few tables (with outlets for my laptop). My loose leaf tea came with a tea strainer and plate which was super helpful! I wish more shops served tea this way. My boyfriend ordered an espresso which came with some sparkling water; I read that this is the "legit" way to serve an espresso and I was surprised at how well it helped. Would definitely return.
author: Jamie B.

description: Artsy, hip neighborhood coffee bar. I was a little worried I'd be entering a snarky hipster den, but even if it had been, that early in the morning, I don't think anyone was up to the snark...neither the barista, nor I. Nah, this place is cool. In terms of feel, for my hometown readers, it reminds me a lot of Miami's Panther, or Eternity, particularly the latter, as I was able to enjoy an expertly brewed coffee using the slow pour-over method here.
author: Patrick L.

description:
If I were rating this shop on coffee and service alone it would be 3/5, however, for those who study at cafes this is a 2/5. The coffee and tea here is quite exceptional, however, I visit cafes and spend hours here, so my review is based on multiple factors and not just the coffee. 

1.Music/Noise Lvl 2/5: This cafe is not jammed full of customers, however, the noise level always seems to be distractingly high (which some people like). Every moment there was someone around me talking loudly (and I wear noise canceling headphones). You cannot control the people around you, however, you can control the background music, machinery used, employees, etc. Employees are loud, music is played way too loud, coffee machine is also loud and distracting so this cafe is extremely loud. I feel like a old man complaining about noise level, but for someone who studies in a coffee shop this is not a good situation. It would be okay if you're casually grabbing coffee with a friend. 
2.Stud-a-bility(env which one can study) 2/5: This is a smaller coffee shop but there are tables just not a plethora of them. Also, the outlets situation is a struggle here. So either charge your laptop or study using your books.  You can def' study here, however you may have to wait for a table. Most of the tables are high off the ground which is not my thing. Also, the noise level in here is usually loud. Employees, customers, and music are always pulling my away from my books. So while there are tables to study and chat with friends it is not meant for those who need to focus and study hard.  
3.Bathroom 3/5: nothing spectacular. SF cleanliness level of public bathroom 
4.Decor/Env 3/5: I generally study and dont look around in coffee shops, however, when I did here I noticed the art, decor, design, and layout is passable.   
5.Price/Selection 3/5: While there is a decent selection of bakery goods, coffee, tea, etc the prices here are steep. I have accepted SF is an expensive city, but this is a little bit on the high end. But you pay for what you get. If you are okay with a $5 tea you will be given a higher quality beverage. 
6.Service 4/5: Employee seemed nice but didnt do anything to merit 5/5.
author: Soroosh A.

description: Wifi has gotten its act together! Same decor but always looks new, so this place is maintained very well!  Custom pourover coffees gotten better and tastier.  Much more decent snack/bakery selection.
author: Eric J.

description:
I'm a coffee snob. Will not frequent any place that ends a drink with "-chino" or "-frappe". I want coffee in the purest form, sometimes with milk, sometimes without. Never sugar, just the beans.

First the good:
Contraband has decent coffee. Ordered a cortado, simple and a great way to compare beans. 

The Scoop: 
Coffee was a bit bright, but that's a personal preference. If you like it on the brighter side, this is your place. Milk to espresso ratio in the cortado seemed high, too much milk. Didn't try the food, again not a sugar person. Prices seem a bit steep, $3.50 for a cortado. Even so, I spent quite a few years in the service industry, threw $1 in the tip jar.

And Finally the Miserable:
The staff, especially the guy with the ironic mustache are incredibly rude. This was the first coffee experience where I literally wanted to go back and fish my tip out of the jar. I didn't, but I really wish I had. If anyone from Contraband Coffee is reading this, I'd love to meet up to get my dollar back.

It's coffee, it's supposed to be a pleasurable experience.  Contraband Coffee is not.
author: A L.

description:
Wow.  This coffee shop is literally everything I'm looking for:
- Solid indoor seating comfy enough to do work
- free wifi
- great coffee
- friendly hipsters serving coffee
- decent selection of pastries 

Gone twice in two days and will go back soon. 

G
author: Gary C.

description:
I've lived near this place ever since it opened, but have only really been coming here regularly for the past month or so. Initially, I wasn't super into the vibe, but recently something clicked, and now I've been coming here four or five days a week.

I'm not really a coffee connoisseur; if you want info on that, I'll refer you to any one of the other reviews that delve into it. But I *will* say that the staff does seem quite serious about their coffee. E.g., I regularly hear conversations going on at the counter about coffee-related things--and although I don't always understand/appreciate what's being discussed, the conversations seem sufficiently informed to my untrained ear that I have confidence that the baristas here are 100% legit.

Anyway, if you are big into coffee, come here and chat up one of the baristas; they seem happy to talk about this stuff, and I'm pretty sure you'll have a good conversation.

As far as working ambiance:

PROS
- solid music selection
- very consistent wifi, sans annoying sign-in pages and the like
- right by my apartment (this is totally irrelevant to almost every single person reading this review, but it feels important to mention, because it's probably the number one reason I come here so dang often)

CONS
- power outlet situation leaves something to be desired
- seating could be seen by some to be uncomfortable
author: Greg P.

description:
Dress the part.

One of those places you'll feel more at home wearing your favorite hipster shirt. My choice: http://sallycantdance.bigcartel.com/product/i-dont-like-electronic-music

Sartorial decisions aside this is a good choice for caffeine. Minimal but well appointed space. Smooth and not overpowering coffee. Mustaches abound.

Americano was sipped while free and fast WiFi was used and people were watched.

Not the cheapest cup of coffee but consider the extra expensive offsetting the risk they took opening the place in a neighborhood in need of more investment.

Bet the hipsters would agree.
author: Jason B.

description:
I've had some mighty impressive lattes here.
Dope place with cool innards that says chill to a WiFi hangout.
It helps too that they carry DYNAMO DONUTS.
Nice establishment.
D-Man endorsement.
author: Derek N.

description:
So there is good news and there is bad news.  

The good news is that this spot that is two blocks up the street from is going to be serving Dynamo donuts.  Now I realize that they have prolly done this forever and I had no idea...but for the purpose of this review today is their first day in business. 

The bad news is that for the first time in recorded history I was somewhere too EARLY.   Ya, me being too early to a coffee shop in the morning is like Liz Taylor getting smallpox in a Monastery.  Okay that doesn't make any sense so it must still be early for me, but now that I know when the donuts are set to arrive it is likely that this spot will be my new go to breakfast nook.     

Haha, nook.  sounds fucking quaint.  Meet me at my nook.  Lets go over the numbers in my nook. Bring those dress patterns to my nook so we can finalize this spring's design.  ooh I love having a nook.
author: Dru P.

description:
I wanted to like this place. Maybe next time.
I was recommended this place by the friend that recommended Jane, so having liked Jane and looking at the reviews for Contraband, I thought i'd be fine.
I liked the layout and vibe of the place. I can see myself studying there which is one of the most of importance to me beyond the coffee.
I ordered an almond milk latte, they were out of almond milk which sucks but understandable especially since it was 7pm.
Soy hurts my stomach so I opted for fat free since it's the least milky...
It looked lovely. Nice presentation.
They didn't have cinnamon which was a tad unfortunate but I just replaced the sweet taste I wanted with some honey.
No big deal when the important thing is the coffee.
Now, for me, a cup of coffee can change your mood. It can make a shaky bad day into a  hopeful one with yes, a simple cup of deliciousness. 
I didn't get that from the latte at Contraband. It had a taste as if the beans were burned or something. I was not content with my cup but I will try Contraband again because who knows, maybe it was a bad batch or because closing was in two hours. I'm not sure but since it's the only place thats open past 7 around the area for coffee I'd like to give it another shot.
This time though, I kinda hope the barista who is working is a bit more welcoming or at least fakes a smile or something. I wasn't sure where to order and such and I felt like I was just bothering him when no one else was around. 
Not this time. But maybe next will be better.
author: Eff B.

description: The coffee is good here but the service is terrible. Rude hipsters. Go over the road to flour and co. You'll get a smile and decent service with your equally as nice coffee.
author: Rob P.

description: I was surprised to find that the baristas here were super friendly and not the snobs I've encountered elsewhere. Clear explanations of the beans, where they come from, and detailed flavor profiles. Worth the extra dollar or two per cup.
author: Brett M.

description:
If you're going for the minimalist coffee vibe, I'd make sure what you're serving is exceptional.  Unfortunately, Contraband is dishing out over-roasted, unexciting coffee.  The quality is par with Starbucks (Ouch, in my book) .  Go with Blue Bottle, De La Paz or Ritual.   

Make matters worse, the service was a crazy bottle neck with only on guy behind the coffee bar.
author: David A.

description: Good coffee and espresso drinks here.  Chicken apple sausage & egg empanada and veggie & egg empanada were AMAZING.  Did you hear?  AMAZING.  This cafe is small but is a good study spot because of the abundant natural light shining through huge windows.  Get there early to grab a seat if you want to study.  I just wish there were more outlets, but I'm not docking points for that.
author: Henna C.

description:
My cousin and I were running some errands around Nob Hill and happened to look up Contraband on Yelp, while in search for iced coffee.

Upon walking in, my first impression was that it was SO HIPSTER. Luckily hipster is the way I like my coffee and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice and friendly both the guy and the girl behind the counter were (this does not occur in San Francisco very often. Especially in the hipsterest of places).

We watched the bartista grind and roast our coffee and the end result was perfect. My iced mocha was all about the expresso with a hint of chocolate, which is the way that a mocha should be.
author: Alli Q.

description:
Great place for espresso drinks.  Haven't tried their coffee yet.  

They are good AND consistent. 
Hours are a little short, but definitely a place you could study at.  Plenty of places to eat nearby.

Chai latte is awesome here.
author: Zach L.

description: What a great neighborhood spot to chill out inside or outside, grab a coffee, and delicious snack. The staff was great! I was there for a solid three hours and didn't feel rushed to leave or order more drinks. It wasn't overly crowded and there was reasonable seating area to get nice and cozy! Highly recommend it for those in the area.
author: Lisa G.

description: Really wonderful cafe with nice morning light. I'd recommend the Pirates Green Matcha Chai. The baristas are super nice and patient.
author: Fiona A.

description:
First visit to Contraband Coffee today and I was blown away. The coffee shop is small, clean and has a minimalist feel with just a pinch of funk sprinkled in. The barristas are very friendly and the coffee is incredible.

Their Americano gets a thumbs up and their Yemen coffee is also great. Accompanied by a delicious Dynamo donut and my Sunday morning is off to a great start.
author: Jared P.

description: I came armed with a $5 for $10 LivingSocial deal sometime in summer of 2011. A fantastic deal for a cute shop. The coffee and pastries weren't memorable, and I haven't been back. I would not be opposed to a return visit, but too many good places to think about this one.
author: Erika C.

description:
I've been here a few times to have some coffee and look for job for a few hours at a time. 

They have a lot of cirtus/fruity coffee, but I prefer earthy coffee (subjective). I find the coffee to be decent, but two out of the three times I was there, the barista waited so long to tell me my coffee was ready, that it was lukewarm by the time I got it. That's annoying, especially when you want to savor it. 

The chairs are uncomfortable for sitting after 30 minutes, and the music is meh...
author: Heather N.

description:
This place looked like a nice little spot to sit outside on a Sunday morning with a nice cup o' joe....but looks are deceiving.  Bypass this place and enjoy your weekend elsewhere.  It's pretentiously obnoxious that no one should have to tolerate especially on a relaxing weekend afternoon.

Rule #1: Don't go in asking for a cup of coffee because Contraband Coffee Bar "doesn't serve coffee".  

Rule #2: Don't ask for large/medium/small "not coffee" coffee because Contraband Coffee Bar doesn't have sizes.  They don't like "labels" for their "not coffee" coffee.  Ugh.  

I like a good cup of coffee as much as the next coffee snob, but it's coffee!!!
Do yourself a favor and go to the small diner/cafe on the corner....they have coffee, and they serve it hot, hold the narcissism.
author: Yaahmee T.

description:
I have fallen in this love with this spot. I have been taste testing many cafes in city and this one keeps standing out. Great selection and preparation of my favorite brews.

Barista was great, ambiance chill and I love liege waffles and other pastries. If you are in the area take a few moments and enjoy this spot. You will go back.
author: Steven K.

description: Cute coffee shop. San Francisco prices. The pastries looked delicious, but I was only stopping in to kill time and grab a coffee to-go.  I got the iced separator. It was pretty delicious, but I'm not sure I will go out of my way to come back.
author: Melissa S.

description: The service was rude, unfriendly and just plain bad.   Food sucked as it came out of a box.   Asked and paid for one large bottle of San Pelegrino and got a small.  You have to be a true hipster and have street cred to get good service at this place.
author: John L.

description: Decent latte and nice place to sit and get some work done. I wish there were comfier chairs though, but they did the trick.
author: Jessie M.

description:
Obnoxious - Check

Pretentious - Check

Going to "It's a Grind" on Polk instead from now on for "sub par" coffee without the side of attitude - Big Check


What is it with this place? I don't care if it's free trade, organic, gluten free, vegan, agnostic, virgin picked, from the depths of a mom & pop farm in drug-free Colombia, coffee. It is still at the end of the day, coffee. Please don't treat it, or your potential customers, like a PhD is required to even enter the Cathedral of All that is Java.

Random Fun Fact: There is a hole in the wall little bus stop coffee joint on Van Ness and Pacific that makes real deal Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Espresso, Condensed Milk goodness, ice....yum. Oh, and the cute old man behind the counter isn't a complete d-bag. 

Go here if you want some Senor D-Bagulous all up in your grill.
author: Ryan A.

description:
I'm not one for hanging at hipster places. I'm not cool like that. 
However, the coffee here is amazing. And, us Australians are the fussiest out there when it comes to seeking the perfect combination of espresso and silky milk. 

The cappuccino here definitely gets my approval.
author: Kristy B.

description: Coffee is good. Glad to get some quality tea there too. BUT Like Vladamir, and others, I have to comment on the bad attitude of the barista and how it's a ruiner for this place. No need to go back for me. I had two bags of coffee beans to purchase when I approached the counter and simply asked for the price. There were no price tags on the product or the display shelf. I was going to buy the beans and order two drinks. When I asked, "how much are these?," the guy rudely brushed me off to a sign that listed the prices and quickly helped the next person in line. What are you, the coffee nazi? I couldn't have a second to complete my order? I had to wait there for several minutes until I got another turn. When my drink was ready the barista was pretty pissy when he had to call it out more than once. Like another reviewer said, I was sitting right in front of him at the bar but I had to get up and out of my chair to get my drink. Could have just handed it to me. I don't need people to be super nice to me but don't be a D*CK! Looking back I don't know why he was in such a hurry to justify rushing me like that. There wasn't a long line or anything. He seemed way speedier than the whole vibe of the place called for. And it was a lazy early weekend morning. Jerk.
author: Suzanne M.

description:
Definitely up there on my list of tasty, strong coffee joints. 

Love that they have detailed descriptions of the various drip coffees for you to peruse before making your informed decision. I went with the Guatemalan and was not disappointed. Full-bodied, deep chocolaty and nutty flavors. 

They have a great accoutrements bar as well with a variety of sugars and milks. Everything is super clean. Service is friendly. There's a bar seating area where you can chat with the barista if s/he isn't too busy.

Open late and free wifi = awesome and rare 

Perhaps a 5-starrer if a return trip is just as fruitful. I shall be back!
author: Monica C.

description:
Decided to check out this neighborhood coffee shop today.   Maybe I'm not a coffee connoisseur (heaven forbid, I'm not a SF hipster), my palate having mostly been subjected to Starbucks over the years, but I just didn't find the gourmet blends available here worth the price premium (or maybe I just couldn't tell the difference, I'll admit it, I'm not hip enough yet for the artisan coffee movement).  

It wasn't the coffee, however, that ruined my experience.  It was the irate Howie/handlebar mustache sporting barista, who thought he was God's gift to coffee, that was responsible for  tainting my experience at this place.  

His manner was brusque and supercilious. The first thing we tried to order resulted in a disdainful "I'm not doing those anymore" response.   He offered absolutely no help with picking between the different blends.  We tried asking for a recommendation and received a rather world-weary "what type of coffee do you like" retort as though he was exhausted with dealing with imbeciles like us all day.

Secondly, we were seated outside and my girlfriend made the fatal mistake of setting her bag down on the "no smoking" sign on the table.  Within 20 seconds of me lighting my smoke, this guy rushes out and in the most condescending fashion imaginable goes "we have signs posted EVERYWHERE (slight exaggeration), there is absolutely no smoking allowed beyond the fence".    Instead of escalating the situation with a "dude chill the &%^$ out, it was an accident", I simply just got up from the table and walked away.   Horrible experience.  I'd stay away unless you enjoy a heavy dose of condescension with your coffee.
author: Chaz N.

description:
New to SF, looking for my future loitering-holes...yelp led me to contraband.

In my first visit, I had one (scratch that, two) of the best mochas I've had, and a tasty breakfast empanada (egg/veggie, thought they had many options).

Great music playing at level where it could be enjoyed without being distracting.

Very good place to do some work or reading, with free wi-fi.
author: George S.

description:
5 stars for the coffee & wifi. 
4 stars for the atmosphere.
3 stars for the quiche & service. 

Upon suggestion of the woman taking my order, I decided to try the broccoli quiche (was between that or an empanada), and also had a half-caff drip coffee which I was perfectly satisfied with. Aside from the simple mistake of forgetting my quiche until I went up to the counter to make sure it was coming (which they were apologetic for), I didn't find it to be anything special. It wasn't particularly bad, but I found the texture to be a little mealy and thought it was lacking something overall. Probably won't be having another, but will definitely come back for something caffeinated should I be in the area...and maybe try the empanada.
author: Kristen C.

description: Went here this morning while waiting for a table at a breakfast place a few doors down. Got up to place my order and then spent the next 3 minutes looking at the back of the baristas head while he and his coworkers discussed the musical talents of Beck versus Beyoncé. Thrilling conversation no doubt but can I just place my order? Coffee came out in a timely manner but was chalky tasting and me and my significant other ended up both throwing out drinks away they were so bad. Never again. Horrible service and WHO DOESNT HAVE COFFEE CUP SLEEVES!?
author: Stacy G.

description: Great tea selections, including herbal teas. You have the option to get them hot or iced.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
This place is like a parody of itself...like a snl skit of pretentious hipster coffee joint where you feel like an idiot not knowing the perfect way in which to order their coffee
Coffee was...wait for it...coffee...it was coffee, that's all
author: Rita I.

description:
Nice place, 25 stools inside with 4 tables and 3 bar area's.
Service was friendly. Cappuccino   was great.
author: Brad J.

description: Cute and cozy cafe. I ordered a latte and it came with a cute leafy art on it. Taste and texture was perfect. Enjoyed the latte with a pistachio lemon donut. Wow, what a treat! If you enjoy outdoor seating and people watching... Stop by Contraband.
author: Kathy Y.

description:
One of the good coffee shop in this neighborhood with a better attitude baristas unlike some of these kind coffee shops.
Space is tiny but efficient.
author: Lyra S.

description: Best coffee in sf. Even better when George is behind the counter.  I have been going here religiously for the past 3 years. It never lets me down.  I always go for the cappuccino or cortado.
author: Corey B.

description: Been going here for a few years now. Solid drip coffees and the breakfast empanadas are the bomb! Staff is super chill and quick to give you your order even when they're really crowded.
author: Lainey D.

description:
It's a Saturday morning.  I'm sitting, working - kind of in a crappy mood - when the owner comes around and replaces the flowers on the tables - he puts fresh beautiful sunflowers, three of them in the middle of the long communal table.  All of a sudden my mood changes; I'm smiling; and, I'm reminded to breathe.

I feel like this happens every time I'm at Contraband.  Not the sunflowers.  But my good mood.  It has to be all of that natural light (and of course, the caffeine!). 

I love Contraband.  There's indoor and outdoor seating, wifi, and huge windows that provide the natural light. The lattes are delicious. Their scones are massive; they are perfectly sweet and just about divine (ask them to heat it up for you!).  The prices are on par with Blue Bottle/Ritual/Ma'velous.  

While I don't really miss living in this neighborhood, I do miss Contraband.  Just thinking about it makes me smile (and crave my caffeine-scone happiness-inducing combo).
author: Kimya P.

description: Been here a few times & the few times turn into not enough time . Great coffee options. Love love the dark white coffee. I could come here hourly if only I could .
author: Gunther B.

description: I had their americano to go it was pretty good. I wanna come back and actually sit down and drink my coffee bc of the cute sunflowers. annoyed they didn't have change for my parking meter but whatevs
author: Erika P.

description: The coffee has gone downhill so incredibly fast it's sad sad sad. And the service... dude with mustache needs to work either the espresso maker or the backroom, his vibe is just not cool.
author: Nasci N.

description: They charge premium prices, but don't put enough care into their product. Go elsewhere for good coffee.
author: Thomas V.

description:
My girlfriend and I were hoping to find a decent coffee shop within walking distance of our hotel and were lucky enough that Contraband was a reasonable distance down the hill. It was our morning stop in just about every day we were in San Francisco on vacation last month and I'm very happy it was. 

I had a few different coffees brewed as espresso (single source and their blend) and  some brewed coffee as well. I really enjoyed seeing some coffee from countries I didn't even know grew coffee and their espresso blend was one of the better iterations I have tasted. My GF stuck to her lattes but was really happy with them in general especially with the house espresso blend which held up well to the milk.

We grabbed a Dynamo maple bacon donut one day and some granola bars for the road another. Both were quite good and worth giving a shot. We were there pretty early in the morning every day but I would imagine it can get quite busy. The workers were very friendly and helpful and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Contraband to anyone looking for great coffee in SF!
author: Chris L.

description: I had the Pirate Green Spicy Chai Latte, a waffle, and a donut (don't judge lol) and it was all amazing, especially the waffle! I will definitely be back here every single time I am in San Francisco!
author: Katlyn B.

description:
These guys know coffee. If you are a coffee connoisseur then you will love this place. Might be a bit intimidating for the average Starbucks regular... but they probably like it that way. They had a bacon donut that was awesome, along with some other really nice looking pastries. I got the feeling that all the coffee they serve is coffee they enjoy themselves. The staff is friendly and they don't mind educating you on which coffee you may enjoy.
Next time were in the neighborhood well definitely look forward to stopping in.
author: Sour D.

description: We didn't even stay for the coffee. The barista was comically passive-aggressive, straight out of a Portlandia "coffee manifesto" episode. Funny on TV, not so much when you are paying $4.50 for coffee.
author: Majora C.

description: Tasty tasty drip coffee with rad staff members. Sit and enjoy a cup...ah bliss.
author: Bree G.

description:
Came here on Saturday to try the coffee based off the great reviews. We tried the drip coffee (Costa Rica) and it was very good. Super strong coffee is amazing on a cold day. 

Venue - has plenty of seats and a coffee bar. They have coffee tastings there too.
author: Carrie Y.

description: It's rare to find a coffee shop with free wi-fi that seamlessly entices both computer squatters and 'others'. Here, laptops blend with books, moleskins, sketchbooks and conversation ... perfect. It's never too busy and the window paned store front ensures plenty of natural light and fresh air. For the electricity-reliant, there are only a few power outlets so these spots are often taken but still, movement is consistent and everyone is friendly so it's easy to power up! The coffee selection is diverse and their tea menu is just as pleasing since we're not all into our beans. Music is varied, food limited consisting of mostly sweet treats and the rotating art exhibits keeps the walls fresh. A lovely space to perch at for an hour or two.
author: Ro L.

description: Good coffee! The place is cute and has free wifi. They also sell dynamo donuts.
author: Julie T.

description:
I'm loving this place a little too hard.

The owner guy is a doll, it's the only decent espresso if you're working on Nob Hill, and it's one of the few places that really understands the latte breve in a meaningful way. 

Laptops ahoy.
author: Megan W.

description: I've had coffee from pretty much all the great coffee houses in the city and Contraband is definitely up there in quality and taste. The staff have been really cool to me every time I've been there so maybe I'm just lucky? This is the best coffee in this area which is probably why I go out of my way to go to them among all the options around...
author: Collin L.

description: A great place to get a great drink.  I got my first drink there recently, although I was referred to Contraband quite a time ago. Wish I hadn't put it off so long. I got the matcha chai latte, which was delicious. The lady behind the counter helped me decide which drink I might like best.  Was very busy on a weekend, lots of people studying or on computers.  Certainly "hipster" looking.  $4 for a drink by the barista... on par with Starbucks as far as pricing  if you ask me.
author: Amy L.

description:
I'm not a local, but of the three or four coffee shops I visited in San Francisco, this one was by far my favorite.  Their coffee is REALLY good.  They grind it right in front of you (at least if you're getting espresso) and make a great drink.  All of the staff is really friendly (I actually tipped them, which I NEVER do at coffeeshops).  The decor is cool (there's cool art) and there's both indoor and outdoor seating.

It's not on a major street, so you may have never noticed it, but it's the best in the neighborhood.
author: Jake W.

description:
Oh yes I do like! Friendly and chatty staff that are not members of a secret cool sect where you have to scowl at regular punters like me. 

It's like a coffee shop in an art gallery. They appreciate how space can be utilised at it's best. No clutter which for a minimalist fan like me is a turn on. Yes I am horny right now as I sit here.

The coffee? Anyone that does slow filter is already a winner in my book.

The empanadas? It was gobbled so quick that my belly is smiling benignly.

The dynamo donut? I got the lemon one. Dear Lord it is making me happy.

Wifi? Free and crazy fast and the password is johnwayne.

Yeehaw Contraband. Yeehaw.
author: Annie L.

description: Nice little shop off quiet Larkin.  Outdoor seating in the morning is nice.  The staff are polite and handsome.  Pastries yum! Coffee is pretty great too!  I'm must agree with some of the previous reviews that sometimes the service is slow, especially if there's only one barista there.  Otherwise great!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I decided to get away from my usual coffee/wifi spots this morning to try a different one-- and one very close to my house for that matter. I'm so glad I did. I've heard great things about this little coffee shop in my neighborhood and have been meaning to try it for quite some time. I walked in to a not-so-crowded cafe with tons of seating and light shining in through large street facing windows. 

They have an array of pastries including Dynamo Donuts (which I hear are amazing and will have to try soon). I opted for one of the 'Amazing Bars' granola bars which was incredible (filling and healthy). My non-fat latte was perfection. 

I sat my butt down in a barstool facing the window, pulled out my laptop, and stayed there for a good 3.5 hours. The staff was incredibly friendly and never seemed annoyed that I stayed there as long as I did. It never got too crowded to the point where all the chairs were being used up anyways which was nice. I was actually able to take a call for work in here comfortably. The music volume is set just right, and the crowd seemed to all be quietly chatting or working on their laptops.

This may very well be my new favorite coffee spot in the neighborhood. The only downfall is I'd like to see more outlets near the window side walls, but thankfully I came fully charged today so it wasn't much of a problem. I wasn't planning on squatting there the whole day anyways... as much as I would have liked to :) Looking forward to coming back... most likely tomorrow. And the next day. And possibly the next. Point is: Contraband has a new fan!
author: Ashley D.

description: Cortado was good, short line but a bit of a wait. Only one barista behind the counter so it was expected. Pan au chocolat was excellent.
author: Dan W.

description:
Great coffee place in Russian Hill area. Lots of seating, wifi and laptop friendly. Wish I lived/worked closer so I could come more often, but I'm too lazy to climb the hill that is California Street! 

No pretentious baristas here like the ones at Sightglass or Blue Bottle which is a nice change. I prefer Blue Bottle's actual coffee overall though.

Pastries/food are a tad on the expensive side for the quality/quantity, but the alfejores (sp?) are to die for!
author: Seema M.

description:
UPDATE: Minus one star.  Tried the Yergacheffe espresso beans at home. OMG awful. I seriously want to throw out the entire bag. First clue was when I opened the bag there was absolutely no smell/scent -- Nothing! I asked my sister thinking perhaps my nose was playing tricks. Still nothing. I have an original edition Quickmill Vetrano (high end) and could not pull a decent shot even with a more forgiving double shot. Not only were the shots god-awful, the aroma was nauseating. I'll try them as regular drip coffee before tossing them but again, OMG, you can't believe how disappointed I am.
Minus another star for my original drink that I got there. No wonder I couldn't taste any espresso. Their beans are apparently bad. 

Original Review---
Had a Coupon deal so the Hubby and I made the trek from the east bay. Needed beans for my espresso machine anyway and was headed to SF, but the coupon brought me here. Loved most parts of everything here. I am giving 4 stars because I loved it so much, but there were some things that could have potentially lowered my rating: no parking (at all, parked 4 blocks away!), my cappuccino was a bit milky/non-strong for my taste - but I also brew my own at home so ......

The best:
Super friendly staff. Freakin' nice. Incredibly knowledgeable. Knew how to recommend beans for home and then upon discussion re-recommended Yergacheffe for my preference...! Talked espresso machines, grinders, roasts, pull times, basket size etc. Definitely could hold his own. They even greeted us as we walked in the door even though there were some indecisive people mulling around at the counter.
Atmosphere is relaxing without being stuffy, overly decorated/furnished. Just calm.
Snacks were YUMMY. Got two sandwich cookies with dulche de leche in the middle, one covered in chocolate and the other plain vanilla. So good. wish we'd bought more.....

Back to the actual drink: It was beautiful and positively smooth. Thick dense foam, etc. But the espresso flavor that should be prevelant was somehow missing. So it was either too wet (too much milk) or I just don't favor that espresso, Illicit I believe.
I haven't tried my home beans yet, I'm letting them bloom and finishing off my other beans, so we'll see how they compare.
author: Beca B.

description:
Their latte was smooth and the latte art was awesome.  The baristas here are friendly even to those who I would even dub as annoying.  That is, the person who asks  for 'just a bit more coffee' in their cup because they added too much sugar initially. Note that each cup of coffee is brewed individually so even if he just wanted a little more to even out the sweetness they'd have to brew more just for him.  Anyway, the barista did so.  Is it odd that I was annoyed on their behalf?  Maybe it's because I find that adding sugar and milk to individually brewed coffee an adulteration of the coffee. 
Anyway, there's plenty of seating considering its size with a communal table, seating along the window and barista bar.  Free wifi and outlets that run in the middle of the communal table. 

Yeah, I'm a fan.
author: Tanya N.

description: I enjoy flat whites and I feel like it was meh. I'm not from San Fran and expected better. Nice place though:)
author: Rose O.

description:
Really nice coffee...puts Starbucks to shame.  Friendly service as well.   Also great ambience.   Downsides: Thought coffee was a little pricey and was disappointed they did not have real NON-sugary/fatty  food such as sandwiches or soup so I had to leave earlier than I wanted to.

Will be back.
author: Christopher T.

description: Good coffee. A large choice of various grains. Delicious espressos! Definitely a place where to enjoy a real coffee. Only had good luck with the wifi, I think it's a solid connection. A large choice of foods too. Not ideal place to work though, tables are small and outlets rare.
author: Micha M.

description: Try the Blossom coffee machine they have here - the coffee that thing makes is ridiculously smooth and consistent. Hard to have any coffee anywhere else with that machine close by. I'll be making regular stops here just for the Blossom.
author: Nick H.

description: This place is hipster, slightly snobby, and expensive. The baristas have no sense of urgency, either.  However, the coffee and pastries are delicious. I love the outdoor seating.
author: Robin K.

description:
I ordered an Ethiopian drip & it was fantastic.  Menu is similar to Philz or Ritual, with several varieties to choose from.

Great little neighborhood coffee bar.  They carry the typical snacks too, and a good selection of tea.  

Well-lit with a nice vibe for the book readers, writers and laptop set.
author: M. P.

description:
There's balance in the perfect pull of espresso. Small and rich, its robust flavor is balanced by a caramel sweetness and the light froth of crema. Contraband Coffee Bar offers such a thoughtful shot, enhanced by a hip environment and a great bar layout. 

Mellow rock tunes play in the background while tech kids talk about Twitter or AJAX or something equally ignorable. Sit at one of the many counter seats and you're in coffee-hipster heaven. Great service and an informed staff round out the flavorful experience.
author: Keane L.

description: The coffee isn't cheap compared to other neighborhood coffee shops, but it's delicious and smooth and fresh. The pastries looked great, although I can't vouch for the taste. They seemed pretty expensive though--$3.50 for a doughnut--maybe I'm missing something, as it seems like other reviewers love the 'nuts.
author: michele v.

description:
The espresso was complex, really bold and flavorful, rich and thick- the way it should be. Citrus notes that were not overpowering. I would call it the best espresso I have had in the city! And the Columbia drip coffee was nothing short than I expected. Fruity and yummy!
Loved the list of beans to choose from, I can't wait to try more.
Pretty pricey for a cup of coffee but well worth it. 
Very chill atmosphere and plenty of seats to hang out.
It's a great place to impress friends visiting from out of town.
author: Heather R.

description: Really cute inside! Their cappuccinos are pretty small so next time I want to try their lattes
author: Page F.

description: When in San Francisco you can never be short on Hipster coffee shops. Anywhere you go there is sure to be a place that suits your taste buds. We just ate lunch down the street and were looking for a caffeinated beverage to we the whistle. You walk inside and the place is burning like an oven! They were lucky the day was nice outside, I did not want to stay inside that place any longer than I had to in order to get my drinks. I ordered a Latte while my girl got an iced mocha. The latte was not hot, it was on the low end of luke warm. Not cool. We were on a time crunch so I didn't want to bother waiting for a remade latte so I just shut my mouth and drank it. My girl got an iced mocha and that was really good. Tasted great, good flavor, not extra sweetener needed and I honestly wish I ordered that. At least it was suppose to be cold unlike my latte. It's a good place to come to if you are in the area which I am not often so this was a rare opportunity for them to earn my business and I think I might have to go elsewhere next time.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Awesome!  Incredible!  As good as it gets!

This is a fantastic spot for 3rd wave coffee.  They've got a fantastic list of single source and blends.  Each cup is a masterful treasure.

The staff is very nice and very chill.  I spent a day studying and stealing free wifi and got to observe customer after customer coming in, being greeted like old friends, and treated like valuable customers.

The atmosphere is just right.  Not nearly as hipster as the mission but plenty of good vibe: chillwave on the Pandora, bright and sunny windows, warm wood.

I wish I lived closer.
author: Ivan L.

description: When you can't get to Blue Bottle, Contraband is a good second place choice to go and grab a latte.
author: Josie C.

description: Love this place. Great lighting, fabulous furniture a mean espresso. 2nd favorite cafe in nob hill.
author: Denise M.

description:
Good, smooth coffee. Great inside - quiet yet funky.  Also free wifi.
the baked goods (delivered from other places) are really good, from the scones to the donuts (Dynamo).
author: Madison W.

description:
I like to think I have a sophisticated palate but maybe it's less developed in the coffee arena. Got a blossom
Brewed special edition coffee, and contrary to other posters (and my concerns) it was plenty hot. However, I found the coffee bitter and not at all consistent with the descriptors the place listed on the wall. So overall, an okay cup of coffee for nearly 5$. Not great.

But the service was super and the space cool and inviting. I would try again...
author: Heather V.

description:
Ever have one of those days when you just wanted to get the hell out of your house? Today was one of those days. I ended up on the hill, it was morning, and I needed coffee.

I had heard about Contraband and today was the day.

Delicious selection of editable delights? Check.
Special donuts? Check.
Great coffee? Check.
Great staff and nice vibe? Check.

I ordered up a fat mocha and grabbed two of the Contraband donuts to sample. Lucky for me there was a nice spot to sit where I could read the paper (yes, I still read a paper....) and people watch.

Coffee - fantastic. Donuts - amazing. Coming back here? Yes I am!
author: Nick B.

description: Came here to meet somebody to buy an iPhone..ordered two coffees came out to about 12 bucks. When I met the person for the phone I needed change for $20, the person working behind the counter (only 1 person working) told me I needed to go to the bank down the street..hello I just spent $12 for overpriced coffee..so I went ahead and bought a toffee biscuit for $3 just so I could get change..pretty pathetic will not be returning. Also the worker was rude before the change incident. Did not tell us to wait when it was our turn just ignored us and when we did order he said it would take 5-10 minutes, it took only about 3. I guess he kept calling for our order and we didn't hear it. He marches over and rudely tells us our order is ready..did not think to walk it over to us..if you cannot handle the job, you shouldn't be working at a coffee shop.
author: z h.

description: Helpful staff who listened to what I wanted to and made excellent suggestions.  In walking distance from my hotel. Unique coffees to try and lots of locals there.
author: Laurie R.

description: Mocha not so great. Empanada is just ok. Loud and noisy. Crowded. Uncomfy chairs, only two outlets in the whole place, staff is short and not warm at all. Not impressed.
author: Carrie T.

description: Delicious coffee (I primarily drink their Lattes), delicious pastries (ESPECIALLY THE WAFFLES!) and great staff. So friendly and patient. Also, they help me decide the best deals I can get there in order to attain my free beverage/pastry!
author: Kimmy A.

description:
This is exactly how you make a proper cappuccino. You can hide poorly roasted beans in a latte smothered with milk. But in the cappuccino, there is no where to hide...it's all about the beans. The "Cap" is pure truth and they make it here to perfection. Staff here is extremely knowledgeable and shockingly very friendly. Hey, this is S.F. right? Being jaded, pretentious and trust fund kid "aloof" is a prerequisite for citizenship in this town. The coffee house is the epitome of S.F. Hipster attitude, yet here at Contraband I feel welcomed (Contraband? Welcomed? Fascinating!) 

Best "Cap" I've had outside of Rome or Milan...
hmmm, do I now meet the requirements for citizenship?
author: Rob B.

description: Unpretentious, great coffee and tea, and good breakfast empanadas!  I love having this place as a neighborhood coffee shop.
author: Riz W.

description: Are you kidding me? Got the bacon donut, a glazed, and a waffle. Only ate half of the bacon one, it's just a bland donut underneath the bacon. I threw out the waffle after one bite it tasted like card board. The the barista was no help at all
author: Sook K.

description:
Yes! There's finally a great coffee bar in my hood! Multiple options for those who love the softer, creamier, lighter blends (me me!) and great options for those who want the deep, dark, aromatic, super strong brews (the hubbs). Quick friendly services and adequate seating options for peps to post up with their laptops or papers. I wasn't able to partake in the doughnuts, but as other's hae mentioned they also carry a few options of dynamo donuts which are pretty dang great (as long as you aren't on a health food, weight lose diet kick like my household currently is). 
Will definitely come back and recommend other's to do the same. Yay for contraband!
author: Audrey V.

description:
This is my favorite coffee house in the city! The coffee is amazing and a definite MUST try!!! They offer an array of pastries and empanadas. 

Because it's individually brewed, you do have to wait a couple of minutes to get your cup of coffee... but WORTH the wait! 

The staff is super friendly as well.
author: Elle V.

description:
Great coffee house feel with a large selection of single source and blended roasts for drip lovers. Also like that they have a Kone size (coffee for 2).  My cappucino was divine - the espresso was so smooth = one happy customer. 

The interior decoration is modern/sleek with a large communal table and several counter spots (and a few tables). There were plenty of spots for weekend laptop warriors, but just a word of warning: not that many plugs to go around, so come with your battery fully charged if you plan to stay for a while.
author: Rachel M.

description: Make sure your device has enough juice. Only 1 outlet. Others are taped up. The coffee is outstanding! YOu will be sure to have enough juice for the day.
author: Keren R.

description:
Super feelin' it.
