I'm happy about this new addition to the hood. I was even happier to score the Living Social deal.  Today I finally cashed it in and here's what I thought:

-love the look and feel. hipster but not in a super exclusive "you're not as cool as i am" kinda way. Valencia Street/Haight Ave but more accessible.

-liked all the pastries especially the glazed alfajores. the regular alfajore was fine. the glazed one is yum.

-outside seating :) hells yeah. 

-chill service, nice, relaxed, friendly.

-as for the coffee:  Jeremy B. had an iced coffee and enjoyed it. I didn't like the flavor of my cafe au lait BUT i still enjoyed it. weird huh? i think it was super laid back vibe and cool customer service.

I'll def be back. 

Willkommen to the Nob!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
I passed by Contraband right before going into an inteview down the street as I arrived a little early. Just from looking at the place, I knew it was top notch. As the coffee person that I am, I was very impressed by all the different single origin drips that they have to offer. I opted for a nonfat latte and it came out delectable. The foam was perfect; the leaf he drew remained on the foam until I was pretty much finished, an indicator of perfectly steamed milk. I also had a cranberry scone that was baked nicely. 

The guy working there was very friendly and knowledgable and obviously remembered his regulars. Its not crowded, at least not on mondays before noon. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of individuals working on their laptops, friends catching up outside on their patio, and patrons talking to the barista. If I get the job down the street, you can bet that Contraband will be my coffee place of choice! I want to try every coffee they have to offer!
author: David O.

description: It's just a short walk to Blue Fog (serving Blue Bottle) Peet's, Starbucks and a few local coffee shops, but none compares to Contraband. I love the roasts and their commitment to the craft. It's also a solid option for those looking to get some work done (though I usually get mine to go).
author: Corey B.

description: This is a cute little place with lots of little interesting food options. But my favorite thing is their truly delicious latte. Nothing not to like.
author: Lisa K.

description:
It was a lazy Sunday afternoon, and I had a living social coupon that I had to use, $10 worth of food/drink, so I dropped by this Russian Hill establishment.  It was a nice weather day, so I saw a couple of people sitting tables directly outside as I approached.

It's a small, cozy location, and as I walked in and I was greeting by the friendly servers.  There's a large selection of coffee beans, all medium-ish roasts, sourced from different parts of the world.  After browsing and talking to the knowledgable guy behind the counter, I selected a Yemeni coffee.  It was a medium roast, slightly on the darker side that was quite good, earthy and nutty, for $4.  They have options for other sizes and may involve different ways of preparation too.  Had some value left over, so I ordered a Spinach & Feta empanada.  Flavor was good, but even after heating it up the outer crust was a little thicker than I'd like, but that's just my preference.

Decent amount of seating for a small location (~20?), but the wifi/internet connection was acting up.  So I was sitting and staring out the window between intermittent pulses.  I think it finally settled down, but strangely enough, the window staring was quite relaxing.  I'd come here again, though it's a bit of a hike for me.
author: Alvin Y.

description: I was staying in town a few blocks away, and stopped by here for a mocha, a macchiato and another mocha. This was probably the best coffee I have had, while visiting San Francisco. The Pistachio croissant was moist and amazing. Unfortunately, on Saturday and Sunday, the pastry options dwindled. Still, great place!
author: Sam R.

description: I LOVE this place! Sit street side, sit inside with your laptop plugged in. Hands DOWN best flat white!! Most folks stateside have no clue what that is and I was in heaven sipping mine with a pastry Yum!!!! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
author: Sue Y.

description: The pirate chai is delicious - really subtle for a chai. It was hard to choose a drink from the menu because they all sounded so good. Lots of space inside to do work. Prices comparable to other local coffee shops.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Best coffee in San Francisco by far!
You must be patient and wait...but the wait is sooooooooooo worth it. 
All their coffee, espresso, and tea drinks are delicious.

The owner is very down to earth and really cares about his business and customers.
If ever you are in SF, make that extra trip to Nob HIll and if you get there early enough get the breakfast bakes goods. Yummy

A great place to hang out at...reminds me of typical modern little privately-owned cafes in Spain. Free wi-fi and dog friendly! :-)
author: Tia N.

description:
Glad to see the yelpers are happy with this one. 

Coffee is incredible, baristas are kind/not snobby, treats are tasty. Overall great vibe and well-run.

Keep up the great work Josh, George and other folks.

Your neighbor,

Mike
author: Mike V.

description:
Yesterday it stopped raining, and I was able to push the hood of my raincoat back off my head as I walked to Contraband for a late afternoon boost.  It was a short walk, but I was consumed the entire time with a sense of perambelation, which is a word I made up to capture that feeling of euphoria induced by a particularly lovely or particularly needed walk.  The sun was so shiny, the streets so scrubbed and fresh.  All the shop windows gleamed and the Tenderloin seemed, for a moment, tender.

You may, as my boyfriend did, suggest that perambelation already exists in the English lexicon.  And it's true that "peramb-Ulation" does.  One definition is "to walk or travel about; to stroll" (dictionary.com).  

But "peramb-Elation" is that joy experienced in the pleasure of taking a walk.  It comes from 1) the deliciousness of moving the body after sitting at your desk, at a computer, for most of the day, combined with 2)  looking about and seeing your City trying to impress you for a change.

Add a touch of caffeine, and voila.  

Perambelation.  Spread it around.  Five stars.
author: julie m.

description:
This coffee spot is hidden away on Larkin Street. 

I came here to grab some coffee and study on Sunday afternoon. Its a small coffee shop, but its nicely furnished and I like the modern/artsy decor. 

Pros:
- The girl who took my coffee order was really nice and helped me select a drip coffee after I described what I was looking for. 
- Guatamalan blend was good
- Ample seating (although only 2 tables and all the others are bar stools at high tables)
- Good wifi network!
- Lots of windows - so brightly lit
- Music- mostly pleasant

Cons:
- If you order the coffee for here, its not very hot to begin with and they give it to you in a mug, so it gets cold fast
- The bar stools are a little uncomfortable to sit in/rest your leg as you're sitting for long periods of time
- Not a "quiet" coffee place, music can get a little loud - so not good for quiet study
- Selection of pastries was a little disappointing

Overall: I'll definitely pay this place another visit in the near future. You can also sign up such that you receive a free coffee after your 10th cup!
author: Vaibhavi U.

description:
Contraband is still a solid 4 stars in my book.  And I very much appreciate those who have, whether intentionally or not, honored my earlier request to leave the light/fan on in the bathroom after taking a dookie.  I'm not sure why the smell seems to linger so long, particularly in this cafe.  They do have pretty strong coffee, if that means anything.

A few observations since my previous review:
- Guy with manicured/weird mustache is indeed very unfriendly, but not completely unapproachable to order things.
- None of the other employees here are very friendly either and I don't see them smile much.
- There are only 2 wall outlets, which means only up to 4 customers can charge their electronics at any one time. The outlet that was once available by the bar/counter is now covered because the bar is meant for chatting.  Maybe that's why aforementioned mustache guy is always so Bitter Betty--his vision of Contraband as a hip, bustling coffee "bar" is really just a study joint. *shrugs* I wish they would provide more outlets.
author: Dwigt K. S.

description:
The good - best coffee in the neighborhood, by far.  Finally means that I don't have to jump into my car every time I want truly good coffee.

Also good - the people.  Really sweet.

The less good - 6 weeks old, they are still working out the kinks so ordering and getting one's coffee takes a little while (who ever laid out this cafe must have been a beginner) and the Moroccan Vegetarian Peasant Pie we ordered was good but not fully heated.

Will only get better, I'm sure.

So no "contrary" review from me for "Contraband."  Welcome to the 'hood!
author: David A.

description: Whelp, I'm addicted. All over again. Thank you Contraband, it's all your fault. Please stop being so amazing and maybe I'll get off caffeine again. One day, you will stop hiring ridiculously cool and kind people, and stop making perfectly fresh n fancy Japanese brews, and stop serving epic snacks like the maple bacon doughnut or the flat granola bar things or the empanadas, and stop playing randomly perfect music at just the right volume, and stop supporting local artists, and stop being super dog friendly too. No? Ok. Fine
author: Amy W.

description:
Hooray!  This new coffee hub on Larkin Street opens tomorrow to the public.  Coffee beans they roast themselves in the East Bay, brew in Nob Hill, and then pair with Dynamo Donuts?!?!   

This means I can get my morning caffeine fix BEFORE walking down to the FiDi, and might actually get stuff done at work instead of staring at the computer screen waiting for my coffee to kick in.  Merry Christmas to me!  (Happy Holidays is what terrorists say.)
author: Janney B.

description: Rude barista - had a hissy fit when I picked up an espresso cup to find out the brand. Said "I'll have to wash that now." Don't get your panties in a tizzy, everything will be okay bud. Good coffee though :)
author: Elle B.

description:
Thanks to Contraband, my wallet has never been slimmer! 

There's a lot to say for Contraband: well made espresso coffees, a surplus of available seating, fast wifi, cool tunes on the boo-hoom-box, two big windows. The only cons would appear to be a dearth of purchasable solids.

Hidden bonus: Does your wallet suffer from bloating and is in desperate need of a deep cleanse before for the summer? Then your in luck! With the lattes at $5.50 plus tip, your wallet will be in fighting shape in no time.
author: J S.

description:
I headed here on an uncharacteristically hot February Saturday to do a bit of work (read: getting distracted by youtube and wikipidea).

'Cus of the heat, I went for an iced coffee - which they didn't have (!), so I opted for an iced americano and a cookie.  Later I had a mocha.  Are those supposed to be super sweet? I don't want to be a dick and say "My mocha was too  sweet" if that's how they're supposed to be.  But my mocha was too fucking sweet.

There's free wifi and it's very fast, so it's a great place to do a bit of work (always be kind, though, if you camp out, keep buying shit.  It's karma)

When I was there they had a great pandora channel on.

Over all, a great addition.  Could use a bit more variety on the foods, and a few more iced beverages.
author: Nathan M.

description: Boss shit...hella good espresso. I get the cortato and it leaves nothing to be desired. I see some reports of poor service, but I've never experienced that in the 5-6 times I've been there. Contraband is worth it.
author: Julian M.

description: Anyone missing Melbourne or Sydney coffee try Contraband, it's a really long way from Starbucks. Always an amazing smooth strong true coffee taste every single time. Awesome baristas, awesome beans. Perfect.
author: Olivia J.

description: Great little independent coffee shop. They do good espresso drinks and also have a great selection of teas. However their pastry selection is sometimes lacking. My main complaint is that a lot of the seating is counter-height which makes it not a great place to sit and do work (but maybe they're trying to discourage that, which is fine).
author: Amy G.

description: This place was decent. The baristas seemed a bit absent-minded and unhelpful (but this may have been because it was a new guy), the donut I had was a bit dry, and the utensils had stained residue on them. I waited 20 minutes for my drink (it wasn't even busy) and checked in with them twice and then they finally realized they never even made it. I was disappointed with the overall experience, but they did give me a free coffee card for when I return. Overall it seemed like a chill spot to work and unwind.
author: Zain A.

description:
This is a great new spot. 

Pros:  
Best Latte I've had in SF...confirmed the second time I ordered it.  I was skeptical when a friend picked one up for me on a miserably tired morning and I loved it, but a few days later my return trip was no less enjoyable.  I'd give their latte a leg-up on anything I've tried, and their standard (I've only tried one variety) drip in-line with blue bottle and other good spots. The people behind the counter are great too- very nice and really do everything to make your individual cup perfect. 

Cons:  This isn't a place for fast coffee on the way to work.  Each cup is unique, so even short lines take a while.  Also, it is really  warm inside.  I was in a t-shirt and shorts and by the time my coffee came beads of sweat were dripping down my forehead.  I'm not sure I could drink hot coffee and hang with my macbook here- but to be fair I usually like my temps a bit cooler than most people.  They also advertise Dynamo Donuts, but I have yet to see any there.
author: J R.

description: A.M.A.Z.I.N.G.  Coffee is amazing.  I love how they pour the cream.  Great start to the day!   Baked goods are fresh and tasty.
author: Sally L.

description:
This place is pretty hipster. 

But it doesn't matter, my latte tasted good. Well worth the $3.50. Free fast Wi-Fi.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Hopin on the Contraband band-wagon (haha..!).

Just moved to the area, and boy oh boy yesireebob I will certainly put it in the bank with Blue Bottle, Flying Goat, Ritual, Farley's, and Philz. 

Hooray for latte's that speak for itself minus the sugar + cream. 

Oh..and...Chocolate Chip Walnut cookie is a spot hitter. *nom nom*
author: Gail N.

description:
I'm a sucker for a paper cup that's been personalized by a rubber stamp. So, my criteria is low for excellence there but it got 5 stars as I walked in the door.

Many choices, many descriptions, pretty much as detailed as wine or tea. But the little description page is way up front and I felt like I was in the way as I was trying to figure it out and make a reasonably intelligent selection:

I didn't really care what I got as long as the gads of milk I pour into my cup wasn't going to kill the hopefully fabulous flavour/aromas I came here to buy. I went for the decaf, after having had half a French press of Blue Bottle next door.

The coffee was great! Unlike any other coffee I've tasted. It taste carmelly, perhaps? But in an adult way, not Starbucks. Course, I did fill up my cup with that unlabled pour bottle that's next to the sugar selections (I poured it assuming, probs accurately, it was sugar syrup / simple sugar / whatever, something that can't damage coffee too badly...) and gads of milk.  

The milk wasn't labeled either, and there was only one jar... so no Soy / 1% / 2% / Milk / Cream variety here. And no smiles when three of us asked for more in the jug.

Anyhoo, what keeps this joint a 5 star establishment for me is the rad set-up they have for laptop users-- seems like they're really happy to give people a properly perfect table and stools -- I hope someone else reviewed their computer table, because it's really great, and has two vases of flowers on it too. Yay, Contraband.
author: Max L.

description:
Amazing beans make for amazing coffee. Don't even bother looking for another coffee shop in the area that is close to being comparable because it doesn't exist. This place has state of the art machinery that is as handcrafted as their drinks. I was impressed as soon as I walked though the door. The heady aroma of fresh coffee beans wafted through the air like a heavenly perfume! 
I love that the owners take such pride in their craft and use the best tools for the job. I recommend this place whole heatedly and I know that nary a person will be disappointed. The communal table and laid back atmosphere sets this joint apart and is the essence of a coffee bar - its definitely not your run of the mill cafe.
author: Stacy T.

description:
arrived super early for an appointment so why not take advantage of my awesome planning and treat myself to a little mid-afternoon snacky snack?  pulled out my trusty phone and searched the area for "coffee & tea" on the yelp app and saw contraband being only 0.1 miles away.  it was literally RIGHT THERE with their cute little outside seating.

i walked into the familiar and welcoming smell of good coffee and instantly i was a happier camper than i already was.  the excitement only continued to increase as i approached the counter and saw a single donut with what appears to be perfect little pieces of bacon on top http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NUrDd8QedLz9G6KFC458sA?select=ZSc8WCyW_n3lQbwjkRExkw .  the lovely barista was making suggestions to what type of roast i should get and honestly, i wasn't even listening.  all i could think about was how quickly that dynamo creation could get in my mouth.

the coffee was great but honestly, the star of my visit to contraband was the bacon maple donut.  i mean...seriously, that's just effin genius!  if the awesomeness of that donut was somehow packaged into the form of a man, i'd marry it and have homer simpson officiate the wedding.
author: Sally T.

description:
Ridiculously smooth espresso!  (I wrote "flawless" first, but forgot that there's no perfection in samsara. ;-)  Very clean decor, and excellent selection of jazz playing.  Good work environment, although there are few outlets to be found.  The counter seating is decent, although it's built for those approx. 6'4"+ (yes, I'm not).

Great addition to this neighborhood, and now on my list!
author: Ari M.

description: I was exploring SF for the weekend and found myself at this spot. Donuts are phenomenal and service was great. Terry hooked it up with a gorgeous soy cappuccino, and gotta say it was as good as it looked! Definitely recommend you come to this spot next time you're in the area.
author: Sam V.

description: Getting better - more food selection, less grumpy barista, good art and music. A bit on the expensive side, but worth the splurge if you're heading to Trader Joe's or Tuesday yoga nearby.
author: Jen S.

description:
It didn't take much coercing, or any, in fact, for me to like this place. 

Polk St. suffers from a general half-assedness when it comes to coffee houses (I'm being nice by omitting the many other establishments that seem to be phoning it in). I dunno WHAT its problem is, but man alive! do I have a bone to pick with it. Several bones, really. F**king stick-in-the-mud Polk St. ... 

I've been sweating this place's opening for a while now, and having been there twice, I'm totally sold. 

Sure, they're a cut above the rest, but they're not just good by comparison -- they've got a friendly staff, nice space, some delicious food items (Peasant Pies apparently kick ass, if I'm to believe myself), and a coffee-centric focus. 

Wish I could nab me one of their mugs, b/c the branding is pretty sweet, too.

Really, it's already THE cafe in the area, and, well, it's probably because they give a damn.
author: Brian K.

description:
Love!

I'm not even a real coffee-drinker, but it's love!

Free wifi (ask a barista for the password), a decent number of outlets, tables, bar-tables/counters, a nice selection of pastries/snacks, outdoor seating, and a more-than-decent Chai latte for this coffee-spurner!

A wonderful place to study, read, people-watch, make new friends, and just generally enjoy yourself. Like I said, love!
author: Kim B.

description:
Discovered their beans while having a one star brunch at Bruno's.  The only thing good was the coffee, so I asked where it was from.  Contraband!

If you can make it up Polk Street on your fixie, it's worth the trip from Mission for the cute baristas, and perhaps the most well-curated collection of locally produced baked goods in the city.  They're open late to boot.

I only wish I had gotten a heart in my foam art instead of a leaf.  Sigh...
author: Sven E.

description: It's only my first visit (and their 3rd day of business) and I already love this place. The latte is lovely, the music is pleasant, and even the flower arrangement is tasteful. The owners Nathan and Josh are knowledgeable and friendly. Aside from the espresso drinks and coffee, they will also be adding cold brews to the menu, so I'll be looking forward to trying them.
author: C. K.

description:
Happened upon this place a week and a half ago, went in to get a coffee and they weren't even officially open yet, but made me a cortado -- for free!  A first for me (the cortado, not a free coffee), and it was the best damn coffee drink I've ever had in my life -- smooth, creamy, incredible mouthfeel -- just perfect really.  So good I even made a detour in my last-minute shopping last Friday to get another one (not free, alas, but well worth the money.)   

Haven't tried anything but the cortado, but I have a feeling everything else is just as tasty.  Dynamo donuts -- hey, you know that's a sure thing.  And I'm sure I'll get around to trying their drips and lattes and all.  But I can't get that damn cortado out of my brain.

Other than the coffee itself, nice mix of customers (had a lovely chat with a sweet retiree at the coffee bar), outgoing and helpful people working there (I don't know much about coffee but they obviously do -- and can talk about it with someone like me with not a whit of attitude), light and airy room -- only drawback is it's not in my neighborhood.  It's right around the corner from the Lumiere, so that's where I'll get my caffeine fix before a movie.  Still, I wish it was closer, I'd be a regular.
author: Nancy P.

description:
You know a place is good when they've got fans raving about their place before they're even officially open. 

I've lived in this neighborhood for 5 years, unhappy with Polk St's selection of so-so coffee shops, jealous of the high-end coffee bars in the Mission like Ritual, Four Barrel. This place is definitely going to give them a run for their money. Delicious, locally roasted (Oakland) beans by a master roaster, are carefully pulled in a beautiful Synesso Hydra espresso maker (http://www.synesso.com/default.aspx?ID=8). 

I'm really looking forward to the coffee connoisseur tastings (similar to a flight of coffees) on Saturday afternoons! Welcome to the neighborhood, Contraband!
author: Jesse N.

description: Best coffee I've had since arriving in San Francisco two weeks ago. Recommend their cappuccino and espresso. The atmosphere is great as well!
author: Stefania S.

description:
First and foremost, this coffee is very good. 
If you just want a good cup and you're in an extraordinarily good mood and don't care if baristas are rude or slow, go here. 

I tried a coupon through Living Social and got $10 of coffee and beans for just $5. This coupon is the whole reason I went into the Coffee Bar and I will not be returning. It's just not worth the hike or dealing with their staff. 

At every turn and at every question, I was informed of what Contraband CANNOT do and of their limitations. I walked out feeling like, "why open a business if you're going to be acerbic and confrontational to the customer?" There's a rule in the theatre which I think can apply to life...."always say YES." Even if you only have one type of Decaf roast, just remain open to a customer's question and say "we can offer this bean today" or "this is what we have available." 
Even if you only serve double shots as a matter of course, just tell the customer "yes" when they ask for a double - it's bad form to immediately bark back at their order saying, "we only serve double shots." 

There is a way to include the customer in the experience of the coffee bar instead of insisting on keeping them at arm's length with explanations of what you can and cannot do for them.
author: Melody M.

description:
Big fan of the new coffeebar in the neighborhood!
Not only can I make it there simply by stumbling outside, then rolling downhill a block or two... but the strong-tasting lattes knock me completely upright until about 2pm. 

Addiction? What addiction? 

Now all we need is to paint the curb white for a carlength or two.... and maybe a faux sign that the neighbors and I will be in on....
author: Razoo D.

description:
Quality cup of Joe served in a decorative fashion.  My first visit was more than a month ago so I dont remember the details very well.  I do remember it being a quality cup.

I will provide a comprehensive review upon my next visit.
author: G. Lue D.

description:
This coffee bar has to be one of the most convenient coffee bars I have been to. It stays open late (until 10 PM) and is a good place to work - if you have headphones to drowned out the noise. It can get pretty loud. 

They have a decent selection of food (try the empanadas) and the coffee is decent.
author: Sara M.

description:
I needed a place to go to get out of the house while getting work done, and Contraband took care of that. I walked in around 7 this evening and got a $3 cappucino, which was gorgeous to the degree of camera-phone-worthiness. Meaning, I, someone who NEVER uses her camera phone for ANYTHING, was moved to snap a pixellated approximation of the glory that was my cappucino.

Anyway, I worked for 3 hours and got more done in that amount of time than I do at home (granted, I didn't lug my laptop all the way up there, so...). The guy working was a real sweetheart. I couldn't help but overhear his conversations with other customers - seems like a really cool guy who knows his coffees! I'm a total coffee noob so he further inspired me to get to know more. He got a 30% tip from me.

I will definitely be returning with my sketchbook, knitting, and/or reading, and hopefully thereby expanding my java repetoire. :)
author: Meredith B.

description: Nob Hill needed a good coffeeshop and it got a great one.  The coffee here is delicious, the people who work here are friendly, and it's a surprisingly good place to study.
author: Charles C.

description:
My Perfect Tea Timer handed to me along with my Camellia blossom tea has just declared my tea is now ready. The barista recommended I let the "5 min, strong"-glass complete its cycle before I indulge.

The lighting in here is brighter than I expected, but I do like the atmosphere. And I'm happy to have found this place, a good getaway in walking distance from my apartment. This soothing cup of loose tea is also just what I needed, and the background music is fun.

Be aware, there's a .25 charge for using credit cards for orders under $5.
author: Emily P.

description:
Not a lot of options, pretty sparse, but most definitely a good cup of coffee.
The people were nice
It's great for the area and a good walk around Nob Hill.

Have fun kids!
author: Kate K.

description:
The coffee here is very good. Certainly, by far, the best in the area. Comparisons to Blue Bottle and Ritual are spot on. 

The space is nice too - music played in the background is great. It's got a good vibe, but they keep it soft enough that you can still do work or read without getting distracted. The space is clean and modern and welcoming. Yesterday, there were two little girls with their sitter/nanny who came to drink hot cocoa and play monopoly on the large communal table. The barrista came by to refill their whipped cream -- adorable! 

The only thing I wish they would include is more food options. As much as I love baked goods, they aren't very healthy. I wish there were some additional options. Maybe once this brand grows a little bit they can expand to add more options? Nonetheless, I will certainly continue to come by for coffee and will recommend to my friends.
author: Smartwater o.

description: Good coffee, with single origin pour over options, but coffee bar has better.  No food options outside of pastry pastry and more pastry (all with gluten).  That said they lack the "better then thou" blue bottle attitude.
author: Katharyn W.

description:
Hands down the best coffee I have had in the city.  I had the Guatemalan while my girlfriend had the Ethiopian drip coffee. We split the pain au chocolat and croissant to dip in in our drips. The pastries were fresh and délicieuses.

Loved the atmosphere with common tables and window seats. Huge plus is the outdoor seating which automatically gives any business an extra star in my book.

I wish I still lived in the neighborhood, because a good coffee shop is definitely what nob hill lacked.  But I will be back to try the Dynamo donuts and a good cup o coffee.
author: ellen m.

description:
What I LOVE about Contraband Coffee Bar:
The service is wonderful ( A+), the coffee and teas are perfection, the featured artists are great, and I always dig the playlists. 
I like meeting friends here, studying here, reading, or just sitting and hanging out.
author: Rubber Ducky C.

description: Never disappoints! Best cappuccinos around! Try their hot chocolate too! Always friendly service! There are parking meters on California St. So easy to find parking. Great place to hang out with a laptop and get work done. Try it!!
author: Todd H.

description:
During my visit to SF to spend some time with my two daughters we stopped off at Contraband for a mid-afternoon cup of coffee.  The owner, Josh and his barrister were über friendly, something that you don't always see back on the east coast.  Sitting at a table outside, taking in t
The sunshine, feeling the light breeze, savoring the coffee aroma, tasting a delicious Awesome Bar and catching up with your daughters is life at it's best.  Thanks Contraband for providing the setting, coffee and the Awesome Bars.
author: Ted M.

description: I always come back for their sweet beef empanada and soy latte!  They roast their own beans and their blend is superb.  Will be back to try their Americano on a day I need extra caffeine.
author: Caitlyn C.

description: Checked this place out to study a couple of times while I was visiting SF for the week. Not as "hipster" as you'd think. (Realistically SF isn't all that hip to begin with contrary to popular belief). I'm a strict Americano fella and they did it well. Would def suggest stopping here if you have an hour to kill to read a book or study. Everyone leaves you alone and ample seating. Enjoy.
author: Maks B.

description:
Coffee is hit or miss for me. I don't proclaim myself to know much about the subject, but I know what I like, and Contraband didn't quite do it for me the way the big hitters (Ritual, BB, 4Barrel) do. Both espresso and drip were on the darker, more roasted side, and didn't appeal to me very much. The finish on both my latte and drip were smooth, but unfortunately, didn't fit my tastes. 

On a brighter note, the staff was great, and the space is great. If you can find parking or you were smart and took a bus there, do take the time to enjoy the art, and the great atmosphere. Unlike the big, crowded coffee houses, this quaint little neighborhood joint boasts a "come in and stay" feel, as well as a super clean bathroom which is much more than I can say for the competitors.
author: Christina N.

description: Free wi-fi, delicious coffee (better than Blue Bottle or Philz in my opinion) and to top it off, they serve Dynamo Donuts.  What a great little coffee shop in lower Nob.
author: Addie B.

description:
YEAH!!! Finally opening on Christmas Eve - what a great present for the owners and the neighbors!

The ambiance is great - comfortable and inviting, the staff is superb and knowledgeable about the art of coffee and needless to say a great cup of joe!  Have not tried the tea yet, but knowing the quality products that they are using it is sure to be a treat as well.

Expected on the menu are Dynamo Donuts (no need to go to Potrero Hill), Empanadas, Pheasant Pies... PERFECT - food and drink

Best wishes for a successful opening and a long relationship in the 'hood.
author: Cricket B.

description:
An awesome joint in my neighborhood.

They have some kind of espresso machine from the future that lets the masterful baristas control pressure and other parameters.  The drip coffee, which they pour individually, is excellent and they offer a changing menu of some of the finest roasted single-origin beans.  After going back a bunch of times for the strong-bodied coffees, I finally tried one of their excellent peasant pies and a scone.  Both were very satisfying pastries (one savory) and were complimented excellently by the beverages.  I have had the tea here as well and was very impressed with the presentation (a unique in-cup brew technique) and quality.

Incidentally I spoke extensively with one of the baristas and he has a black-belt in espresso-making.

The best part is the people here are just so nice and easy-going, making all of the customers feel comfortable and relaxed.  To see other satisfied costumers just makes the experience that much better.  I will be a regular at this place, which, as has been noted, fills a void in this part of the city, and I would argue, in the entire city.

One notable perk here is the fresh flowers.  I challenge anyone to find a place that still does this.

One issue or potential issue:  dogs.  It is time that all SF establishments honored health codes by not allowing dogs into restaurants and cafes.  It really is not a severe problem here as in other places, but I hope they take a hard-line stance on this issue to preserve their establishment and continue to distinguish it from the others in the city.
author: Marc M.

description:
I will give 4 stars to anyone that wants to add someplace good to go to in Nob Hill. Seriously, I worked in the neighborhood for years and there are few good reasonable food or beverage options.

Enter Contraband.This is the level of sophistication  you would expect at a Blue Bottle or a Four Barrel. Oh and they have food (Dynamo Donuts included). Oh and they have free, endless wi-fi. 

Support this place Nob Hill people!
author: Dave B.

description:
WHAT?! I haven't reviewed Contraband yet!?

I'll keep it simple. Love the folks here, love the treats, and love the drinks. 

The End.
author: Christina B.

description:
This place has been open for more than 6 months?  Where have I been?  I must have been hiding under a ROCK.  I pass by this place on Larkin (sorta) on my route to Re:charge Medical and Day Spa every 2 weeks.  I'm kind of oblivious in that way (I'm learning).

For some reason, I was walking on Larkin today and noticed it.  Then, after my nail appt, I decided to try a latte and some pastries.

I got a cookie, which was way too sweet for me and a blueberry something or other muffin, which was DELISH.  I've read some of the reviews that indicate that the cookies are from Mission Beach Cafe (which I happen to like).  Don't know where the muffin was from, I'll have to ask.

The latte, took a bit of time to make, but I wasn't in a rush and I got a chance to appreciate the warmth of the space.  There are large window fronts, plenty of window/bar type seating and the natural light and warm colored walls, just make it a warm space to hide away on a cold day and to bask in the sun on warm days.  Plus, there are outdoor tables and chairs.

My soy latte and 2 baked goods were rather inexpensive (less than $10).  The latte was smooth, no aftertaste of bitterness and I enjoyed the rich flavor paired with my blueberry muffin.

All in all, a good experience.
author: Hiromi N.

description: This coffee shop is pretty close to our hotel, we read the reviews and came by, Honestly we're not really that much of a fan with this place, their coffee are much more bitter than other places that we've tried with drip coffee (We've tried Ritual, Blue Bottle, and Four Barrel), unfortunately, this place is our least favorite of all.
author: T y.

description: I don't know why this place has such great reviews. We went in there because of the reviews only to be severely let down, over charged, and throwing away our coffee. The workers were too cool for school and not very nice. The guy was actually ok. He made a good cappuccino but my three dollar  12 oz brew bar  coffee was awful and I threw it away. We went down the street and got awesome bagels,  really good one dollar coffee and super friendly service. The one star here is for the cappuccino. Save yourself a couple bucks and go somewhere else.
author: Harmony G.

description:
An excellent selection of brews, with various distinct flavors to fit the one you're craving.

The staff is very knowledgeable about the beans, and pretty much are connoiseurs on the subject, so don't be afraid to ask them what they would recommend.

My favorite so far is the Ethiopia, with a very berry like currant hint to it, quite satisfying.  Or if you're more in the mood for just a good ol' cup of Joe, go for the Costa Rica.  They're all good...expand your horizons :)
author: Jonathan B.

description: Contraband serves the best coffee in San Francisco. I know a number of people who get off the freeway and cut through Nob Hill just for their drip / espresso. The owner is great as are the patrons but if you are really, really craving the best coffee product in San Francisco - you must go to Contraband.
author: Harland K.

description: The coffee was pretty delicious and good. The staff, not so much. Another reviewer wrote about the tattoo guy and his not so friendly service. Agreed. If someone is pondering aloud about what to order, maybe you should recommend something. The place looked like a cool place to study or work though. And the barista lady was pretty okay. Poor service isn't a reason to come back.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Damned amazing coffee made by a bunch of friendly staff.  
The place is quiet inside and the baristas are real friendly.  Grab a cup of amazing brew, sit down, and enjoy an amazing experience.
There's a bunch of choices for your brew, so make sure you choose something spectacular.  If you get lost, the baristas are more than happy to help you pick something.
author: Julian P.

description:
Coffee was delicious (one-cup drip) and the ambiance was nice. However, in all honesty, it was a little too sterile and quiet for my taste. I would go back with a friend to chat, but as far as people watching and work goes...

... I guess I prefer my cafe a little dirty, a bit rough around the edges - ya dig? ;-)
author: Minnie P.

description:
Perfect Mocha, And
A Bacon/Maple donut
Two blocks from the Crib.
author: Paula M.

description: Huzzah!  This has quickly become my favorite Nob Hill coffee shop.  Went in for a latte and the afternoon seems to be nice and quiet -- could be a great place to get some work done/take in some quiet time.  The coffee is probably the best I've found in the neighborhood so far.
author: Mel G.

description:
This spot is chill. It has a nice neighborhood feel: small but inviting, friendly staff, frequently local visitors and the owners are usually serving up the dark liquid goodness.

Nice selection of coffee and small bites (Dynamo donuts, son!). Free wi-fi and a few outdoor tables.
author: Eric L.

description: This is my go to cafe in the city. Fantastic espresso, smooth drips, and tasty treats (in addition to the staff). Even with all these stellar drinks and treats, what makes Contraband unique in the city is the community it has built.  This is a place where people make friends and connections over jokes and great coffee conversations. Wifi is super speedy even when the cafe is full of laptops, and huge windows to bring in lots of natural light to keep your brain functioning.
author: Christina M.

description: Really good espresso and caps. Head barista can be a dick. Other than that a go- to joint that won't fail you.
author: Robert P.

description:
Thanks for the verbiage yelp, yes "Yay!  I'm a fan" pretty much describes it.  

I went here today for the first time and was impressed with both the pricing (reasonable in comparison with the "other" coffee shops that offer similar single bean varietals), quality and service.  

I had the Ethiopian in latte form and it was fantastic.  

The coffee shop then transitioned to some sort of art show opening deal... the art was cool, but I left cause I felt like I was crashing someone else's party.  

Nob Hill, you're stoked on Contraband.  Hayes Valley, we're stoked on BB.  Can't really lose.
author: Becca A.

description: Great coffee and pastries.  Cool location. Great sunny outdoor seating.  No one likes the guy that works there with the handlebar mustache. People outside joke about "who wants to go first?" when he's at the register. Rude, cold and the worst part of this establishment.  Read the reviews.  If you see a low star count you can bet there is a comment about this guy.  I try to figure out this guy's schedule and not go there when he is on duty. The coffee and pastries must be good otherwise I'd find a new coffee bar without the mustache guy.
author: Keith M.

description: Adore this place. I have been going to Cup A Joe for the past year almost daily, but it got too crowded there. The owner is amazing and the same goes for the coffee, teas and food.
author: sophie h.

description: Great coffee and lovely pastries! Nice layout and plenty of space to work. Wifi signal was a little spotty and caused the streaming playlist to be quite jumpy and distracting. Many of the tables are uncomfortably tall for working on laptops, unfortunately.
author: E. S.

description: Great coffee, reliable wifi and chill atmosphere. They also have a fantastic empanada selection. They vary daily, but my favorite is the mushroom & gorgonzola. Mmmm...
author: Daniel K.

description:
On my quest to find great coffee and awesome study spots, I discovered Contraband.  Recommended by a friend, this place is a discovery that is OH très awesome!

The coffee was excellent (I had a cappuccino), and they have cortado!  Which, actually, is the main reason I got the cappuccino.  Cappuccino is the American (kinda) version of café con leche, and if they have café cortado, possibly the cappuccino is legit...?  :D  My reasoning blows my mind too, I know.

Anyway, it was delish.  And so was the huge cranberry and orange zest scone I had.  I usually don't like scones, but this one was terrific.

Good lighting: check!
Table space: Not a lot of room, but there weren't many people here on a weekday, so I had space to spread my stuff around
Wifi: assumed so, since everyone else had a laptop with them (sans me)
Baristas: Super friendly-- :D

It was a bit of a trek up the hill and through the TL to get to Contraband, but I've traveled farther for worse coffee before.  Definitely worth the hike though!  Will def be coming back.
author: Jeanne Y.

description:
"Coffee Lab" - best idea in a cafe in a long time.  We randomly wandered into Contraband on a Saturday afternoon, and were immediately invited to do a free coffee tasting to compare a bunch of different drip coffees.  This is the best idea ever!  I've often gone into some uber hip coffee shop and had the choice of 100 coffees from around the world and had no idea what to do.  So here at Coffee Lab I got to try some different options and discovered how much I like Ethiopian Yirgacheffe.  

So just came in again today and thought I'd give their mocha a shot.  Now I'm a bit of a mocha snob, and I've only ever really liked the mocha at Cafe Trieste in North Beach.  But today with my new found discovery from the coffee lab, I ordered a mocha with Ethiopian Yirgacheffe espresso.  And BOOM - it's a great mocha!  

They use Ghirardelli chocolate for their mochas, which is a big step down from Cafe Trieste's Guittard chocolate, but their eithiopian yirgacheffe was so awesome, and the chocoloate not too sweet, that made for a really delightful mocha.  

Besides the coffee, great atmosphere, great internet, friendly baristas, and I even really liked the croissants.  

So definitely I'm planning to come here a lot more, and I highly recommend the coffee labs, which I think are every Saturday at noon.
author: Charles G.

description:
This place is pretty amazing.

The people at the counter seem a little pretentious but nothing too intolerable.

The coffee is so good.  I like the punk-rock vibe here.  But super clean.  
A treat in this area of the city.

The work-lab type atomosphere is actually really cool.  And nobody pressures you to buy or leave, etc.
author: Chloe V.

description:
Beautifully decorated, really nice talkative barista. Let us laugh obnoxiously. (we were the only ones without headphones/laptops, so we weren't disturbing anyone else).

I'm definitely coming back!
I love that they're open so late.
You are awesome, Contraband Coffee Bar!
author: Malkov D.

description:
I enjoyed Yemen coffee~.
Makes me so happy to discover excellent dark, 
quality coffee after 9 pm on Friday :D
author: Yoshiko M.

description: I think you can review a cafe from a couple perspectives. And after been here infrequently for a couple times, I feel I need to give another review. In terms of coffee, they definitely have pretty great drip with huge varieties. However, a main reason I go to a cafe is so that I can sit down people watch and get some work done. While it's a popular spot, I feel the space is not really well designed, it feels crowded, and also the worst of all is EVERY TIME I come here, I can't help but notice the super strong toilet detergent smell that sipped to the cafe from the bathroom. And it really destroys the mood on top of the fact that it's mostly a closed space. So I will say for TO GO, it is okay, but for sitting down, this is not my spot.
author: Fung S. O.

description: It's a small clean cafe with friendly service. The menu is reasonably priced. From my first impression I can already see myself coming back in the future to do some reading over a fresh cup of pour over coffee.
author: Alan L.

description:
walking into Contraband in the morning makes me feel good! 
My favorite drip coffee are Bali and Brazilian. Get a Dynamo donut with you.
author: Helice W.

description:
Pour-over consistency vastly improved with new system in place that uses weight to standardize the amount of water used.  Kudos to Contraband!

Inconsistent customer service still a problem.  Specifically, the guy with a mustache and tatted arms barely makes eye contact and treats me like we've never seen each other.  At best, he's indifferent.  Often, he's caustic.  This exact same sentiment is shared with many of my friends.  I know he's one of the old guard but that's not an excuse for being an a-hole.  On the upside, the new crew are now skilled baristas and super cool.
author: David C.

description: Perfectly located. Great tasting coffee. I always get their cappuccino! Good place to work. I usually go on weekends to get some studying done. Very hipster crowd.
author: Chloe G.

description: Bought a groupon for here while visiting SF. The coffee was ok. To too many options. The maple bacon donut was amazing!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Russian Hill/Polk Gulch finally got a coffee house worthy of making the trek to.  I love this place.  Amazing coffee.

Also, I introed my friend to this place and she used to live in the Mission by Philz.  Now she moved back to Russian Hill and she gets coffee from here every AM.  Yes, the coffee is that amazing!
author: Sarah C.

description: Comfortable coffee shop - we had a chamomile tea and a cold cold-brewed coffee. Both were great, and stove was warm and friendly! I even heard the barista ask someone if she could help explain flat white v. cortado -- no snobs here.
author: MichLee A.

description:
I had a great first experience at Contraband Coffee today. I had heard about their Saturday Coffee Lab sessions from an AskMen e-mail blast earlier this month, and was excited to finally get a chance to go up and check them out. I wasn't disappointed!

Nathan, the boss of the joint, greeted me almost immediately from behind the bar. We got to talking and I settled on a Chai Latte, with his recommendation. They use a small brand Chai base from Oregon, with no sweetener added, and it didn't need it. Delicious.

The highlight of the trip was Coffee Lab, where I and a few other participants were given the change to experiment with Nathan, tapping in to his expertise to learn more about coffee. He took our feedback to heart throughout the process of creating a blend of three different coffees, and really helped me to understand why we were using which and how much of each coffee in it.

I'll definitely be back for another Coffee Lab session soon, and I really hope that Contraband can thrive. Four Stars!
author: Louis C.

description: This small coffee bar has everything you could ask for: great coffee, wifi, and seating.  What more could you ask for?  I was too full from brunch to try their Donuts, but I'll definitely be back for my caffination fixation.
author: Carli F.

description: Nice design, bright space with great coffee and less attitude...Yes, 3rd wave coffee bars are a bit tough to take with the stoic faces and lack of eye contact, but this this place was not.  Spoke to Barista, turned out to be the owner...very cool.
author: Ed V.

description: The coffee was good, but the overall experience was lacking. Pretty hip with some hype. Hope I caught them on an off day, but the customer flow was lousy.
author: Gabe H.

description: For realz, how have I JUST been to Contraband? It's literally right down the street from my apartment and for some reason I've opted for the nearby It's a Grind, Starbucks and Nook (one of my most faves, too) and failed to check out Contraband. Their $4 for $7 Groupon deal was actually the impetus for my checking it out, but I was very happy that I did after I popped in. The space is much bigger than I imagined and makes a great place to get some work done. Free wifi, plentiful plugs and great coffee. Our nonfat lattes were delish and their prices are actually pretty reasonable. Quality coffee and a great little location.
author: Shannon E.

description: WOW and I am a real coffee snob.  Figured I would stop after school drop off, the coffee was amazing and this was after some db was on his cell phone holding up the line as he tried his best to waste everyones time given his inability to multitask and operate his cell phone (love the coffee shops that have the no cell phone in line signs).  I thought for sure the hipster employee would shave his beard on the spot, remove his tatoos, and perform a caffeine induced beat down but not this trip.  Regardless, coffee was great and purchased 1/2 lb on the spot.  Watch out Blue Bottle.
author: mike s.

description:
Cappuccino was perfect.  Chocolate dulce de leche cookie just right.

Music not too loud.  Service great - not speedy, this is individually crafted coffee drinks, but wor the wait. 

Nice space - with ample room for ipadding, light and airy.  Small outside patio space. 

Definitely a place for quality espresso beverages
author: Gustav N.

description:
They placed no smoking signs in the outdoor seating area! Nice. Now everyone can enjoy an amazing cappuccino on sunny Larkin St.

Oh and if you make your own coffees or capps at home- BUY THEIR BEANS! sooo good :)
author: Kristen R.

description: Gorgeously designed coffee stop with efficient and super nice staff. Owner Josh obviously knows his coffees and teas and how to manage a smooth operation. Always a great cup here. Go often and get high!
author: Ron W.

description: Without a doubt, this is the BEST coffee bar within a 10 block radius (if not more).  Every coffee drink here is done perfectly.  Their barristas are highly skilled and it makes all the difference in making a superior drink.  The coffee is phenomenal and the service is friendly and efficient.   In terms of the ambiance, this place has a groove and that energy attracts nice folks.  They are the ideal setup for the remote office with laptop style countertops and stools/chairs.  The other charming part of this cafe is the window seats and the outdoor sidewalk tables.
author: Tania C.

description: The very best coffee I've ever had, outside of Europe. And the service was so friendly. They are clearly making an extra effort to be gracious. I LOVE this place.
author: Ed B.

description:
I only got to go here once, and even then I went out of my way for the sake of the rave reviews on here... And I was not disappointed. I find i give a disproportionate amount of 5 star reviews, and I imagine anyone that looks at my rating history will start to doubt my opinion, but I promise that this much is due to my tendency to stick to the highest rated places I find on Yelp. As is pretty much always the case, the site came through. 

This is possibly the best coffee shop I have ever been to. They grind the coffee right there at the counter, which results in this place smelling amazing. I had a cappuccino which was was as artfully prepared as one can imagine,  and tasted goddamn excellent. Plenty of kick and just the right amount of milk. The memory that will stick with me is the shortbread though. It was sweet, and salted, and was apparently made with lavender. This last bit took me by complete surprise but the end result was incredible. If you are within the most remotely reasonable version of walking distance, make the trip.
author: Vince B.

description:
The guy behind the counter was right: the Illicit Espresso is a home espresso machine's dream.  For no discernible reason, it makes a smoother, richer, creamier espresso in my Gaggia Classic than many of the expensive coffees I buy around town.  Half a pound for $8 is a little on the high end, but I had a Living Social coupon.

I'll be back for lattes and baked goods at this tucked-away local treat.
author: Pei L.

description: I've only had their coffee a few times, but man it packs a mean kick. Not a lot in terms of fluid which is good because I don't like sipping on coffee forever. They've got a lot of variety and seems like a good place to go if you're into coffee a lot and know a lot about it. The guy behind the counter doesn't talk much but it's whatever.
author: Kay S.

description: Been here twice so far. Best (and strongest coffee flavor) decaf latte by far! I like that they are open quite late compared to some other coffee shops in the area. The staff is friendly and space is comfortable with a relaxed ambiance. A good study spot.
author: Vendela F.

description: As someone who likes to sit and enjoy her coffee as well as interacting with people who smile, I found this place unsatisfactory. The barista was very unfriendly and made me feel like an alien when I ordered a nonfat vanilla latte, something that I consider a basic caffeinated beverage but, apparently, I am just not cool enough. So upon switching to an overpriced/bitter mocha, I sat in one of the uncomfortable stools, endured an uncomfortable silence for about 10 minutes, and left. I could see this place being great for someone who is verrrry into straight coffee and/or being a hipster, but it's simply not for me. Won't be returning.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Great coffee. You have to like brewed by the cup. This isn't a run in, order and run out sorta place. Owners are nice. Love the decor.
author: Scott C.

description: I came here based on a friend's recommendation and found the place to have sub-par coffee, a cramped seating area that's not optimal for studying, and no fans or air conditioning (it was hot inside). Not sure what the big deal is about this place. The coffee was very bitter and tasted like cheap instant coffee. Blah.
author: James S.

description: I was visiting a friend in SF and love coffee in the morning, so a quick search on Yelp turned this place up. I've seen their beans back home in a few retail stores, so I excited to give the coffee bar a try and was pleased with my experience. It maintains just enough hipster vibe and pretension without making me feel out of place (as I'm a few years to old and 2 jeans sizes too big to be true hipster). The coffee was very good smooth and rich, and there were many options of different beans and roasts. Over a few mornings, I had several macchiatos (my benchmark drink) and several coffees and all were very good. The prices were about right for a city and gourmet coffee and the service was unremarkable, if not friendly. There were many people using the wi-fi, which appears to be a popular activity here. Also there is art work by local artists on the wall. I did not try the pastries/food.
author: Brian I.

description:
In a rare void of cafes in this section of Nob Hill, Contraband is a welcome oasis.
Perfectly made coffees
Excellent pastries and other snacks.
Outdoor seating/ WiFi/ clean bathroom
Friendly vibe, and every time I was there, way better than average music choices
The perfect way to start your day or afternoon pick me up.

A little slow on the service in the morning rush mostly due to the current fad for pour over coffee. Two power outlets in the whole place for those inclined to plug in.  Seating could be bit comfier, but it's a small place, and I think they made the most of it. Have a coffee and gaze out the window at the parade of passers by on Larkin St.
author: Thomas M.

description:
One of my new favorite coffee shops and roasters. This place is not in my neighborhood but worth going out of the way for. Absolutely delicious coffee!!! Perfect drip that has a full rich flavor and a smooth finish, made to order and perfection. The staff is friendly and very accommodating and while sitting at the bar, I shared stories and laughs with the staff and neighborhood regulars. A great place to chill, study, or socialize. 

I will be back to fill my coffee cravings. Oh and the emanada's and sweet treats are must try's too. Can't wait to go back! Support local love!!!
author: Awny R.

description: Contraband was close enough to my hotel in Nob Hill that I made it a mission to pop in one morning to fuel up before hitting the hills, I mean, streets. I had an awesome cup of coffee, which was the absolute perfect thing I needed to get me going. I imagine I'd stop in regularly if I lived closer.
author: Renee E.

description:
Absolutely incredible drip coffee. They roast it themselves (said the barista) and it's really out of this world. I had possibly the cleanest most balanced Yemen ever. 

The pistachio croissant is insane, the guy at the bar was charming, and there was plenty of table space available. Too bad it's only open til 8!

I will definitely be back.
author: Monica Q.

description:
Harold is the man. He knows his business and will pour you one of the dopest cappuccinos you can get on the hill or, dare I say, in San Francisco.

Kinda a bummer that the Barleycorn had to come down for this place to open up but if any place is gonna take its spot, I'm glad its this one.

Go here.
author: Jason M.

description: Stumbled upon this shop before a hike in Marin. Great coffee, good pastries.
author: Jordan R.

description: Kind of pricey for a cup of tea and a coffee, but they were good, the server was friendly, and the space was nice. We opted for the outdoor seating.
author: Rob R.

description:
This review is long overdue.
Contraband is one of my favorite new coffee places. 
I usually get a drip but cappuccinos are good too. You can get Guatemala, Ethiopian or Costa Rica drip.
They have nice pastry selection: as many of reviewers mentioned  they have dynamo donuts; they also have peasant pies, empanadas, muffins, scones, etc.
author: BO P.

description: This is a great little coffee bar in which to duck in, enjoy a wonderfully prepared coffee drink and peruse whatever it is you might read on a sunny Sunday morning.  Contraband benefits from large windows facing South and letting in the most beautiful light. Yes, I endorse your giving this place a go.
author: Jay D.

description:
a great gem hidden away on a side street.  

Definitely worth checking out.  I'm a coffee aficionado and I approve of this place!
author: Matt V.

description: I give Contraband 5 stars for the friendly service and the delicious peppermint tea. It was nice to be able to sit in front of the big window and people watch.
author: LaShea R.

description: Contraband is a super nice place to grab a cup of coffee. The atmosphere is calm and quiet. Music choice is nice. They do latte art! It was easy to find and the place is really clean. I would go back again!
author: Brandon L.

description: Welcoming, Warm and Comfortable. I  felt non of these here. The hipster "Too Cool For School" guy in the Beret seemed to be put out at having to serve me...When part of my order was ready he didn't tell me..I happened to see it on the counter. I asked if it was mine and got a quick and annoyed, "yeah"..I mean come on....It's a coffee House.....I won't be back which is too bad because it's conveniently located in my neighborhood.
author: Mark M.

description: Made a cup of coffee that Agent Dale Cooper would be proud of - piping hot, full bodied, and oil free. Spacious, well lit, well decorated, and quiet on the Saturday morning I visited it. Seems like a nice place to relax on and get some work done over the weekend. Didn't notice any powerstrips, but I may have missed them.
author: Ian S.

description:
The best cafe near Polk st. 

Fantastic cappuccino. All the quality of Blue Bottle but with better seating and shorter lines! The regular espresso is much better than the decaf, but I'm sure they'll refine it. 

Their baked goods are also great and they carry both sweet and savory items.
author: Lion G.

description:
One visit here will remind you (or make you realize) what's missing from the big corporate coffee chains - besides personality.

The "base" coffee is fantastic, excellent selection of beans and roasts - you're not forced into something extra dark roasted (i.e. burnt).  And if you feel like something fancy, the baristas just flat out know what they are doing.

Keep up the good work!
author: Paul J.

description:
Simply my favorite place for a coffee in San Francisco. Great coffee, great atmosphere, and very authentic.

Only downside is that the person in charge there is really not pleasant, and can be really rude to customers.
author: Steve L.

description: Cool, hip place. I ordered a latte and it took a long time before I got it. Latte has good coffee taste but it was too creamy. Seems like they put half and half rather than milk.  The barista was quite moody, seems like he is over worked.
author: Christina L.

description: Good coffee, good pastries, nice space, wifi. Great place if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Rick B.

description: Right around the corner from my house...ranks up there with the best of them...BlueBottle, Four Barrel, etc... The espresso is a bit more earthy in tone, but very smooth and worth walking a couple of extra blocks if you are in the Nob Hill area.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Friendly service, uber-fresh coffee, and a welcoming atmosphere. I really felt like I was a guest in these guys' home. I came right at coffee-tasting time (2:30pm on Saturday) and was offered tastes of coffee from all over the world. I love Guatemala! 

It's comfortable. You could sit and read, bring your laptop, have a seat at the bar and sip your espresso or cappuccino, or grab a cup o' joe on the go. 

This is the good stuff: fresh, quality beans ground and brewed to the strictest of Contraband standards. It's coffee done right.

They have Dynamo Donuts, too!
author: Tony S.

description: the employees are rude.  also, the ipad square app they use gives you $1, $2, $3 tip options...let me get this straight, you want 30% tip for an overpriced cup of coffee
author: Mike K.

description: Contraband is such a cool space that gets tons of beautiful morning sunshine and that has an outdoor seating area for your morning coffee and walk with the dog! Oh, and did I mention that their coffee is delicious! These people are serious about their coffee without the usual snobbery that comes with it. The cappuccino was smooth and not over-extracted in any way. The beans seemed perfectly roasted and the latte art was like icing on the cake! What a cool neighborhood coffee shop. I will definitely be back!
author: Emily S.

description: I heart their lattes. The place itself is extremely inviting and a nice getaway from Polk Street and in turn I head here a couple mornings a week to get my caffeine fix. They have a selection of pastries that beats anything you find at Starbucks, which doesn't hurt either.
author: Melinda S.

description: GREAT coffee and cool atmosphere. Good place to hang out and get some work or studying done. Solid crowd w lap tops but not overly busy. Totally worth checking out!
author: Valerie F.

description:
As much as I love Ruggy I am gonna have to disagree with him. Though the place is hip, and cool the staff is quite full of themselves along with the customers. Don't get me wrong it's awesome to have a local coffee shop instead of the monster we call Starbucks. I will still keep trying the place, but it still isn't the best I have ever had. 
I ordered an iced coffee forgive me it's 80F outside so, sorry I don't want to drink boiling water. The coffee was already done, and left on the counter in a clear jug. Nothing very fancy happens, just some ice cubes, and 3$ cost. 
Sugar doesn't dissolve in cold water so, I was stuck with Splenda which has an aftertaste. Even with the aftertaste it still couldn't match the bitterness of the coffee itself. Like hell I'm gonna throw it away I paid 3 bucks for this coffee. 
The positive is they have a wide selection of beans to choice from so, if your into the try one time blends this place is good to go. They have a good selection of pastries to choose from like Ruggy said. 
Other than that I'll stick with Philz for my standard cup, and Starbucks for the fancy items.
author: Nathan M.

description: The coffee is great, but the main barista that works there most of the time is rude, and has been multiple times we've been in there. My wife tried to order an "iced separator", which is on the menu and there was a picture of it next to the register, and main barista interrupted the employee that was taking our order and said "we aren't making those right now". My wife asked why and he just ignored us while the other employee taking our order just rolled her eyes at the barista.
author: Mike B.

description: They have top notch equipment and very good breans.  Dude at the counter probably needs to be a little bit more polite.  I like the fact they can make a Flat White.
author: Demanding T.

description: Great coffee. Good seating. Sweet art. Free wifi. No flavors for coffee. Average pricing for SF.
author: Danny M.

description:
ok, this place is good and cool, but it might be full of the most hipsters you've ever met, for better or worse.  i didn't have a negative experience, but it was pretty interesting being surrounded by stereotypical hipsters, some complaining about things louder than others.  either way, i kept to myself and soaked in all the experience while munching on my delicious mushroom empanada and sipping on my delicious latte.  

compared to the popular philz and blue bottle, contraband has its own feel and reasons for liking it (gotta try the bacon donut next time), so it's tough to say whether i like one over another.  thankfully, all 3 are located in different areas, so i won't ever have to make up my mind about which one i like more.
author: Jeff N.

description:
worthy of deep inhalation! 

I came here on the strong recommendation of a friend and was NOT disappointed: the brew is a divine elixir. I opted for my faithful soy latte and the creamy, rich immersive experience will linger on until I return. Great lighting and friendly staff who seem fine if you camp out for endless amounts of time with your laptop supported by plenty of power outlets and wifi all conspire to make Contraband a compelling work and drink spot. Once I taste the pastries I may up it to 5.
author: Diane B.

description: 0 Stars if possible.  I walk in and the barista says, "It'll be a 15 minute wait." No problem, since I really want to try the coffee. 15 minutes so by, the barista has said sorry for the wait to me about 2 times. Then someone else walks in and he just takes his order and never meets my eyes ever again. Of course I am furious, I patiently waited and then I was ignored.  With service like that, the mustache man is going to scare all the business away!
author: oi y.

description: I love this place; this is where I work on my screenplay and spend half of my personal budget.
author: Jonas K.

description: A beautiful espresso here! You're paying a bit more however it's worth it if you want to enjoy your coffee.
author: Paul M.

description: Cool guys, good coffee, strong internet - what more could you want?
author: Kevin M.

description: The drip coffee craze jacks the price sky high at this place and some days it's difficult to justify the extra buck for a cup of joe. However, this is a nice little spot of urban cool with free wifi, so sometimes the price of admission is worth it to avoid the typical chain or grungy shops nearby.
author: Charlie B.

description: It's okay. Nice people working there, but the beverages did not quite live up to my expectations. Taste wise was okay, but consistency was lacking. I ordered an iced mocha, and it came not well-mixed, with lots of chocolate powder in it. It took a half hour of shaking to get my drink smooth.
author: Melody L.

description: Second go, no bueno. I tried, legitimately did but the mocha latte came out like... milk with a bit chocolate and maybe you could taste some of the espresso. But not really. The staff is definitely friendly and it's a lovely atmosphere but the drinks have not been good, not even decent.
author: Shauna S.

description: Remarkably good coffee bar.  Probably the only true gourmet coffee on Nob Hill!  Superb single-source coffee selections make you wonder why you'd ever drink the ordinary stuff again.  Since I discovered Contraband, I have a new reason to look forward to visiting Nob Hill!
author: Paul S.

description: Contraband Coffee Bar serves a really nice cappuccino. It was my first in the city for this trip, and I was quite happy. The texture was nice, the temp was good, and the flavor was light, but really quite tasty. I think the barista hurried my drink a bit because the microfoam broke down pretty quickly, but it was still a really nice drink. I'll be back for more.
author: Erik S.

description: Wow, this place is amazing. I had the best cup of hot chocolate of my life, followed by the best chai latte. Both had perfect balance of semi-sweetness and flavor, and featured a consistency that made me feel like I was drinking a cloud. Ambiance and service is friendly, too, although frankly I'd put up with just about anything for beverages of that caliber.
author: David C.

description: Cute neighborhood coffee shop with plenty of tasty bean options. Super tiny though - it's tough to find a convenient/out of the way place to wait. Lots of table and window space for laptoppers but not a whole lot for sitting and chatting.
author: Karena Q.

description: I love Contraband.  It's the best coffee shop that has happened to Nob Hill in recent years.  The staff is incredibly knowledgable and can tell you anything you want to know about the coffee they brew up.  It may take a little while to get your cup, but that's only because every one is handmade to order.  They even have tasty food like empanadas.  Everyone is always very friendly, and I have always had a lovely experience here.
author: K T.

description: I have mixed feelings. The place gets an "A" for attitude and ambience. My friend liked her single macchiato, however, my triple with a splash of milk was SO bitter that it was undrinkable. Without hesitation, they made me another but it was equally bad. My friend agreed and we got into speculating why her single was so good, but my triple so horrible. I didn't bother to ask them to do it again because I was so put off by the bitter taste in my mouth. Bottom line, my friend loves the place (she's visually oriented and non-confrontational), however, I wouldn't go back except to watch her enjoy the place. Café Vivace, the coffee superstar in Seattle, says that "espresso should taste like fresh roasted coffee smells." That wasn't my experience at Contraband.
author: S. K.

description:
was excited to hear that this part of town was getting a much needed coffee spot, and was optimistic on walking in and seeing the Melbourne style menu board (that town has some seriously amazing coffee goodness), but as much as i wanted to like this place, the coffee disappointed.  we ordered a drip and a soy latte.  both tasted over-roasted to the point we ended up tossing them more than half-full...at $4 for the latte at that.  charging extra for soy in this town doesn't seem right...charging extra for kirkland soy is simply not acceptable.   it's early days though and the staff, as incredibly friendly as they are, seem keen on optimizing and refining the overall contraband experience... for now though I won't be returning any time soon

4 stars for the space...especially all the seating
4 stars for peasant pies, empanadas and dynamo(!) donuts 

but in the end we came for the coffee so for the foreseeable future it's back to bb, ritual, matching half and sightglass.  good coffee is well worth the wait...and any accompanying attitude
author: Nadim J.

description: It's a great addition to a part of Nob Hill that's pretty nondescript. The bean quality is much higher than coffee on Polk and the staff is always friendly when I've been in.
author: David K.

description: I drink a lot of coffee.  Oftentimes, I'll get decaf to avoid caffeine overload.  I've found that many coffee shops have pretty bland/weak decaf.  Not so, here at Contraband.  The decaf Americano that I got was delicious.  A bit pricey, but worth it every once in awhile.
author: Ted G.

description: A really awesome addition to the Polk Gulch neighborhood. Contraband can seriously pull some outstanding shots of espresso and their drip coffee is quite good too. They also serve some outstanding pastries and breakfast Empanyadas.
author: Marco M.

description: Finally, a hip coffee shop in my 'hood. Contraband feels a lot like the coffee shops I used to frequent in Palo Alto (when I was living on free wireless, a strange time in my life for sure). Make sure to bring a fully charged laptop though, outlets are not ubiquitous. Bonus points, the name of the coffee shop reminds me of a Vampire Weekend album
author: Adam D.

description: Great drip coffee in a lively, modern bar-like setting.  A nice alternative to the traditional coffee shop environment.
author: Joe G.

description: Although this place is known for its drip coffee, there are only a couple that fits my taste; so, I took the cappuccino toady. The barista (i think also owner) make the latte art on it. That's not the exceptional aspect.... The cap tasted very good! Worth a try if you are in the mood for a cap.
author: M S.

description: The place continues to grow in reputation, and with its rep come, alas, more people.  But absolutely NOTHING has changed in quality, and I remain convinced that this is some of the very best coffee in this coffee-crazed city.  Bravo Josh and team, for caring so much, pulling such great coffee, and creating such a good experience.  No pretense, just great coffee.
author: Lisa A.

description: Great coffee shop.  A super duper extensive coffee menu (dare I say too extensive, which of course is contradictory), very cool layout and space, and some outdoor seating for when the fog isn't too heavy.  They also have lots of interesting treats that I didn't have room to try (dynamo donuts and belgian waffles).  All in all, very cool place.  It's a shame it's on the other side of town from me, but I'll definitely keep it in mind next time I'm over there and in need of some caffeine.
author: Sean H.

description: Coffee was rushed and tasted burnt. The former barista, Jenalee, used to make a proper latte. Slow down, dude.
author: Ray M.

description: i love you so. I don't drink coffee but boy are your bread pudding muffins to die for. And boy are your employees nice. And boy is your space bright. And boys is the half-block walk from by house heavenly for its brevity. I love you so.
author: Katie T.

description: it's a good coffee shop. good coffee in large mugs if you are staying. but super crowded. line moves slowly. and the seats are very uncomfortable. i really enjoyed my large dark mocha but wish i had a more comfortable place to sit and drink.
author: Christina H.

description: Yelpers got this one right. Perhaps the best latte in CA. AND the service is great to boot. Small spot but we still managed to sit three and enjoyed our lattes down to the last sip. Perfect foam to the end. In regards to the mustache fellow being unpleasant, that was not what I experienced. We also had a baby stroller with us and got no stink eye from him. With that said folks, if you are in a small cafe, then be respectful and not think you can squat there with a $3 purchase. I ordred, sat, chatted, checked email a bit, finished my drink, thanked the barista, and left. Want to chat and use up power for your laptop, then find a starbucks
author: Booger D.

description: This fulfills every fantasy of the small, independent, chic, bohemian cafe on the corner. The coffee is delicious without a hint of snark or snobbery from the baristas, and the art and decor just set the right ambience.
author: Tian X.

description: Finally I found this place. I live on Nob Hill and after making the rounds of coffee shops I was left underwhelmed by the quality of the espresso I was trying. The shots were watery and I'm not sure the baristas quite knew what they were doing. Contraband makes delicious espresso.  Rich, creamy, and flavorful.
author: Will S.

description: Love Contraband. Best cup of joe in this neighborhood. It's well worth the extra quarter mile for me.
author: Emily C.

description: When you keep it simple you have more room to get it right. This cappuccino was one of the best ever. Hella good.
author: Francesca S.

description: Walking into a coffee shop on a Sunday at 10am and see no line...3 stars.  Great service = 4th star.  Excellent coffee = there's your 5th.  I had a cup of black coffee, the brazilian blend, which was heavenly. It's the perfect location to get your morning caffeine jolt.    But make sure to put your name in at Olea for breakfast across the street first!
author: Joel F.
