description: This place gets my Kiwi Coffeeista thumbs up for their flat white. Australasians will be at home here.
author: Adam B.

description: Decent coffee - I was sitting at the area by the window and there were some old dishes & cups there left for over 2 hours. I don't understand that kind of laziness on the part of the staff. The place was not even close to being busy.
author: George S.

description: The best coffee i have had in SF. Not sure what it is, but they do something good...really good. I usually get the Ethiopian. The empanadas there are very good too. The staff and owners there are very friendly. The owners even took a good chunk of time out of his work to talk to me about some ideas i wanted to run by him . He even offered to help me further if needed. They are working hard at their business and the results are showing. The only negative i have about this place is that some times they are a bit short staffed. Couple of times i wanted to get a carafe of Coffee when we have gone as a group and have been denied it as they were short staffed. Hopefully that will be taken care off soon.
author: Karthick S.

description: You have to come here if you like real Ristreto espresso! Strong, short, creamy, smooth, not bitter at all, either caff or decaff, no difference. Basically an awesome experience. Just get in, now!
author: David J.

description: New fave work from home spot!   I am new to the work from home world and have been scoping out spots around the city to get my work done - Contraband is my new favorite.   Great coffee, fast internet, not too crowded, and not too hipster.   Ritual drives me nuts with the overcrowding of pretentious hipsters and the coffee is only so so.  I love Philz but recently have been having problems with their wifi.  Contraband is perfect.  I only wish they served lunch and I would camp out there all day!
author: Nic B.

description: Great coffee, nice atmosphere, cool location and a nice long bench against the window so people like me can look out said window while reading, writing and daydreaming.  Tops.
author: Mark W.

description: Hands down, the most delicious cup of coffee I've ever had. I will be back whenever possible. Cool place, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful people and free wifi.
author: David H.

description:
The chicken enchilada empanadas are amazing!!! & so are the walnut chocolate chip cookies (needs to warmed up a bit more). Today was my first time here, and I felt very at home, and got a significant amount of work done. 

The only reason it isn't 5 stars is bc/ they have a serious bug issue on their window. It's a bit gross & it is distracting when I'm trying to read (& as a student I like to look outside to remind me there is more than reading) 

Nonetheless the cashier/barista was friendly & it was a nice smooth atmosphere. Will definitely go back, but I won't sit by the window!!!
author: Adriana B.

description: Best coffee in the city! There are always beans from several sources around the world roasted to different levels.  I'm a black coffee drinker (and the occasional americano), so I can't speak to how their espresso / milk drinks are, but Contraband has, by far, the best coffee I've had in the city.
author: Bryan G.

description:
There are a lot of coffee shops in SF but this one is by far the best. I've not had this  kind of goodness since living in Switzerland. So, I have been coming here for about eight months now: I've brought dates, applied to grad school and stayed probably far too long each time  (is it 1 drink per 2 hours?!) Yes, you need to pay a little more for good stuff but I've seen the staff giving free lessons/tutorials about coffee etc. so you can see all of the effort that goes in. You might make some new friends too, win.

The owner has taken great care in the ambiance: so much good music, that I think is chosen by each worker. He has rotating art shows on the walls; paintings are always unique and interesting. Ample seating, easy to use lap tops and it's really great to sit at the window and watch people walk by (like looking at the glass tank in the aquarium.) The owner is pretty much always in his shop, making sure everything runs smoothly.

I like that he has staff that know how to make great coffee.  I don't like big chain coffee joints, I like to go to a place where "everybody knows your name."  It's a nice touch when my drink has a special design on it, Starbucks doesn't give me that kind of lovin.

Food selection has just changed recently. He's still got a selection of savory empanadas (my favorites are the sweet beef and mushroom gorgonzola) and Dynamo Donuts. Newest additions are the pear spice bread, rosemary oatmeal bread and a lavender shortbread cookie - all of which are excellent. 

I hope the owner of this shop wakes up in the morning and feels that he has accomplished something truly amazing. I love you.

This is my place, go try it!!
author: J C.

description: My latte was like, $4, which, I've just come to expect of good espresso drinks in the city, but still, my heart always stops a little bit when I shell out that much money for a drink. The latte was really good, though, so no complaints on quality. Note for the newbies: they don't do "sizes" here, I guess it's just based on how many shots of espresso, etc. The staff were nice enough, definitely not a "go out of your way to make you feel welcome" type crowd, but also not totally unapproachable or snobby either. Came here on a crowded weekend morning, and there were barely any spots to sit at which had outlets, which is always annoying. So, overall, not a bad spot if you're just looking for a really good cup of coffee or espresso on the go, but probably not the best spot to sit and do work for a while (for that, check out Another Cafe, that's my go to study spot...wait, on second thought...please don't check it out, I don't want it to get too crowded...).
author: Jennifer M.

description: This spot is just delightful.  Excellent coffee without having the anxiety that comes with not wearing skinny jeans in some of the more delicious coffee establishments.
author: ellyk E.

description: Clean, comfortable, with kick-ass coffee.  Finally there's a coffee place in walking distance of Nob Hill that doesn't make me want to cry.
author: Soren T.

description: Loved the cappuccino I got here, but also wasn't too impressed by their teas.  On the other hand, Contraband has free wi-fi and a moderate amount of tables/chairs.  It is a small coffee shop, but I never found it too crowded either. Definitely will be returning!
author: Viv J.

description: Fantastic!  Great chai latte.  Happy they serve Dynamo Donuts, when available!  Great atmosphere, funky wall art, and really great customer service.  Even their regulars are super nice.  One regular customer was sweet enough to hand me a lid for my latte!
author: Ny H.

description: This review is long overdue.  Awesome coffee and selection, cool owners and staff, and great atmosphere.  This place has improved the entire neighborhood.  Keep it up guys!
author: Jesse G.

description: Was recently here with some GF's and enjoyed myself. Its a cute quiet little place but a great place for you and your buddies. We laughed loudly, ordered coffee and pastries, which were very yum. The only reason I give it a 4 is because the parking situation sucks big time. Save yourself the hassle and take public transportation.
author: M G.

description: Nice, clean, well lighted place with art on the walls. It was my first visit there, and was impressed with the fact that they hand brewed my cup of coffee. I took off one star because I wasn't blown away by the flavor of my cup of decaf, but still, it was a quality experience. I will definitely be back for more!
author: Jeannie P.

description: Pretty good coffee, but I didn't think it was great. It has plenty of room to sit and free wifi, so I'd definitely recommend a visit if you live nearby
author: Michael C.

description: nice table and chair layout, but stay away from the electronic free portion of the coffee bar.  they are strict.  latte foam nice, milky latte though.
author: Rob C.

description: Excellent atmosphere, excellent service, and a fantastic drip Ethiopian yergacheffe.  I'd come back here in a second.
author: Dan S.

description: The Best Coffee ever in their brand new site.  No more chasing them around at special events.  Contraband is so new they aren't officially open yet, but starting 8am, thurs dec 16 only,  FREE COFFEE.  The wonderful owners make the beans themselves. San Franciscans expect no less. What's not to love.
author: Lynn F.

description:
As good as it gets. 
I have lived two blocks up from here for 15 years and was never thrilled with the coffee scene nearby at all. I agree with someone else who said it is too bad Barleycorn had to perish to give rise to Contraband, but at least there is something truly worthy to fill the empty void left behind (thanks again, Luisa). 
The coffee is simply divine. In my opinion it beats Blue Bottle. It is like drinking a light chocolate - perfectly smooth, velvety bliss with all the nuances you could muster up to describe the complexities (I never knew you could describe coffee like an oenophile describes wine but now I know how this is possible). 
Contraband is absolutely my new weekend coffee spot. Nothing will likely ding a star for the review because the coffee is so stunningly awesome, however it would be nice if service could be sped up a bit. It's nice that each drink, including drip coffee is made to order, but wait times can be excessive as a result. I think they'll get this worked out eventually, but for me it's worth the wait and it appears to be for a lot of other people as well.
author: Matt H.

description: These guys know their coffee, and they love it too. I do not believe I have ever seen a baristo take so much care to make a cup of drip coffee. Their varied selection is daunting if you're not accustomed to the fine points of coffee (as I am not). Definitely stop in if you're in the area to get your mind blown with some brew
author: Jay L.

description: Been  here a few times now. It's small and cozy but they always seem to have a seat. Tried the drips and a Gibraltar. So far...very good. Great place to relax and chat with friends. A couple of convenient tables out front when the weather's nice and you want to chill in an unassuming neighbourhood.
author: Johnny O.

description: Good coffee, and quite a selection of it. Great atmosphere; you can come and study or come with friends. Good selection of local food. Mellow, knowledgeable staff. $3.50 for a latte, single cup drip varies by coffee -- reasonable. I just moved to the city and have been to Ritual and Four Barrel already, this is of the same caliber.
author: Kalyn B.

description: I've been a regular for a few weeks.  The coffee drinks are great.  Interesting/functional interior.  To get five stars from me, they should sweep and clean a little better.  I will follow up at a later date.
author: Simons C.

description: Love love love Contraband coffee. We always order nonfat lattes to go. The place is always busy on the weekends.
author: Kimberly S.

description: A solid little cafe with good beans, good friendly baristas and a good vibe, in a neighborhood that badly needs a decent cafe.
author: sean s.

description: Got a plain black coffee and it was delicious.  You can always tell the good coffee places by thier coffee of the day.  I will be back!
author: Rob E.

description: Best soy latte in SF hands down! Never disappoints and dangerously close to my work. I often send clients their way and they never fail to come back and thank me for pointing them in the direction of this gem.
author: Lisa S.

description: Came here after my boyfriend had their Bali drip yesterday--- he liked it so much he brought me back. I had the Scoutmob deal, so I asked for a Kone of the Burundi ($7), and they charged me for a drip which I didn't pick up on at first, but then when only one cup of coffee came out, and they realized I had asked for a kone, they made me a 2nd cup of coffee on the house (don't do this intentionally, its evil)--- they are such nice people! The location is awesome, outdoor seating, and freaking amazing coffee! I RARELY drink my coffee black- but, well, that's how I'm drinking it now. Get over here!
author: Amanda S.

description: This place has some strong but good coffee!! They have great teas to choose from as well. When your tea is seeping, thy give u a hourglass timer which depending on the tea/timer help seep ur to perfection. The only drawback is I'm a fan more of the foo foo drinks and all they make eside coffee, expresso and lattes was a mocha.
author: Bettina L.

description: My optometrist recommended Contraband to me after an appointment, and I so glad she did. This is seriously one of my favorite new coffee shops. Not only are the espresso drinks fantastic, but I love the quiet atmosphere where I can sit and read or get work done.
author: Saad A.

description: Great spot to enjoy a latte while working on your laptop with free WIFI. Love the vibe.
author: Amy A.

description: Don't have to drive to Ritual coffee anymore.
author: Jonathan E.

description: Cookies are great, and so are the empanada.  Had the costa rica blend which was okay.  Other than that, this place has a cool vibe and a great playlist.  Good place to work!
author: Francis L.

description: Yay for their coffee! Yay for their pastries! I once tried one of their red wine-infused chocolate brownies and, despite sounding like something I'd absolutely hate, it was actually surprisingly tasty. Insofar as general decor, coffee quality, and staff, it's uber hipster (minus the attitude), which... let's face it... when it comes to this kind of thing, is a darn good sign. Definitely a weekend staple.
author: G. J.

description:
Worth the ten minute walk to get here. Nice seating inside and out, especially on a sunny day. 

This is place makes top-notch pour over drip coffee. Second-best in the city for me. They don't grind beans until you order it and make it a mug at at time. 

Their caps are great, their espressos are excellent. A (tea snob) friend that was with me on one occasion loved their tea. I can't speak to the rest of the drink menu.

Super good pastries. 

The workers here are very friendly. The owner is awesome.

What else can I say? Loving it so far.
author: Kristopher R.

description:
Yes, this place has very good one cup at a time made coffee,  very smooth,  but not as strong as Blue Bottle.  I had an Empanada and pastry, both heated up and both very fresh and tasty.  The setting is mostly 2 large bars with seats on both sides, bright and airy. Nice staff too.  Right now it is cash only, but I was told the owner is working on getting set up for debit/credit cards.  I will definitely return, especially when they start accepting debit/credit cards.  



B.
author: Bernie B.

description: Love this place. Fantastic coffee, great selection, and wonderful employees. Great neighborhood feel. The place has been open only a short time but already seems to be filled with regulars.
author: Galen D.

description: I waited eagerly for this place to open-we need a good coffee house in this stretch of Polk/Nob Hill. Today I finally made it inside. Man, was I impressed! I ordered a soy mocha and can not stop thinking about it! Most soy mochas taste cloyingly sweet with the soy/chocolate masking the coffee. Not here! The coffee flavor was strong and extremely flavorful with various underlying flavors and accents. The soy milk added a just the right amount of sweetness to the mocha. I'm really impressed and look forward to bringing my family and bf here this coming weekend.
author: Timoteo K.

description: I don't know why, but their iced black coffee is the most addictive thing ever.
author: Ryan G.

description: Contraband is underrated; their coffee is the best in the city! only blue bottle and ritual compete but contraband is slightly better! Also, try the liege waffles with some honey on top :)
author: Julie O.

description: The food and coffee is good, and the space is pretty and modern and clean.
author: Rain R.

description: Extremely rude bartender, coffee was nothing special and kind of cold. Go to starbucks and save yourself a buck, unless you want to be treated like a moron by a dude who did not finish high school.
author: Nick S.

description:
Contraband is really good.  It is the first quality coffee shop I have been to in the neighborhood.  I used to always have to walk down to Blue Bottle in Mint Plaza to get coffee but not any more!  In fact, I enjoy Contraband more than Blue Bottle.  

Right now I think I would rate my top three as:
#1 Contraband
#2 Four Barrel
#3 Blue Bottle

Of course Ritual Roasters belongs in the list also but I said top three so had to make a choice. 

I have had soy lattes/caps and drip coffee and they were all amazing.  I have also had several of the savory snacks they have and they were great also.   I have not tried using my laptop there yet so I cannot comment on that but I do see people in there using their computers regularly so it must be OK.

I highly recommend Contraband.   As mentioned before it is still very new and so things may have been a bit bumpy right at first but the quality of the place is worth any of the minor hiccups I have witnessed due to being new.
author: James S.

description: Although a tad on the pricey side, the coffee was quite delicious.   They had a unique flavor of donut: bacon-maple!   I didn't try it, but my fiance said it was awesome.   I got a piece of apple coffee cake that was surprisingly enormous but unfortunately on the stale side.
author: Charlotte A.

description: This place has a great vibe, great interior design, and great coffee. My only complaint is the tea is WAY to expensive. $3 for a small cup they don't even fill up all the way! That's why I only gave them 4 stars.
author: Nicole F.

description: Loved it! Got to taste test some new blends there Saturday. Owners know their stuff!
author: Caitlin S.

description: The staff was helpful, patient, and friendly. I also liked the brightness of the space. I like the feeling in there and it's a quiet place to work but there aren't a ton of outlets for the computer. Also, I ordered banana bread and it was stale. The food selection was pretty drab in general. I'd go again for a cup of coffee and a small amount of work, that's about it.
author: Eliz M.

description: This place is incredible.  Best latte I've ever had, fantastic decor - -very bright, inviting, and modern - - free wifi, outlets - an incredibly friendly staff, and here's the best part - - a lot of coffee bars sell muffins and croissants, but this gem sells NUCHA EMPANADAS.  Not to be missed, these Argentinian pocket sandwiches are to die for.  With such varieties as beef, mushroom, corn, tuna, spinach and even a delicious variety of breakfast empanadas, CONTRABAND COFFEE has just become MY San Francisco destination.
author: Glenn G.

description: I really like this place. Pretty good music, decent noise level, friendly staff and good beverages. There are only a few outlets for computers but the there is a lot of good table space. WiFi is free and pretty reliable thus far :) Overall I likes!
author: SF M.

description: a cup of coffee and  cup of tea are $8.15.  guy making coffee is a  pretentious asshat  who simultaneously  thinks he is the world's expert on coffee and tea while serving it luke warm  and  so slowly  he forgets who ordered what.  obviously his brain  is too busy imagining how awesome he is to actually be good at his job,  or  service oriented. puerh tea  was below average  blend.  sidewalk  seating looks like they put  about 3  minutes  and $25  into the design.  uncomfortable,  smelly,  noisy,  no green space of any kind ( would it kill you to plant a  tree or a couple flowers WTF)?  baked goods were dried out and uninspired.  girl behind the counter seemed to  think sugar inside a waffle is  "amazing"  like landing on the moon or climbing Everest.  it's a waffle.  with sugar.  lame food,  lame  drinks,  lame atmosphere,  lame service.  two stars for  people watching overdressed couples try to  parallel park their Lexus.
author: Mulberry S.

description: They've fixed the pace of service, the confusion over baked goods and now take cards and not just cash. Well done Contraband. Well done.
author: Jen R.

description: Found this place by checking on yelp and it holds up to the reviews. I ordered a mocha for myself and a Guatemalan dark for my husband. We were nothing but very impressed and enjoyed our coffees.
author: Yvette B.

description: My neighborhood coffee shop, so happy to have it around. Great coffee, great service, free wi-fi. I love their empanadas, but most of them are gone by 10-11, wish they had more of them! They offer rewards program, so after 10 coffees you get 1 free.
author: Svetlana R.

description: II have been in this hood the tender nobb that is and I have wished for many things in the neighborhood. Since last year one of my wishes came true we have a really great coffee shop. I work in a small shop so when I have a meeting contraband is my office. The staff is so nice and makes the best latte sometimes with a heart in the foam even when the hearts not there I still feel the love.
author: Jubilee M.

description: Stopped by to check out this place yesterday. While I'm not a coffee drinker, they made me an great cup of tea. My cousin who is a bit of a coffee snob ordered an espresso and claimed that it was up there with some of the best in the city. Good vibe going on. They've done a nice job on the layout and make you feel comfortable.
author: Dean C.

description: This place has always intrigued me, so i stopped by today.  Great coffee, good ambiance.  Actually decent parking so I got my work done, ate a empanada, and then went and enjoyed the sunshine.  Totally brightened my day.
author: Tiffany L.

description: here's why contraband is my favorite cafe.  they give you excellent coffee without the snobby attitude found in some other places.  they've created a great environment to meet up with friends or to sit for hours on the fast wifi.  the outdoor seating soaks up the sun.  they have good little snacks to keep your blood sugar levels from going haywire, i especially enjoy the empanadas.  the owners are local, friendly, and driven to provide an excellent experience for their customers.
author: Rob P.

description: alas, an awesome, non-chain coffee shop in my 'hood!  came here and tried the latte and its creamy deliciousness.  added plus is they have peasant pies, empanadas, and dynamo donuts!
author: Helen T.

description: Honestly, this place is the best.  Love the staff, tea/coffee, pastries (so tempting every time), vibe, and music.  And they always have fresh flowers, which is a nice little touch.
author: Molly C.

description: its been said before...but GREAT coffee and owners/staff are soooo friendly.  you can really feel good about supporting a place like this, you know?
author: Christy C.

description: great americano, free wifi and also pastries from mission beach cafe (another fave of mine), and on my way to my shuttle stop!
author: Jemma L.

description: I'm so happy a good coffee shop is finally in my neighborhood. Their coffee is awesome and they roast their own beans. I really like the yirgacheffe Ethiopian blend. The atmosphere is comfortable and there is free wifi. The only thing that is missing for me is a little better food selection.
author: Rachel B.

description: Supremely disappointed with this shop, which has so much potential. Mainly, the barista with the mustache is rude. He doesn't greet customers when they enter the shop. He was unwilling to clarify for me what an item on the menu was, and when I pressed him, he was dismissive. He apparently always feels it necessary to inform me when the shop is closing (8:30), even though I arrive at 4:00pm (which translates to make sure you get out of here when I'm ready to leave). He also closes down drip coffees at 4:00, and he was out of all green teas (which is out of his control, I'm sure, but having to change my order multiple times because the vendor cannot accommodate for something on the menu is a terrible customer experience). All in all, this is a nice local shop with good coffees and convenient wifi, but I refuse to go back while this man works there because he makes the experience so unpleasant.
author: Stewart M.

description: coffee great, food good, tattoed coffee snob was a real bummer
author: Aaron D.

description: Good to see a locally-owned joint take over the old John Barleycorn space. The inside was welcoming, nicely-lit and clean. And the staff takes their coffee to an almost fanatical-like plateau of gourmet worship. I chatted with the owner Josh, and he gave us some small free tastings of their Bali grown espresso- it tingled my toes and rought back my re-occuring heart murmur. Contraband definitley knows their stuff and I will be coming ASAP to see what else they will be brewing up for me on a bleary-eyed morning before work. A great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Gregory G.

description: So excited for this addition to the neighborhood!  Best coffee in SF.  Hands down.  Worth walking a few extra blocks to the offbeat location.
author: A. P.

description: im so glad that contraband opened up. nobhill needed some good coffee. im happy that i have a new secret coffee spot to study & meet friends. the coffee is deliciously made! definitely worth your time & money.
author: Ray O.

description: Decent.  Very good.  Outdoor seating rocks!  I really like this place, I just can get over the fact that the single brew coffee doesn't have that aerated texture that Philz does.....
author: The P.

description: Love the coffee and the employees at Contraband.  Super nice and great service.  Finally a fab place on Larkin!!
author: ivan i.

description: amazing coffee! better than blue bottle in my opinion.
author: Marie L.

description: i am so foreign to this place since it's off the beaten path from where i live.  fortunately, i took the day off to work on a paper and decided to tackle the gym before i tackled my paper.  thanks to scoutmob i found this place near 24hr fitness on vanness.  after sweating it out at the gym, i decided to venture to contraband with my iphone at hand.  i walked in and was met by a friendly barista. he asked me if i had any questions.  perhaps it was the deer in the headlights look on my face that prompted his inquiry?  i have to say it was a bit jarring to walk in that place with its individualized coffee ordering system.  all i wanted was coffee but there were so many to choose from!  that said, i had them choose for me and i had the guatemalan drip coffee coupled with bacon and egg empanada and a choc chip cookie for later.  i was pleasantly happy with my coffee. it had a nice rich flavor to it that tasted like a deep dark roast.  unfortunately, the empanada was less than desirable.  the cookie on the otherhand is amazeballs.  in fact, i'm having at the moment during my break from my research paper.  overall, contraband was a nice excuse away from homemade peets coffee this morning.  overall experience is positive:  the service was fantastic, the environment is very modern yet cozy.  i would definitely return if i were ever back in that area...unfortunately, parking isn't that great if i were to venture out in the weekend.
author: ismael d.
